      • createLocalRefGroup

        public LocalRefGroup createLocalRefGroup(java.lang.String name)
        Create a new LocalRefGroup. This group must be then added to the list retrieved via a getLocalRefGroups.
        Throws a T24IllegalArgumentException if this fields is not a group of Local References (see LocalRefField.isGroup()())
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the local references. (See LOCAL.REF.TABLE)
        Returns:
        LocalRefGroup -

      • getAccountOfficer

        public TField getAccountOfficer()
        Returns the AccountOfficer

        Field description: This field identifies the account officer responsible for the relationship with the client for whom the transaction has been opened/confirmed/advised. This information will be used by the Management Information System (MIS) for the determination of the Customer Profitability Analysis. This field has been provided to enable the user to override at transaction level the client default account officer defined in the CUSTOMER file. For Import L/C's the client is defined as the Applicant of the L/C. For Export L/C's the client is defined as the Issuing/Opening bank. Validation Rules: 1-4 digit numeric field. (Optional input; Default value = Account Officer specified on the clients CUSTOMER file.) The Account Officer code must appear on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AccountOfficer

      • getAccrualParam

        public TField getAccrualParam()
        Returns the AccrualParam

        Field description: Determines whether the value date or maturity date or both need to be considered for commission calculation. Accepts valid record ID from EB.ACCRUAL.PARAM table. Validations:

        Applicable only when COMM.RATE or FIXED.COMM.AMT is defined.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AccrualParam

      • getAckAcptAmount

        public TField getAckAcptAmount()
        Returns the AckAcptAmount

        Field description: This field holds the amount Acknowledged/Accepted, when an inward MT410/MT412 (as held in Tag32) is processed. The value held here is for information purpose only. Validation Rules: This is a system maintained field. Standard amount field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AckAcptAmount

      • getAckChgClaim

        public TField getAckChgClaim()
        Returns the AckChgClaim

        Field description: This field allows input of currency and amount of charges to be claimed by the Sender. The field will be mapped against the Tag 32a for Outward and Inward MT730 messages. If EUR 120 were to be claimed as charges, the input may either be EUR120 or 100.120, where 100 represents the ID of EUR in the NUMERIC.CURRENCY table. Validation Rules: 3 character (uppercase alpha) - type SSS, or 1-3 numeric character for a valid currency code. When Numeric code is used for the currency, the '.' delimiter is mandatory. 1-14 characters plus a decimal point (standard amount format) - type AMT to represent the amount. The Numeric Currency Code must be an existing code on the NUMERIC.CURRENCY table.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AckChgClaim

      • getActivityCode

        public TField getActivityCode()
        Returns the ActivityCode

        Field description: System maintained field. This field holds the activity number, which is triggered by the latest activity in the life-cycle of the transaction. The activity is 4 digit number composed of three main parts: First indicates the operation 1 - Represents O or P; operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT 2 - Represents A, C or T; operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT 3 - Represents Sight Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS 4 - Represents Usance Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS Second indicates the type of instrument 1 - Represents Outward Collection 2 - Represents Inward Collection 4 - Represents Export Letter of Credit 8 - Represents Import Letter of Credit And the last two digit indicate the detail activity related to that operation. For example : For the L/C Import Issuing activity, the first digit will be 1. The second digit will be 8 and the last two digits will be 01 (to indicate basic INPUT/AUTHORIZE operation). Thus, the activity for L/C import issuing will be LC-1801. The complete list of activity codes can be found in User's Manual.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ActivityCode

      • getAddAmtCovered

        public List<TField> getAddAmtCovered()
        Returns the collection of AddAmtCovered

        Field description: Used to specify any additional amounts covered by this LC, i.e. charges, transportation costs, etc. Used only for the production of LC documents and advices, to specify any additional amounts that are covered by this LC (as described in S.W.I.F.T. MT700 field no. 39c) Validation Rules: Multivalue field of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getAddAmtCovered

        public TField getAddAmtCovered(int idx)
        Returns the AddAmtCovered at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Used to specify any additional amounts covered by this LC, i.e. charges, transportation costs, etc. Used only for the production of LC documents and advices, to specify any additional amounts that are covered by this LC (as described in S.W.I.F.T. MT700 field no. 39c) Validation Rules: Multivalue field of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getAdditionlConds

        public List<TField> getAdditionlConds()
        Returns the collection of AdditionlConds

        Field description: This field can be used to provide a description of additional conditions that are not detailed elsewhere. The contents of this field may be printed on messages and advices generated by the system. This field represents 47A for LC Issuance. When used to create an amendment message using Operation A, any modification to this field identify that the additional conditions of the LC contract is amended. The additional conditions details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 47B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 47B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both ADDITIONL.CONDS and CLAUSES.TXT, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getAdditionlConds

        public TField getAdditionlConds(int idx)
        Returns the AdditionlConds at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: This field can be used to provide a description of additional conditions that are not detailed elsewhere. The contents of this field may be printed on messages and advices generated by the system. This field represents 47A for LC Issuance. When used to create an amendment message using Operation A, any modification to this field identify that the additional conditions of the LC contract is amended. The additional conditions details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 47B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 47B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both ADDITIONL.CONDS and CLAUSES.TXT, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getAdvBkConfirm

        Returns the AdvBkConfirm

        Field description: Reserved for export LC during 'IO' stage in Internet Banking for LC

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdvBkConfirm

      • getAdviceExpiryDate

        public TField getAdviceExpiryDate()
        Returns the AdviceExpiryDate

        Field description: This field specifies the date that a letter of credit expires from the beneficiary's point of view. This will usually be a number of working days before the EXPIRY.DATE. Charge calculation and customer advices will be using this field whereas accounting, limit updates will still be taking place on EXPIRY.DATE. Validation Rules: Standard T24 date format. Optional input field. (Default EXPIRY.DATE) Must be less than or equal to EXPIRY.DATE. If Presentation days and Lastest shipment date is defined, advice expiry date will be calculated based on Lastest shipment date plus Presentation Days for import LC's.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdviceExpiryDate

      • getAdviseThru

        public List<TField> getAdviseThru()
        Returns the collection of AdviseThru

        Field description: Used to identify the bank (which is not a customer of the bank) which is assigned to act as the intermediary between the advising bank of a Letter of Credit/ Collecting Bank or a Documentary Collection and the beneficiary/drawee. If an intermediary between the advising bank/collecting bank and the beneficiary is required, but the intermediary chosen is not a customer of the bank, then this field allows the input of a free format name and address of the chosen bank. It will be used to route all documents/advices for advising/presenting to the beneficiary/drawee. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO is entered.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getAdviseThru

        public TField getAdviseThru(int idx)
        Returns the AdviseThru at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Used to identify the bank (which is not a customer of the bank) which is assigned to act as the intermediary between the advising bank of a Letter of Credit/ Collecting Bank or a Documentary Collection and the beneficiary/drawee. If an intermediary between the advising bank/collecting bank and the beneficiary is required, but the intermediary chosen is not a customer of the bank, then this field allows the input of a free format name and address of the chosen bank. It will be used to route all documents/advices for advising/presenting to the beneficiary/drawee. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO is entered.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getAdviseThruAcc

        public TField getAdviseThruAcc()
        Returns the AdviseThruAcc

        Field description: Optional input. Identifies the account of the advise-thru bank, if there is an account relationship. For Export/Advising LC'/Collections, if an account relationship exists between the bank and the advise thru bank, and this account is to be used to route payments to the beneficiary of the LC, then the account is entered here. Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Must be a valid account that belongs to the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdviseThruAcc

      • getAdviseThruCustno

        public TField getAdviseThruCustno()
        Returns the AdviseThruCustno

        Field description: This field identifies the bank who is designated to act as an intermediary between the advising bank of a letter of credit and the beneficiary or the collecting bank of a documentary collection and the drawee. Input into this field is conditional upon the party in question holding a valid customer.no with the bank. This field is required for letters of credit and collections if the advising/collecting bank does not have a direct relationship with the beneficiary/drawee. It identifies the bank through which documents/advices are to be routed for advice/presentation to the beneficiary/drawee. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). For Import/Opening LCs/Outward Collection, cannot be the same as the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO or the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO. For Export/Advising LCs/Inward Collection, cannot be the same as the ISSUING.BANK.NO or the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdviseThruCustno

      • getAdviseThurRef

        public TField getAdviseThurRef()
        Returns the AdviseThurRef

        Field description: This field is used to identify the Advise thru bank's reference number. Validation Rules: Optional Input

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdviseThurRef

      • getAdvisingBk

        public List<TField> getAdvisingBk()
        Returns the collection of AdvisingBk

        Field description: For Import Letters of Credit this field identifies the name and address of the advising bank. For Inward Documentary Collections this field identifies the name and address of the Remitting Bank. This field is mandatory if the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO. has not been input. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getAdvisingBk

        public TField getAdvisingBk(int idx)
        Returns the AdvisingBk at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: For Import Letters of Credit this field identifies the name and address of the advising bank. For Inward Documentary Collections this field identifies the name and address of the Remitting Bank. This field is mandatory if the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO. has not been input. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getAdvisingBkAcc

        public TField getAdvisingBkAcc()
        Returns the AdvisingBkAcc

        Field description: Optional input for Import Letters of Credit. Identifies the account number of the Advising bank to be used as the default payment account. Input is allowed only if the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO is set. Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Not allowed for Export/Advising LCs. Must be a valid Account.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdvisingBkAcc

      • getAdvisingBkCustno

        public TField getAdvisingBkCustno()
        Returns the AdvisingBkCustno

        Field description: This field is mandatory for Import Letter of Credits and contains the customer number or mnemonic of the advising bank. For Inward Documentary Collections this field contains the customer number or mnemonic of the Remitting Bank. When a child LC is created from an Export transfer type of Letter of Credit, this field identifies the name and address of the bank that receives the outward MT720. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.') Must exist on the CUSTOMER file. Not allowed for Export Letters of Credit except those opened through Inward MT710 or Outward Documentary Collections.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdvisingBkCustno

      • getAdvisingDate

        public TField getAdvisingDate()
        Returns the AdvisingDate

        Field description: Date of advising of the Export LC(Applicable only for Export LCs). For Periodic Commission calculation of Export LCs, if the Bank opts to collect commission from the Advising date, this field is used as the start date for commission calculation. Defaulted to the date on which LC is advised. System maintained field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AdvisingDate

      • getAmendNo

        public TField getAmendNo()
        Returns the AmendNo

        Field description: This field accepts the Amendment Number, on which the decision has received. The order of input need not be sequential or in any pattern. The number is the amendment number of the LC Amendment. Once input and committed, until the Amendment is authorised, the field does not open up. This field should allow user to input values from 1 to 999 when an operation D is performed for an existing bene consent amendment. Input, only during Operation 'D'. Validation Rules: (1) MANDATORY INPUT, when Operation is 'D'. (2) Input must be the number after the alphabet A of the LC.AMENDMENTS ID. Example: If LC.AMENDMENTS ID is TF0007500001A01 , then AMEND.NO must 01. (3) The Amendment must have status as PENDING. This field specifies the amendment number of the Documentary credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AmendNo

      • getAmendStatus

        public TField getAmendStatus()
        Returns the AmendStatus

        Field description: This field is used to input the Decision text, on the Amendment with number entered in the previous field AMEND.NO. This signifies the Beneficiary consent on the Amendment. When the value input is APPROVED and LIMIT.UPDATE holds the value YES the second limit line is appended to the first. The decision APPROVED is irrevocable even at the INAU status. The opposite is possible Validation Rules: Valid Inputs are APPROVED or REJECTED. Once APPROVED cannot be REJECTED even at INAU. If there is an AMEND.NO this is MANDATORY.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AmendStatus

      • getAmendmentDel

        public TField getAmendmentDel()
        Returns the AmendmentDel

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether the amendment is internal of external. 'Yes' indicates that this amendment is external and will be communicated to third parties using messages and documents sent via the Delivery application. 'No' indicates that this amendment is internal and will not be communicated to the third parties to the contract. Validation Rules: Optional input. Following values allowed: Yes - send delivery messages. This is an external amendment. No - do not send delivery messages. This is an internal amendment. Input only permitted if OPERATION.CODE is A for amendment.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AmendmentDel

      • getAmendmentDte

        public TField getAmendmentDte()
        Returns the AmendmentDte

        Field description: This field displays the date of the last external amendment. This field specifies the date on which the issuing bank considers the documentary credit as being amended. This represents Tag30 of MT707. Backdated date is acceptable under this field. In case, the swift message extends to MT708's, amendment date from tag30 of MT707 to be replicated in MT708 message type. For Import LC, it is a system-generated field. System date is auto picked as the date of amendment for issuance of MT707. For Export LC, this is an inputable field, where date of amendment under tag 30 mentioned in the inward MT707 received from the issuing bank to be inputted (Date of advising the amendment to second advising bank should not be considered). Validation Rules: Mandatory Field Format Specification YYMMDD Amendment date cannot be greater than todays date. Amendment date cannot be lesser than Issue date of the credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AmendmentDte

      • getAmendmentNo

        public TField getAmendmentNo()
        Returns the AmendmentNo

        Field description: System maintained field for Import Letter of Credit and Input field for Exports. This field displays the number of external amendments made to this letter of credit. Amendments (OPERATION.CODE of A) are classified as internal or external depending on the value input in the AMENDMENT.DEL field. Third parties are informed of external amendments. For each external amendment made, this field will be automatically incremented by 1. In the case of Export Letter of Credit, the user has the option to input the same. It can then be used in advices and documents sent to third parties to ensure that all are aware of each modification made to the LC. This field is used in SWIFT message MT707 field 26 Number of Amendment. Validation Rules: This is a NO-INPUT, system maintained field for Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AmendmentNo

      • getAmendments

        public TField getAmendments(int idx)
        Returns the Amendments at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: This free format field is used to describe amendments to the transaction, other than Amount/CCY/Maturity date, which can be amended in their specific fields. Validation Rules: 6 x 35 type S (Swift Standard Format).

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getApplRuleCodes

        public TField getApplRuleCodes()
        Returns the ApplRuleCodes

        Field description: This field specifies the rules the credit is subject to.Following values can be inputUCP LATEST VERSION,EUCP LATEST VERSION,UCPURR LATEST VERSION,EUCPURR LATEST VERSION,ISP LATEST VERSION,OTHR If OTHR is input then, the rule under which credit is subject to must be input in APPL.RULE.DESC field. For the other values, APPL.RULE.DESC will remain a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ApplRuleCodes

      • getApplRuleDesc

        public TField getApplRuleDesc()
        Returns the ApplRuleDesc

        Field description: This field specifies the rules the credit is subject to. Accepts 35 alphanumeric characters. Input to the field is mandatory only if OTHR is specified in APPL.RULE.CODES field. For the remaining values of APPLR.ULE.CODE field, This field remains NOINPUT.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ApplRuleDesc

      • getApplRuleMt740

        public TField getApplRuleMt740()

        Field description: This field specifies the rules the reimbursement is subject to. Following values can be inputURR LATEST VERSION, NOTURR. This field can be input only if field THIRD.PARTY or THIRD.PARTY.CUST.NO is input

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ApplRuleMt740

      • getApplicant

        public List<TField> getApplicant()
        Returns the collection of Applicant

        Field description: This field identifies the name and address of the Applicant / Drawee / Drawer. LETTERS OF CREDIT For Letters of Credit, this field identifies the applicant's name and address on whose behalf of a Letter of Credit is issued. Although the initial values are defaulted from the Customer file, yet they may be altered with an alternate address that the Bank may think is apt. In the case of Transferred Letter of Credit, this field holds the value of the Original Beneficiary of the Parent Letter of Credit. DOCUMENTARY COLLECTIONS For Documentary Collections, this field identifies the bank's customer's name and address i.e. Drawee (inward collection) or drawer (outward collection). Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Only allowed if APPLICANT.CUSTNO is not entered.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getApplicant

        public TField getApplicant(int idx)
        Returns the Applicant at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: This field identifies the name and address of the Applicant / Drawee / Drawer. LETTERS OF CREDIT For Letters of Credit, this field identifies the applicant's name and address on whose behalf of a Letter of Credit is issued. Although the initial values are defaulted from the Customer file, yet they may be altered with an alternate address that the Bank may think is apt. In the case of Transferred Letter of Credit, this field holds the value of the Original Beneficiary of the Parent Letter of Credit. DOCUMENTARY COLLECTIONS For Documentary Collections, this field identifies the bank's customer's name and address i.e. Drawee (inward collection) or drawer (outward collection). Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Only allowed if APPLICANT.CUSTNO is not entered.

        Parameters:

Either this field or APPLICANT field (a text description of the applicant) must be entered. For Documentary Collections this field identifies the banks customer i.e. drawee (inward collection) or drawer (outward collection). Validation Rules: Number of mnemonic of customer on CUSTOMER file. Either this field or APPLICANT is mandatory. 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.')

      • getAutoExpiry

        public TField getAutoExpiry()
        Returns the AutoExpiry

        Field description: Specifies whether LC is to be liquidated manually or automatically on EXPIRY.DATE. When set to "YES", LC will be automatically expired on EXPIRY.DATE of LC. When set to "NO", LC will be in live status even after crossing the EXPIRY.DATE and has to be manually liquidated. Validations Rules

        Valid input- YES or NO

        Default value - YES

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AutoExpiry

      • getAvailWithCustno

        public TField getAvailWithCustno()
        Returns the AvailWithCustno

        Field description: Used for the production of letter of credit messages/advices, this field identifies the bank authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit if such a bank is a customer with a valid CUSTOMER.NO. This field is not required for collections. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). (Mandatory Input) If this field is entered then AVAIL.WITH cannot be entered. Must be a valid CUSTOMER.NO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AvailWithCustno

This field is not required for collections. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. If this field is entered, then AVAIL.WITH.CUSTNO must be blank.

      • getBackToBack

        public TField getBackToBack()
        Returns the BackToBack

        Field description: Back-to-back letters of credit are related to each other usually with one acting as security for the other. T24 can help with the preparation of details by using one as the basis for generating the other. This field indicates whether a back-to-back LC is to be generated. Input is allowed in this field only if the BACK.TO.BACK field is set to YES in the LC.TYPES record of an export letter of credit. The type of the generated LC is taken from the BACK.LC.TYPE field in the LC.TYPES record. The associated import letter of credit will be generated in the IHOLD status when the record is authorised.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BackToBack

      • getBankToBank

        public TField getBankToBank(int idx)
        Returns the BankToBank at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: This field specifies additional information for the Receiver. This field represents tag72Z in the SWIFT Message type MT700. This is a freetext and allows the user to input any information apart from the those sepcified in the structured fields in the message. Validation Rules: Optional field. Max 6 lines allowed and each lines can have 35Z characters. Also, allows Z Characters when a MT700/705/707/710/720 messages are generated

        Parameters:

      • getBrokerPercent

        public TField getBrokerPercent()
        Returns the BrokerPercent

        Field description: Where present, the value in this field is used to calculate the default brokerage on all Letter of Credit Drawings for which this contract is the underlying Letter of Credit. The default brokerage amount is set to the percentage defined here of the document amount on the DRAWINGS application. Validation Rules: Standard T24 rate field. Input cannot be greater than 100%. Optional Input.

      • getBwdFwdKey

        public TField getBwdFwdKey()
        Returns the BwdFwdKey

        Field description: Identifies to which day the scheduled frequency date is to be cycled, when the scheduled date is not a working day. Options: C - Calendar, P - Previous working day, N - Next working day. Validation: Applicable only when COMM.FREQUENCY is defined.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BwdFwdKey

      • getCancelReq

        public TField getCancelReq()
        Returns the CancelReq

        Field description: This field specifies that the documentary credit is requested to be cancelled. This field represents Tag 23S when a MT707 is generated. When consent received to CANCEL the Documentary Credit, Reversal of liability entries after validation of the current contract to be manually handled. Permitted Code are: CANCEL - This is a request to cancel the instrument Validation Rules: Optional field Valid input is CANCEL Upon validation of cancellation request, System checks and throw override in the below scenarios and user needs to keep track on the expected consequences and act as per the valid business requirement. If any drawings already booked under the Documentary credit. User to keep track on the other consequence for requesting the cancellation when drawings is already booked and to act as per the valid business requirement. If any previous Amendments are already booked through LETTER.OF.CREDIT operation A, no other fields to be amended along with cancellation request except for bank-to-bank communication and charges fields. System to throw override, when amendment/drawings initiated for the cancellation request already accepted through operation D.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CancelReq

      • getCategoryCode

        public TField getCategoryCode()
        Returns the CategoryCode

        Field description: This field contains the category code to which the deal will be accounted. This information will be used for CRF and MIS reporting and will identify the product being processed. A default category code may be specified for each L/C type on the LC.TYPES file. Validation Rules: 5 numeric characters. (Optional input, default value, see details below). The category code must be defined on the CATEGORY table. The category code must relate to the LC application. Valid range is 23000-23999.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CategoryCode

      • getChargeBaseAmt

        public TField getChargeBaseAmt()
        Returns the ChargeBaseAmt

        Field description: CHARGE.BASE.AMT: While amending a Letter of Credit, when charges are allowed to default the same is calculated for the entire amount of the LC and not for the amended amount. The value input into this field enables the user to identify a portion of the Letter of Credit for which the charges are to be applied. This facility is available for operation "O" and "A" only. For Example: When a Letter of Credit is input for GBP 100,000 and then amended to GBP 150,000, the user has the option to recover charges only to the extent of the enhanced amount, which is GBP 50,000 in this case. This enhanced amount is treated as the CHARGE.BASE.AMT. If left blank, LC.AMOUNT will be used for calculating default charges, which is the existing flow. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. Input is only allowed if valid Charge/Commission code has been entered

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ChargeBaseAmt

      • getChargeCode

        public List<ChargeCodeClass> getChargeCode()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of ChargeCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<ChargeCodeClass> -

      • getChargeCode

        public ChargeCodeClass getChargeCode(int idx)
        Returns the ChargeCode at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        ChargeCodeClass -

      • getChargesAccount

        public TField getChargesAccount()
        Returns the ChargesAccount

        Field description: From G10.2.02, the charge account will be part of the charge input set. Therefore this field will be no longer use. This field identifies the account from which related charges will be taken, if any.Any valid account number can be entered in this field. If this is entered and the credit is an IMPORT contract , then all charges relating to this L/C will automatically be taken from this account whenever a charge arises during the life of the L/C. All charges for drawings under this L/C will taken from this account, on the day the charge is raised, unless value dating charges is set to yes (From the LC.PARAMETERS file), when they will be taken on the Issue date for L/Cs and the value date for drawings under this L/C. Validation Rules: Optional Input Standard Account Format. Must be a valid account.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ChargesAccount

      • getChargesDet

        public TField getChargesDet(int idx)
        Returns the ChargesDet at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: The field will be mapped against Tag 71D of Outward and Inward MT730 messages. or of MT740 When set to MT730, the valid codes are: AGENT - Agents Commission COMM - Our commission CORCOM - Our correspondent's commission DISC - Commercial discount INSUR - Insurance premium POST - Our postage STAMP - Stamp duty WAREHOUS - Wharfing and warehouse When set to MT740, the valid codes are: DISCCHGS - Discount Charges. ACCECHGS - Acceptance Charges. Any code used in this field must be between slashes and must appear at the beginning of a line. These codes must have been defined in the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS. Narrative text must not begin with a slash and, if used, must begin on a new line and be the last information in the field. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines of 35 type X (Alphanumeric) characters Allows Z characters when a MT730/740 is generated.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getChargesDet

        public List<TField> getChargesDet()
        Returns the collection of ChargesDet

        Field description: The field will be mapped against Tag 71D of Outward and Inward MT730 messages. or of MT740 When set to MT730, the valid codes are: AGENT - Agents Commission COMM - Our commission CORCOM - Our correspondent's commission DISC - Commercial discount INSUR - Insurance premium POST - Our postage STAMP - Stamp duty WAREHOUS - Wharfing and warehouse When set to MT740, the valid codes are: DISCCHGS - Discount Charges. ACCECHGS - Acceptance Charges. Any code used in this field must be between slashes and must appear at the beginning of a line. These codes must have been defined in the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS. Narrative text must not begin with a slash and, if used, must begin on a new line and be the last information in the field. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines of 35 type X (Alphanumeric) characters Allows Z characters when a MT730/740 is generated.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getChargesFrom

        public TField getChargesFrom()
        Returns the ChargesFrom

        Field description: This field displays a code to identify from whom the bank is to claim it's charges. Valid codes are: O(pener), B(eneficiary) or T(hird Party) Validation Rules: 'O', 'B', or 'T'. Default is 'O'. If 'T' is entered, then THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO or THIRD.PARTY must be present.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ChargesFrom

      • getClientRef

        public TField getClientRef()
        Returns the ClientRef

        Field description: Free text field to hold Client Reference Number. Validation Rules: 10 Alpha numeric characters characters

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ClientRef

      • getClosingDate

        public TField getClosingDate()
        Returns the ClosingDate

        Field description: Indicates the date that the LC is due to be closed, and written to the history files. If any drawings are outstanding on this date for the LC, then the LC will not be closed. The date entered here will be the date on which the LC will be closed from the books and written to the history files. This will not happen if there are outstanding drawings sent for collection, authority to Pay/Access oand Requested, term/usance deals with maturity review dates greater than this date. Validation Rules: Standard Date Format. (Default from EXPIRY.DATE + CLOSING.DAYS from LC.PARAMETERS file). Mandatory input.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ClosingDate

      • getCoCode

        public String getCoCode()
        Returns the CoCode

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the internal bank identity number.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The CoCode

      • getCollMatCode

        public TField getCollMatCode()
        Returns the CollMatCode

        Field description: In support of Option K of Tag 32a in 4** series of SWIFT for collection and to default text in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT for acceptence and deferred LC's. This works in conjunction with the DAYS field and accepts the following values. will get triggered if DAYS field has a value and DATE.ACCEPTED is left blank. The default values are ST in the case of Sight Document and BE in the case of Usance documents. The value here along with DAYS shall form the basis for field 32 of MT 400 generated from DRAWINGS under this collection. In case DATE.ACCEPTED is input, then that will be taken to form F32 of MT 400. COLL.MAT.CODE in conjuction with DAYS field will be defaulted for deferred and acceptance LC's in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT fields. This field indicates the codes available for the drafts under a collection. It can also be used under "Documentary Collections" in conjunction with DAYS field to indicate the tenor of the drafts under a collection. System allows input under this field for a documentary collection only if the TENOR field has no value. System allows input either under TENOR or COLL.MAT.CODE. Value under any one of the fields is mandatory under a usance collection. Validation Rules: Mandatory for Option K of Tag 32a in 4** series.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CollMatCode

      • getCommAccount

        public TField getCommAccount()
        Returns the CommAccount

        Field description: Account from which the commission amount is to be collected. Must be a valid account not necessarily in contract currency. Validation:

        Mandatory when commission code is defined and commission is collected.

        Input is not allowed when commission is claimed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommAccount

      • getCommAmount

        public TField getCommAmount()
        Returns the CommAmount

        Field description: Holds the commission amount for current schedule. System maintained field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommAmount

      • getCommClaimed

        public TField getCommClaimed()
        Returns the CommClaimed

        Field description: Identifies whether the commission is to be collected from the customer's account or claimed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommClaimed

      • getCommCode

        public TField getCommCode()
        Returns the CommCode

        Field description: Field to trigger the collection of periodic commission in LETTER.OF.CREDIT for an issuance and also for an amendment. Separate amendment commission code can be defined for the LC either through operation A or D. Accepts valid code from PERIODIC.COMMISSION table. If any code is defined for the LC type (with operation O, A or D) in LC.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION, then the same is defaulted in this field. However, user input takes precedence. Validations: Periodic commission is not supported for,

        Revolving LCs

        LCs issued under syndication

        Pre-advised LCs

        If no issuance commission has been taken, then amendment commission cannot be taken.

        If separate amendment commission code is not input, then the existing issuance commission will be recalculated.

        Only one amendment commission can be taken (either through operation A or D). For subsequent amendments, the same amendment commission will be recalculated. LC issuance commission accruals will remain unchanged.

        If frequency is defined for LC issuance commission, then separate amendment commission code cannot be input in the amendment.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommCode

      • getCommExchRate

        public TField getCommExchRate()
        Returns the CommExchRate

        Field description: Exchange rate to be applied between commission(contract) currency and commission account currency. If not input by the user, system to default the appropriate buy/sell rate from the currency table. Validations:

        Optional field.

        Not allowed when LC currency and commission account currency are same.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommExchRate

      • getCommFrequency

        public TField getCommFrequency()
        Returns the CommFrequency

        Field description: Determines the frequency at which the commission is to be collected or claimed. The first scheduled date must be the value date. Standard T24 frequency field. Validations:

        Only monthly frequency allowed (M01, M02, etc.)

        Not allowed when PERIODIC.COMMISSION is defined with 'For every Additional Period'.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommFrequency

      • getCommPartyChg

        public TField getCommPartyChg()
        Returns the CommPartyChg

        Field description: This field is to identify whether the commission is claimed from opener or beneficiary. Validation Rules: No change field. Option field. Options - O(Opener) or B(Beneficiary) Allowed only when commission is claimed. When commission claimed is "Yes", system defaults this field as "O".

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommPartyChg

      • getCommRate

        public TField getCommRate()
        Returns the CommRate

        Field description: Identifies the rate at which the commission has to be calculated. If the user inputs a rate in this field, then the default commission calculation will be ignored and the commission will be calculated at this rate. User input field. Validation:

        Not allowed when FIXED.COMM.AMT is INPUT.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommRate

      • getCommStartDate

        public TField getCommStartDate()
        Returns the CommStartDate

        Field description: Start date for calculation of the LC commission. Values are Advising Date, Confirmation Date, Issue Date, Aval Date. Default value for Import LC is Issue Date. Allowed value for Import LC is Issue Date only Allowed value for Import Collections is Aval Date only

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommStartDate

      • getCommTaxAmt

        Returns the CommTaxAmt

        Field description: Holds the tax component for current schedule. System maintained field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommTaxAmt

      • getConCusLink

        public TField getConCusLink()
        Returns the ConCusLink

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the CUSTOMER used for accounting and limits processing. For import Letters of Credit this will contain the APPLICANT.CUSTNO. For export Letters of Credit this will contain the ISSUING.BANK.NO. Validation Rules: This is a NO INPUT, system maintained field. Will contain a valid record on the CUSTOMER file.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConCusLink

        Field description: This field is currently not in use.

        Parameters:

        TField - The ConPartyChg

      • getConfAddlInst

        public TField getConfAddlInst()
        Returns the ConfAddlInst

        Field description: This field is used to mark against Tag 40B of MT710/720. Validation Rules: Accepts a maximum of 24 characters. Valid inputs are: Adding our Confirmation / Without our Confirmation.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfAddlInst

      • getConfLiabAmt

        public TField getConfLiabAmt()
        Returns the ConfLiabAmt

        Field description: CONF.LIAB.AMT: Identifies the total confirmed liability amount in respect of partially confirmed Letters of Credit. It represents the running total of the remaining confirmed portion of the liability amount, as the drawings are being made under this Letter of Credit. The amount will be expressed in terms of LC currency. This field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. Validation Rules: System Generated. Standard Amount format.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfLiabAmt

      • getConfirmComm

        public TField getConfirmComm()
        Returns the ConfirmComm

        Field description: This field is currently not in use.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfirmComm

      • getConfirmInst

        public TField getConfirmInst()
        Returns the ConfirmInst

        Field description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the Receiver. Only three Swift key words can be entered into this field (see Validation Rules: ) The default from the LC.TYPE file can be overwritten. Validation Rules: 7 Alphanumeric characters as specified in the Validation Rules. Defaults from the LC.TYPE parameter file. Valid codes are as follows: CONFIRM The Receiver is requested to confirm the credit. MAY ADD The Receiver may add its confirmation to the credit. WITHOUT The Receiver is not requested to confirm the credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfirmInst

      • getConfirmationAmt

        public TField getConfirmationAmt()
        Returns the ConfirmationAmt

        Field description: CONFIRMATION.AMT In a partially Confirmed Letter of Credit this field can be input with a value that represents the portion of the Letter of Credit that has been confirmed. This can be expressed in terms of percentage or amount. When input as a percentage, the CONFIRMATION.AMT will be calculated only on the LC amount without taking into account the credit tolerance or Add Covered amount if any. If a provision amount is input without CONFIRMATION.AMT, then to input the confirmation amount the provision has to be released first. But the provision and the CONFIRMATION.AMT may be input concurrently, or the provision may be taken after inputting the confirmation amount. Either way when a provision is input with a CONFIRMATION.AMT then the provision is calculated only for this value and not the LC amount. If a Drawing is done prior to inputting a value into this field, then no partial confirmation can be done for that Letter of Credit. Likewise if the LC is of a Transferable type then no partial confirmation can be done. Validation Rules: It cannot be greater than liability amount. Enabled only for export Letter of Credits.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfirmationAmt

      • getConfirmationDate

        public TField getConfirmationDate()
        Returns the ConfirmationDate

        Field description: Date of adding confirmation to the export LC. Field applicable only for export LCs. Defaulted to the current date, when LC gets confirmed System maintained field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConfirmationDate

      • getConsolKey

        public TField getConsolKey()
        Returns the ConsolKey

        Field description: System maintained field. Indicates the consolidation key which has been generated for this contract. This field will be updated by the system after its first end of day has been processed. The field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. The first four parameters will always contain the application ID (i.e. LC), the Currency Market, the Position Type, and the currency code (LC.CURRENCY). The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConsolKey

      • getContactInfo

        public List<ContactInfoClass> getContactInfo()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of ContactInfo

        Returns:
        List<ContactInfoClass> -

      • getContactInfo

        Returns the ContactInfo at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        ContactInfoClass -

      • getCreditProvisAcc

        public TField getCreditProvisAcc()
        Returns the CreditProvisAcc

        Field description: This field indicates the account where the provision needs to be credited. In can be in any currency. If not input, default will be from the LC.PARAMETERS and the credit will be in the same currency as that of the debit currency. NOTES: The provision credit account can be changed to any other account provided the currencies are the same. During change of credit provision account (in same currency), no additional amounts can be debited. If provision credit account currency needs to be changed to an account of another currency, then first the existing provision needs to be released by setting REL.PROV to "Y" under operation "A". Once the existing provision is released, the operator can take a revised provision to the debit and credit accounts of different choice. Validation Rules: Mandatory Input if Field PROVISION set to 'YES'.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CreditProvisAcc

      • getCsnCode

        public CsnCodeClass getCsnCode(int idx)
        Returns the CsnCode at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        TField - The CurrencyMarket

      • getDateAccepted

        Returns the DateAccepted

        Field description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections Only. It records the maturity date as advised by the Collecting Bank of a usance draft accepted payable by the Drawee. Validation Rules: Standard Date format only. Documentary Collection input only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DateAccepted

      • getDateTime

        public String getDateTime(int idx)
        Returns the DateTime at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the lastest date and time of input of data to the contract.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        String -

      • getDayBasis

        public TField getDayBasis()
        Returns the DayBasis

        Field description: Indicates the calculation method to be used to generate the Discount and Load amounts on the Drawing contracts related to this L/C and also for charge amortisations. The following types are acceptable:

        Key Days/Denominator
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        S Special
        W 252/252
        W1 21/252
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASIS Validation Rules: 1 type A (alphanumeric) character. Valid inputs are A, B, C, D,E, F, S,W,W1 or blank. Default Value = Interest Day Basis as specified on the Currency record for the currency of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DayBasis

      • getDays

        public TField getDays()
        Returns the Days

        Field description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections and LC. only. It is used in conjunction with the previous field 'TENOR' to indicate the tenor of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding documentary collection messages. However, this field in order to support Option K of Tag 32a, accepts "D" or "M" followed by number representing Number of Days or Number of Months. Eg. To input a draft of '120 days from the bill of lading date', the number 'D120' would be inserted in this field. The descriptive text i.e. 'days from the bill of lading date' would be inserted in the field 'TENOR'. COLL.MAT.CODE may also be input with BE in this case. COLL.MAT.CODE in conjuction with DAYS field will be defaulted for deferred and acceptance LC's in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT fields. Validation Rules: Maximum length of 4. First Character can either be D or M followed by number such as 120 or 012. Documentary Collection input only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Days

      • getDbProvAmount

        public TField getDbProvAmount()
        Returns the DbProvAmount

        Field description: System maintained field This field displays the provision amount in terms of the debit account. This will be prefixed by a minus sign to indicate the debit. As debit account and credit account can be of any two currencies, this field will indicate the amount debited in the currency of the debit account.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DbProvAmount

      • getDeferredPay

        public List<TField> getDeferredPay()
        Returns the collection of DeferredPay

        Field description: This free text field will specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC. Validation Rules: 4 x 35 alphanumeric characters. If the LC type is DP(Deferred Payment), this field is mandatory input. If the LC type is N or NS, this field is an optional field. However override raised when no value is inputted. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY DEF PAYMENT", standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC. E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getDeferredPay

        public TField getDeferredPay(int idx)
        Returns the DeferredPay at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: This free text field will specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC. Validation Rules: 4 x 35 alphanumeric characters. If the LC type is DP(Deferred Payment), this field is mandatory input. If the LC type is N or NS, this field is an optional field. However override raised when no value is inputted. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY DEF PAYMENT", standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC. E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getDeptCode

        public String getDeptCode()
        Returns the DeptCode

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the departmental ID number.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The DeptCode

      • getDescGoods

        public List<TField> getDescGoods()
        Returns the collection of DescGoods

        Field description: Used for the creation of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the description of the goods covered by the transaction. This field represents tag 45A while issuance of a LC. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this field identify that the description goods of the LC contract is amended. The description of goods can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 45B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 45B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/705/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. A maximum of 250 lines are only allowed Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getDescGoods

        public TField getDescGoods(int idx)
        Returns the DescGoods at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Used for the creation of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the description of the goods covered by the transaction. This field represents tag 45A while issuance of a LC. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this field identify that the description goods of the LC contract is amended. The description of goods can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 45B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 45B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/705/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. A maximum of 250 lines are only allowed Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getDirectCollNo

        public TField getDirectCollNo()
        Returns the DirectCollNo

        Field description: Direct Export Collection Reference. One of a series of references pre-issued for use by a customer. It is a reference which can be used with the customer ID as an alternative key to access the collection record.. The reference must be in a series assigned to the customer in the DIR.COL.ALL application. Validation Rules: The reference must be in a series assigned to the customer in the DIR.COL.ALL application. The reference must not have been used in another collection by this customer.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DirectCollNo

      • getDiscountNo

        public TField getDiscountNo()
        Returns the DiscountNo

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the total number of term or usance drawings made under the letter of credit which have been discounted. When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new term or usance drawing (drawing with type 'AC', or 'DP') that is discounted, is entered via the DRAWINGS application for this Letter of credit then this field will be incremented by 1. This provides the user with an easy reference to identify the total number of discounted drawings made against this letter of credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DiscountNo

      • getDiscountVal

        public TField getDiscountVal()
        Returns the DiscountVal

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the amount of discount made against the letter of credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DiscountVal

      • getDocsReceived

        public TField getDocsReceived()
        Returns the DocsReceived

        Field description: When an outward collection is initiated through internet banking, this field specifies if original documents have been received by the bank. When this field is set to 'Yes', only then IB.STATUS can be changed to 'Approved'. Validation Rules: Allowed values: Yes, No. User input field. Allowed only for Bank user.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DocsReceived

      • getDocumentCode

        public List<DocumentCodeClass> getDocumentCode()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of DocumentCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<DocumentCodeClass> -

      • getDocumentCode

        public DocumentCodeClass getDocumentCode(int idx)
        Returns the DocumentCode at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        DocumentCodeClass -

      • getDocumentId

        public TField getDocumentId()
        Returns the DocumentId

        Field description: This field is used to default list of documents defined in LC.ADVICE.TEXT. Validation Rules Applicable only for Import Letter of Credit Default will be based on the following combinations and order from LC.ADVICE.TEXT Applicant customer - Inco Terms - Mode of Shipment Inco Terms - Mode ot Shipment Applicant customer - Free Text Applicant customer

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DocumentId

      • getDocumentsReq

        public TField getDocumentsReq(int idx)
        Returns the DocumentsReq at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: This field contains the description of the documents to be presented by under the letter of credit. It will be included in messages/advices generated by the application. This field represents 46A for LC Issuance. The descriptions input to this field will be used in addition to the predefined documents input in the DOCUMENT.CODE field. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this narrative structured text field identify that the document required of the LC contract is amended. The document details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 46B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 46B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept x (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both DOCUMENT.TXT and DOCUMENTS.REQ, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getDocumentsReq

        public List<TField> getDocumentsReq()
        Returns the collection of DocumentsReq

        Field description: This field contains the description of the documents to be presented by under the letter of credit. It will be included in messages/advices generated by the application. This field represents 46A for LC Issuance. The descriptions input to this field will be used in addition to the predefined documents input in the DOCUMENT.CODE field. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this narrative structured text field identify that the document required of the LC contract is amended. The document details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 46B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 46B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept x (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both DOCUMENT.TXT and DOCUMENTS.REQ, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getDraftPrint

        public TField getDraftPrint()
        Returns the DraftPrint

        Field description: This fielkd is used to indicate whether a draft print of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection document created is to be produced on deal input (i.e. before the authorization stage). If set to 'Y' and the Letter of Credit is an IMPORT credit then a draft print of the letter of credit MT700 will be produced after validation. The message type used for this delivery transaction is MT9700. This preview will not be available at the authorisation stage Validation Rules: 'Y' or 'N'. Default from LC.PARAMETERS file.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DraftPrint

      • getDraftsAt

        public List<TField> getDraftsAt()
        Returns the collection of DraftsAt

        Field description: Used in the production of messages/advices, this field indicates the tenor of the draft to be presented under the Letter of Credit. Example: when a letter of credit has a tenor of 120 days sight, '120 days sight' will be entered in this field. Validation Rules: 35 alphanumeric characters. If this field is used then the Tenor field must be blank and either DRAWEE.CUST.NO or DRAWEE must have a value. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY ACCEPTANCE or BY NEGOTIATION"(Negotiation Acceptance), standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getDraftsAt

        public TField getDraftsAt(int idx)
        Returns the DraftsAt at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Used in the production of messages/advices, this field indicates the tenor of the draft to be presented under the Letter of Credit. Example: when a letter of credit has a tenor of 120 days sight, '120 days sight' will be entered in this field. Validation Rules: 35 alphanumeric characters. If this field is used then the Tenor field must be blank and either DRAWEE.CUST.NO or DRAWEE must have a value. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY ACCEPTANCE or BY NEGOTIATION"(Negotiation Acceptance), standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -
