      • getDrawee

        public List<TField> getDrawee()
        Returns the collection of Drawee

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO. Drawees Name and Address may be manually input. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A Alphanumeric characters.. If DRAFTS.AT is used, either this field or DRAWEE.CUST.NO must have a value. If this field is used, then DRAWEE.CUST.NO must be left blank. If the LC type is DP (Deferred Payment) this field must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getDrawee

        public TField getDrawee(int idx)
        Returns the Drawee at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO. Drawees Name and Address may be manually input. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A Alphanumeric characters.. If DRAFTS.AT is used, either this field or DRAWEE.CUST.NO must have a value. If this field is used, then DRAWEE.CUST.NO must be left blank. If the LC type is DP (Deferred Payment) this field must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getDraweeCustNo

        public TField getDraweeCustNo()
        Returns the DraweeCustNo

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this field identifies the name of the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z Uppercase alpha or '.'). If DRAFTS.AT is used, either this field or DRAWEEmust have a value. If this field is used, then DRAWEE must be left blank. The Customer code must be on CUSTOMER file. If the LC type is DP (Deferred Payment) this field must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DraweeCustNo

      • getDrawings

        public TField getDrawings()
        Returns the Drawings

        Field description: System maintained field. This field is used to display a running total of the amount of drawings/payments made under the contract to date. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the Letter of contract (LC.CURRENCY). When a new Letter of Credit/Documentary Collection is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new drawing is entered, this field will be updated by the amount of the drawing. A drawing on a 'collection' basis (Drawing Type CO) under a letter of credit will not be included in the total.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Drawings

      • getExpiryDate

        public TField getExpiryDate()
        Returns the ExpiryDate

        Field description: For Letters of Credit, this field details the 'Expiry Date' of the Letter of Credit in the bank's book and is not necessarily the actual Expiry Date of the Letter of Credit. On this date all CRF contingent entries and Limits will be liquidated. After this date no further drawings can be made. For term/usance drawings made under an LC, the maturity review date can be greater than this date. Care should be taken not to confuse this field with ADVICE.EXPIRY.DAT which is the actual expiry date advised to the beneficiary in the letter of credit, if different to this EXPIRY.DATE field.. For Documentary Collections, this field details the 'TRACE' date. On this date the item will be included in the 'TRACE' report, which in respect of all Collections whose fate has not been notified by the Collecting Bank. This date can be amended to meet the user's requirements. To facilitate easy input of this field, the user can enter a code indicating the number of weeks or months forward of the issue date to be used as the expiry date. This can be entered in the form of a number followed by the letter 'W' for weeks and 'M' for 'months'. For example if '3M' is entered here and the issue date entered above is '15 June 2000' then the expiry date will be calculated as '15 September 2000'. Note that if you enter "6M" and a 3-monthly charge is applied then the number of charge periods may default to 3 if the expiry date is adjusted to a working day. If this happens then you should override the number of charge periods manually. Validation Rules: Standard Date Format or Code (see above). Mandatory input. If the expiry date of a Letter of Credit exceeds the issue date by more than one year, then an override will be needed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ExpiryDate

      • getExpiryPlace

        public TField getExpiryPlace()
        Returns the ExpiryPlace

        Field description: This field is relevant to Letters of Credit only and identifies the location at which the Letter of Credit expires. Can be a 2 digit country code eg. GB or US or up to 26 free format characters identifying the place of Letter of Credit expiry. If a 2 digit code is entered, then this is checked against the COUNTRY file for enrichment. Validation Rules: 2-26 S (Uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. If 2 digits are entered then this must be a valid country code from the COUNTRY file. If more than 2 digits are entered then any location can be specified. No input required for Collection.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ExpiryPlace

      • getExtArrId

        public TField getExtArrId()
        Returns the ExtArrId

        Field description: When an external arrangement is created as a result of availing a LC using AA Facility, then the arrangement ID created is stored in this field to identify the linked external arrangement and communicate future activities to the arrangement. This is a system updated field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ExtArrId

      • getExternalReference

        public TField getExternalReference()
        Returns the ExternalReference

        Field description: This field is used to display the Issuing Bank/Handling Bank/Customer reference for use on messages and advices. For Export LCs this is the Issuing Bank's reference. For outward collections this is the Customer's reference number and for inward collections this the Remitting Bank's reference number. For Inward MT730 the field will be populated with the value in Tag20 Validation Rules: 1-16 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Input only allowed for Collections and Export Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ExternalReference

        Field description: This field specifies the final destination or place of delivery to be indicated in the transport document

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FinalDestination

      • getFixedCommAmt

        public TField getFixedCommAmt()
        Returns the FixedCommAmt

        Field description: Identifies the commission amount for each commission schedule. Amount expressed in the currency of the contract. If the user inputs a value in this field, then the default commission calculation will be ignored. User input field. Validations:

        Not allowed when COMM.RATE is input.

        Fixed commission amount must be less than LC face value.

        Input of value zero is not allowed.

        If user doesnt input any value in this field, system will default PERIODIC.COMM.AMT field of LC.GROUP.CONDITION defined for the periodic commission code in COMM.CODE field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FixedCommAmt

      • getFullyUtilised

        public TField getFullyUtilised()
        Returns the FullyUtilised

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether this transaction is fully utilised. YES - fully utilised NO - not fully utilised If this field is set to YES then any drawings will require the override of a warning message. This field will default to NO. It may be set to YES in the following circumstances. - Manually during an amendment to the LC. - If a drawing has its FULLY.UTILISED field set to YES. - Automatically if the total of all drawings exceed the LC amount. Validation Rules: Optional input. Must be YES or NO. Default is NO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FullyUtilised

Validation Rules: Allowed Values are YES or NO Value 'YES' will hit the limit at 'IO' stage in Internet Banking Value 'NO' will not hit the limit at 'IO' stage in Internet Banking Default value is 'NO'

        Returns the IbStatus

        Field description: Field to indicate the status of LC request through internet banking. "With Bank" System updated value at CIB side. If value selected is "Rejected" or "With Customer",then IB.BK.TO.CUST field is mandatory.

      • getIncoTerms

        public TField getIncoTerms()
        Returns the IncoTerms

        Field description: Holds the terms of LC contract. Validation Rules: Allowed Values are CIF stands for COST,INSURANCE AND FREIGHT CFR stands for COST AND FREIGHT FOB stands for FREE ON BOARD FCA stands for FREE CARRIER FAS stands for FREE ALONGSIDE SHIP CPT stands for CARRIAGE PAID TO CIP stands for CARRIAGE AND INSURANCE PAID TO DAF stands for DELEIVERED AT FRONTIER DDP stands for DELIEVERED DUTY PAID DDU stands for DELIVERED DUTY UNPAID DES stands for DELIVERED EX SHIP DEQ stands for DELIVERED EX QUAY EXW stands for EX WORKS

        Parameters:

      • getIssueDate

        public TField getIssueDate()
        Returns the IssueDate

        Field description: This field identifies the initial date of the contract i.e. the date the Letter of Credit is Issued/Advised/Confirmed. Can be prior to or after the deal input date. Should an unconfirmed export Letter of Credit subsequently be confirmed, this initial date will not change. All entries for contingent accounting/charges will be produced effective from this date. Validation Rules: Standard date Format. Mandatory Input (Default to Today).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IssueDate

      • getIssuingBank

        public List<TField> getIssuingBank()
        Returns the collection of IssuingBank

        Field description: This field identifies the Issuing Bank for an Export Letter of Credit and the Collecting Bank for an Outward Documentary Collection. Input is mandatory if the Bank in question is not a customer on the CUSTOMER file and the respective customer no. has not been inserted in the field ISSUING.BANK.NO. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed for Inward Documentation Collections / Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed for Inward Documentation Collections / Import Letters of Credit.

        TField -

      • getIssuingBankAcc

        public TField getIssuingBankAcc()
        Returns the IssuingBankAcc

        Field description: Optional input. Input to this field sets up the default account to be used for reimbursement from the Issuing Bank (in the case of a Export Letter of Credit) and the Collecting Bank (in the case of an Outward Documentary Collection). Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Should belong to the Issuing / Collecting Bank. Only allowed for Export Letters of Credit / Outward Documentary Collections. No input allowed for Inward Documentary Collections / Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IssuingBankAcc

      • getIssuingBankNo

        public TField getIssuingBankNo()
        Returns the IssuingBankNo

        Field description: For Export Letters of Credit, this field identifies the Issuing Bank. For Outward Documentary Collections, this field identifies the Collecting bank. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). The customer code must exist on the CUSTOMER file. No input allowed for Inward Documentary Collections / Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IssuingBankNo

      • getLatestShipment

        public TField getLatestShipment()
        Returns the LatestShipment

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this field stipulates the latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC. Validation Rules: Standard date format. Date cannot be greater than Expiry date. Input to this field is not allowed if field <SHIPMENT.PERIOD> has been used.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LatestShipment

      • getLcAmount

        public TField getLcAmount()
        Returns the LcAmount

        Field description: This field contains the amount of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection which will always be expressed in the currency defined in the previous field (LC.CURRENCY). In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. In english language text this is accomplished by using a 'T' to denote thousands, and an 'M' to denote millions. Other languages will require the provision of translation values. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T = 1,000.00, 1M = 1,000,000.00, 1B = 1,000,000,000.00 Validation Rules: 2-16 type AMT (Standard amount format) characters. (Mandatory input) The amount must be greater than zero.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LcAmount

      • getLcAmountLocal

        public TField getLcAmountLocal()
        Returns the LcAmountLocal

        Field description: System maintained field. The value in this field contains the local currency equivalent of the liability amount mentioned in field <LIABILITY.AMT.>.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LcAmountLocal

      • getLcCurrency

        public TField getLcCurrency()
        Returns the LcCurrency

        Field description: Contains the SWIFT currency code to denote the currency of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection. Will be used on all related correspondence. CRF entries are generated in this currency. Defaults to local currency. Validation Rules: SWIFT Currency code e.g. United States Dollars must be USD. (Mandatory input) Must exist on the CURRENCY file. Once the deal has been authorised, this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LcCurrency

      • getLcOrigRate

        public TField getLcOrigRate()
        Returns the LcOrigRate

        Field description: This field holds the rate between LC.CURRENCY and local currency. This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LcOrigRate

      • getLcType

        public TField getLcType()
        Returns the LcType

        Field description: Identifies the type of Trade Finance contract from the LC.TYPES file. The type will identify whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable lc etc... If the type input is a Documentary Collection, then this will impact on the processing performed, and some of the other input fields' meanings. The value entered must be a valid record on the LC.TYPES file and will be used to determine which kind of processing is required for the various combinations of Import/Confirmed/Usance etc. Validation Rules: For any parent transferred LC, which has already been transferred the LC.TYPE cannot be changed. (L/C transaction has already had the child L/C number associated to). A child is not be allowed to transfer to another child l/c and therefore the child LC.TYPE cannot be transferrable.. 3-4 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. (Mandatory input) Must be present on the LC.TYPES file.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LcType

      • getLiabilityAmt

        public TField getLiabilityAmt()
        Returns the LiabilityAmt

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total liability amount in respect of each individual issued or confirmed letters of credit. Used as a running total of the remaining credit amount available after all current drawings (if any) have been made under the letter of credit. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY). When the letter of credit/documentary collection is input this field will contain either the LC.AMOUNT, or the MAXIMUM.CR.AMT, or the LC amount plus any tolerance indicated in field <PERCENTAGE.CR.AMT>.and any amount entered in the field <ADD.COVERED.AMOUNT>. Whenever drawings are entered, this amount is reduced by the amount of the drawing, so at any stage the total credit amount remaining will be shown by this field. This field also represents the undrawn balance of an unconfirmed letter of credit and the unpaid balance of a documentary collection. The contingent CRF entry will be updated by this field for all live letters of credit, to show the total liability amount.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LiabilityAmt

      • getLimitBroken

        public TField getLimitBroken()
        Returns the LimitBroken

        Field description: when a CRITICAL limit override message is received. Additional information may be added here for the Credit Officer of the account .

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LimitBroken

        public TField getLimitReference()
        Returns the LimitReference

        Field description: This field is no longer used. Its function is replaced by the multi-value PORT.LIM.REF Validation Rules:

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LimitReference

      • getLimitUpdate

        public TField getLimitUpdate()
        Returns the LimitUpdate

        Field description: Holds the value updated from the LC.AMENDMENTS application. It is based on this field, the second Limit line for the LC.AMENDMENT is hit or reversed. Validation Rules: (1) System maintained. Updated from LC.AMENDMENT application.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LimitUpdate

      • getLimitWithProv

        public TField getLimitWithProv()
        Returns the LimitWithProv

        Field description: This value is defaulted from the Parameter. When set to YES, the Limit is impacted net of the Provision taken if any and when set to NO, irrespective of the Provision taken the limit is impacted for the Liability amount. E.g. When a Letter of Credit is opened for USD 100,000.00 and a Provision of USD 50,000 is taken, the impact of the limit line would be for: USD 50,000 when LIMIT.WITH.PROV is set to YES USD 100,000 when LIMIT.WITH.PROV is set to NO. Validation Rules: Valid input is YES or NO. Input cannot be changed even at INAU.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LimitWithProv

      • getLmtForRevolving

        public TField getLmtForRevolving()
        Returns the LmtForRevolving

        Field description: In the case of Revolving Non-Cumulative Letters of Credit, the limit can be impacted only for the current revolution, by setting this field to SINGLE. The consol entry also would be raised for the current cycle's liability. The default would be NULL, retaining the extant flow. If an LC were to be issued for USD 150,000 for 2 revolutions, the limit would be impacted for USD 450,000 and consol entry would be raised for USD 450,000. By setting this to SINGLE, the limit would be impacted for USD 150,000 and this would also be the amount of consol entry. During the roll-over the new limit line and the consol entry would be raised as a part of End of Day processing. However, if Cash Margin (Provision) were to be taken under this LC, the same would be calculated on the entire Liability of the LC and not just for the Current cycle's liability as populated in CUR.REVOL.LIAB. Validation Rules: Valid input is SINGLE. Input permitted only if the LC is revolving and non-cumulative in nature.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LmtForRevolving

      • getLocalRef

        public LocalRefClass getLocalRef(java.lang.String name)

      • getMaximumCrAmt

        public TField getMaximumCrAmt()
        Returns the MaximumCrAmt

        Field description: This field is used to specify the users preferred choice to indicate that the l/c amount indicated in field <LC.AMOUNT> is a maximum. This field reflects the options available under S.W.I.F.T. specifications. Validation Rules: 13 type Alphanumeric characters. Can only be entered if the field <PERCENTAGE.CR.AMT> is blank. Validate input terms are: UP.TO, MAXIMUM, or NOT EXCEEDING. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MaximumCrAmt

      • getMt759AltRefNumber

        public TField getMt759AltRefNumber()
        Returns the Mt759AltRefNumber

        Field description: If the user intends to send a MT759 for an amendment or for a drawing record then this field is used to specify the reference of the LC.AMENDMENTS or the DRAWINGS record. Should be a valid @ID from LC.AMENDMENTS and DRAWINGS. Allowed input only when Operation is M. This field will be mapped to Tag 20 of the MT759. Validation Rules: Should be a valid @ID from LC.AMENDMENTS and DRAWINGS. This field must not start or end with a slash '/' and must not contain two consecutive slashes '//'

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Mt759AltRefNumber

      • getMt759FormOfUndk

        public TField getMt759FormOfUndk()
        Returns the Mt759FormOfUndk

        Field description: This field specifies the type of instrument. Field will be mapped against Tag 22D of Outward and Inward MT759 messages. Mandatory field for a MT759 message. Input in this field is applicable only for Operation - M. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes as under Allowed Codes are: i. DOCR - Documentary Credit ii. STBY - Standby Letter of Credit iii.UNDK - Undertaking Validation Rules: i. If MT759.FUNCTION is ISSUANCE, REQISSUE, REQAMEND, or ISSAMEND then field MT759.FORM.OF.UNDK must contain UNDK ii. If MT759.FUNCTION is TRANSFER then field MT759.FORM.OF.UNDK must contain STBY or UNDK

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Mt759FormOfUndk

      • getMt759Function

        public TField getMt759Function()
        Returns the Mt759Function

        Field description: This field specifies the type of request or function of the message. Field will be mapped against Tag 23H of the MT759 message. Mandatory field to generate a MT759 message. Input allowed only when operation is M. Permitted Codes are: i. CLSVCLOS - Closing of client service call by Trade Operations ii. CLSVOPEN - Opening of client service call by Trade Operations iii. FRAUDMSG - Advice of a fraud attempt iv. GENINFAD - General information advice v. ISSAMEND - Amendment of a free-form undertaking such as a dependent guarantee vi. ISSUANCE - Issue of a free-form undertaking such as a dependent guarantee vii. OTHERFNC - Other request viii.REIMBURS - Request related to a reimbursement ix. REQAMEND - Request to amend an undertaking x. REQFINAN - Financing request xi. REQISSUE - Request to issue an undertaking xii. TRANSFER - Transfer of a undertaking Validation Rules: i. ISSUANCE, REQISSUE, REQAMEND, or ISSAMEND then field 22D must contain UNDK ii. TRANSFER then field 22D must contain STBY, or UNDK

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Mt759Function

      • getMt759Narrative

        public List<TField> getMt759Narrative()
        Returns the collection of Mt759Narrative

        Field description: Free text field that allows the user to input the details of the request or the information. Input allowed only when operation is 'M' This field will be mapped against the tag 45D of a MT759 message. Format : 150*65z ( of 8 sequences) Accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters System auto populates 'Tag 27 - Sequence of Total' based on the number of MT759 messages generated. Only upto 8 sequences allowed(i.e. 8/8). This field allows to input a maximum of 1200 lines of 65 characters(Z character set). For each of the 150 lines, T24 generates multiple MT759 messages and a maximum of upto 8/8 sequence of messages can generated. Mandatory field for a MT759 message. Validation Rules: The number of lines in this field cannot exceed 1200.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getMt759Narrative

Input allowed only when operation is 'M' This field will be mapped against the tag 45D of a MT759 message. Format : 150*65z ( of 8 sequences) Accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters System auto populates 'Tag 27 - Sequence of Total' based on the number of MT759 messages generated. Only upto 8 sequences allowed(i.e. 8/8). This field allows to input a maximum of 1200 lines of 65 characters(Z character set). For each of the 150 lines, T24 generates multiple MT759 messages and a maximum of upto 8/8 sequence of messages can generated. Mandatory field for a MT759 message. Validation Rules: The number of lines in this field cannot exceed 1200.

Also, accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/710/720/740 is generated Defaults standard text - All charges outside (Applicant's Country) are for the account of Beneficiary' for import LC's.

      • getNextDrawing

        public TField getNextDrawing()
        Returns the NextDrawing

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the number of the next drawing that will be made under the letter of credit. 01 is defaulted if there are no drawings against the L/C.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The NextDrawing

      • getNoOfRevolving

        public TField getNoOfRevolving()
        Returns the NoOfRevolving

        Field description: This field identifies the number of times the letter of credit will revolve. Example: A letter of credit is issued for US$50,000.00 and the NO.OF.REVOLVING field shows an input of '3'. This indicates that the letter of credit will be revolved three times. The liability will show an outstanding of USD200,000 (i.e. the initial US$50,000 plus US$150,000 [US$50,000 revolved 3 times]). In the case of an export revolving letter of credit which has been transferred; any amendment (operation 'A') to the field NO.OF.REVOLVING will be checked against that of the transferred letter of credit. If the proposed number change does not support the transfer already effected then it will not be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 alphanumeric characters.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The NoOfRevolving

      • getNopayReason

        public List<TField> getNopayReason()
        Returns the collection of NopayReason

        Field description: This field is used to map 77A tag in MT416 message (Inward as well as outward). Validation Rules Allowed to input only when MT416 is set in SEND.COLL.MSG field. Allowed to input only during amendment of LC record. Not allowed to input if drawings are present under the Collection. Not allowed if LC is already fully utilised. Should not be more than 20 lines.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

Allowed to input only during amendment of LC record. Not allowed to input if drawings are present under the Collection. Not allowed if LC is already fully utilised. Should not be more than 20 lines.

      • getOpeningComm

        public TField getOpeningComm()
        Returns the OpeningComm

        Field description: This field is currently not in use.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OpeningComm

      • getOperation

        public TField getOperation()
        Returns the Operation

        Field description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. The following codes are valid: O - Open new Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, P - Preadvise new Letter of Credit contract, A - Amend an existing Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, C - Direct charge processing for an existing contract, T - Trace existing Documentary Collection contract, D - Decision on an Amendment, M - Ancillary Trade Structured Message. Operation 'C' provides the operator with the ability to either record a new charge or amend (not cancel or write-off) a previously input charge. Operation 'C' also displays all uncollected charges (having null status) in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES, which are available to the operator to amend. However, keeping the status unchanged at null will enable the system to rewrite the charges back in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES. To ensure that no fee/charges are accidentally deleted or 'lost' from the system, once a charge set has been input, it cannot be deleted. However such a charge can be written off in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES. When accessed the contract will be shown with all relevant fields in their amended state, except charges set. When using 'T' trace, an MT420 will be produced and the next process date will have to be modified. Operation D is used when a decision on a Pending Amendment is to be taken as either Approved or Rejected. Use of this option opens up AMEND.NO and AMEND.STATUS. to use this the Letter of Credit has to be previously authorised in its O status. Operation M is used to send an Ancillary Trade Structured Message MT759. User can send a MT759 for a LC contract, LC Amendment or a Drawing contract. During this operation, input to other fields are not allowed other than the related MT759 fields. This operation is allowed only for an existing contract.

        Validation Rules: Mandatory input. For a new contract the following are valid: O - open, P - pre-advise For an existing contract the following are valid: A - amend, C - direct charge, T - trace (collections only), D decision, M - Miscellaneous Message For D operation, the Letter of Credit must be previously authorised as O, should not be of a Mixed payment or Revolving type or a Collection Document.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Operation

      • getOpnPartyChg

        public TField getOpnPartyChg()
        Returns the OpnPartyChg

        Field description: This field is currently not in use.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OpnPartyChg

      • getOscollectNo

        public TField getOscollectNo()
        Returns the OscollectNo

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total number of outstanding drawings sent for 'collection' under the letter of credit. When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new drawing sent for 'collection' (drawing type of 'CO' is entered via the DRAWINGS application for this LC), the field will be increased by 1. Note: When a drawing that has been sent for collection is subsequently changed to a 'SP', 'AC', or 'DP', then this field is decreased by 1.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OscollectNo

      • getOscollectVal

        public TField getOscollectVal()
        Returns the OscollectVal

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total value of documents sent for 'collection' under a letter of credit which remain outstanding. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY). When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a set of documents are sent for collection (drawing type of 'CO' is entered via the DRAWINGS application), then this field will be increased by the amount of the drawing. Note: When a drawing that has been sent for 'collection' is subsequently changed to a 'SP', 'AC', or 'DP', then this field is reduced by the amount of the drawing.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OscollectVal

      • getOsusanceNo

        public TField getOsusanceNo()
        Returns the OsusanceNo

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the total number of term or usance drawings made under this letter of credit. When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new term or usance drawing (drawing with type 'AC', or 'DP') is entered via the DRAWINGS application, then this field will be increased by 1.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OsusanceNo

      • getOsusanceVal

        public TField getOsusanceVal()
        Returns the OsusanceVal

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the total value of any outstanding term or usance drawings made under this letter of credit. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY). When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new term or usance drawing (drawing with type 'AC', or 'DP'), is entered via the DRAWINGS application for this LC, then this field will be increased by the amount of the drawing.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OsusanceVal

      • getOtherDespatchDet

        public TField getOtherDespatchDet()
        Returns the OtherDespatchDet

        Field description: This field specifies the place of taking in charge(in case of multimodal transport document), the place of receipt(in case of a road, rail or inland waterway transport document or a courier expedited delivery service document), the place of dispatch or the place of shipment to be indicated on the transport document

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OtherDespatchDet

      • getOtherOfficer

        public TField getOtherOfficer(int idx)
        Returns the OtherOfficer at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Optional input. This multi-value field contains the code(s) to identify other Account Officer(s) involved with the transaction. Validation is the same as ACCOUNT.OFFICER above. Validation Rules: Mulivalue field of 1-4 digit numeric. Must not be the same as ACCOUNT.OFFICER.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getOtherOfficer

        public List<TField> getOtherOfficer()
        Returns the collection of OtherOfficer

        Field description: Optional input. This multi-value field contains the code(s) to identify other Account Officer(s) involved with the transaction. Validation is the same as ACCOUNT.OFFICER above. Validation Rules: Mulivalue field of 1-4 digit numeric. Must not be the same as ACCOUNT.OFFICER.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getOverdrawnAmt

        public TField getOverdrawnAmt()
        Returns the OverdrawnAmt

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the amount that this letter of credit is overdrawn. If the letter of credit is not overdrawn then this field will be zero.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OverdrawnAmt

      • getOverride

        public List<TField> getOverride()
        Returns the collection of Override

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the contents of various system generated warning messages related to the contract at the time of data input and confirmation (F5) by the inputter.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getOverride

        public TField getOverride(int idx)
        Returns the Override at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the contents of various system generated warning messages related to the contract at the time of data input and confirmation (F5) by the inputter.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getOwnPartAmount

        public TField getOwnPartAmount()
        Returns the OwnPartAmount

        Field description: Represents the share of T24 bank in the Syndicated LC. Validation Rules: System maintained field. No input field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The OwnPartAmount

      • getParentLcNo

        public TField getParentLcNo()
        Returns the ParentLcNo

        Field description: This field is applicable to transferred child L/C(s) input only. The <PARENT.LC.NO> is the T24 transaction reference for parent L/C. When inputting the child L/C(s) record, the parent L/C number has to be put in this field. so that the serial updating control can be maintained in the parent L/C record. The details of the parent L/C can be retrieved for use in the child L/C record(s). For example: Example - The parent L/C is a sight credit and partial shipments allowed (i.e. in which case, multi-transfer under this L/C can be effected.). It has been input in T24 under reference TF0005200001 with following extract: Date of Issue: 06-Mar-00 Expiry Date: 06-Jun-00 Place of Expiry: Germany Applicant: PO Box 888, Bangkok, Thailand Beneficiary: German Mechanical Ltd., PO Box 999, Hamburg, Germany. Amount: USD600,000 Available With: Any Bank By Payment Draft At: Sight Shipment Latest: 16-May-00 Shipment: 1,000 sets of washing machine and accessories. FOB Singapore Against presentation of the following documents: +Signed Commercial Invoice in five-fold +Full set clean on board Ocean Bills of Lading made out to the order and blank endorsed marked "Freight Collect" evidencing shipment of the above merchandise. +Packing List in five-fold Documents are to be presented within 21 days after the date of issuance of the shipping documents. The advising bank may add its confirmation to the credit. Shipment will be from Singapore to Bangkok, Thailand Transshipment is allowed Partial shipment is allowed Against presentation of the following documents: +Signed Commercial Invoice in five-fold +Full set clean on board Ocean Bills of Lading made out to the order and blank endorsed marked "Freight Collect" evidencing shipment of the above merchandise. +Packing List in five-fold Documents are to be presented within 21 days after the date of issuance of the shipping documents. The advising bank may add its confirmation to the credit. Shipment will be from Singapore to Bangkok, Thailand Transshipment is allowed Partial shipment is allowed Now, the 1st beneficiary requests to transfer above L/C to A Co. and B Co. for USD250,000 and USD200,000 respectively. When input the Child L/C(s), TF0005200001 has to be input in <Field 34>, then the details in above extract would be retrieved in the child L/C records, except the Applicant of which it would be replaced by the 1st beneficiary automatically. As usual, the expiry date, shipment date and days of presentation may be reduced according to 1st beneficiary's request. After committing the Child L/C(s), let us say TF0005300001 and TF0005300002, the fields <TRANSFERRED.LC> and <TRAN.PORT.AMT> in the parent L/C record will be updated accordingly as below: TRANSFERRED.LC TF0005300001 TRAN.PORT.AMT.. 250,000 TRANSFERRED.LC. TF0005300002 TRAN.PORT.AMT.. 200,000 Validation Rules: Only valid Letter of Credit record allowed

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ParentLcNo

      • getPartShipCode

        public TField getPartShipCode()
        Returns the PartShipCode

        Field description: This field identifies if part shipments are allowed under the terms of the Letter of Credit. Part shipments is used in the production of messages/advices to specify whether part shipments are allowed or not under the terms of the Letter of Credit. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes Allowed codes are ALLOWED - Allowed under the documentary credit. CONDITIONAL - Conditional based on conditions specified elsewhere in the message. NOT ALLOWED - Not allowed under the documentary credit. Override generated to alert the user to specify the condition when the code chosen is CONDITIONAL.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PartShipCode

      • getPartShipText

        public TField getPartShipText()
        Returns the PartShipText

        Field description: This field holds the details of Part Shipment. If input, this field takes priority over PART.SHIPMENTS for the purpose of delivery messages. Validation Rules: 35 Type A (alphanumeric) characters. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PartShipText

      • getPartShipments

        public TField getPartShipments()
        Returns the PartShipments

        Field description: This field identifies if part shipments are allowed under the terms of the Letter of Credit. Part shipments is used in the production of messages/advices to specify whether part shipments are allowed under the terms of the Letter of Credit. Validation Rules: 'Y'- Partshipments Allowed or 'N' - Partshipments Not Allowed. Default to 'N'. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PartShipments

      • getPayTerms

        public TField getPayTerms()
        Returns the PayTerms

        Field description: This field is used to decide the pay type for LC when LC initiated through Internet Banking. Validation Rules: Mandatory when LC initiated through Internet Banking Allowed Values are Sight Deffered Acceptance Nego.Sight Nego.Acceptance

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PayTerms

      • getPaymentAmt

        public TField getPaymentAmt()
        Returns the PaymentAmt

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the payment amount of the last DRAWING made under this letter of credit in the currency of the drawing.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PaymentAmt

      • getPendDecMvmt

        public TField getPendDecMvmt()
        Returns the PendDecMvmt

        Field description: Contains the total of all negative amount from all pending Amendments for the LC. Validation Rules: (1) NO INPUT Field . (2) This Field is automatically updated by adding up the decrease of Liability Amount on decision of each Amendment.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PendDecMvmt

      • getPercentageCrAmt

        public TField getPercentageCrAmt()
        Returns the PercentageCrAmt

        Field description: Used to define the percentage to be added to the letter of credit amount (LC.AMOUNT) to calculate the full liability amount or maximum amount that can be drawn. If a rate is specified here, then it is used to calculate the liability amount of the letter of credit by adding the percentage of the LC.AMOUNT to the LC.AMOUNT. Example: If the LC.AMOUNT = 1,000,000.00 and the percentage entered here = 10, then the LIABILITY.AMOUNT will be equal to 1,100,000.00. Validation Rules: Standard rate format (Only up to 6 integer and decimal characters). If this field is entered, then MAXIMUM.CR.AMT must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PercentageCrAmt

      • getPercentageDrAmt

        public TField getPercentageDrAmt()
        Returns the PercentageDrAmt

        Field description: This field specifies the negative tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount as a percentage. Example: If the LC.AMOUNT = $1,000,000.00 and the percentage entered here = 10, then the minimum drawing expected under this letter of credit is $900,000.00 and the maximum is $1,000,000.00. The LIABILITY.AMOUNT will be equal to $1,000,000.00. Validation Rules: Standard rate format (Only up to 6 integer and decimal characters).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PercentageDrAmt

      • getPortNoAppIss

        public TField getPortNoAppIss()
        Returns the PortNoAppIss

        Field description: Identifies the customer portfolio number to which this letter of contract will be associated with. This will be used for the portfolio valuation either for the APPLICANT.CUSTNO or the ISSUING.BANK.NO fields. On Import LCs the APPLICANT.CUSTNO field will be used here and for Export LCs the ISSUING.BANK.NO field will be used in the Portfolio Valuation. The amount of the letter of credit less the drawings will be used to update the Portfolio as a NEGATIVE amount, i.e. will be treated similar to a Loan. No input will result in this deal being excluded from the portfolio valuation. Validation Rules: Up to 3 characters numeric. (Optional input)

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PortNoAppIss

      • getPortNoBen

        public TField getPortNoBen()
        Returns the PortNoBen

        Field description: This field identifies the customer portfolio number with which this letter of credit record will be associated. This will be used for the portfolio valuation for that BENEFICIARY.CUSTNO. No input will result in this deal being excluded from the portfolio valuation. Validation Rules: Up to 3 characters numeric. (Optional input)

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PortNoBen

      • getPositionType

        public TField getPositionType()
        Returns the PositionType

        Field description: Indicates the position the transaction will be recorded under. Any positions updated as a result of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract willl be recorded under the position type entered here e.g. Trading, Investment etc. Validation Rules: 2 SSS (Uppercase alpha) characters. Default from LC.PARAMETERS. Must be present on the FX.POS.TYPE file.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PositionType

      • getPreAdvRef

        public TField getPreAdvRef()
        Returns the PreAdvRef

        Field description: This field holds the value of Tag23 of MT700, which is an additional reference to the Documentary Credit, which has been Pre-advised. This is an input field for Operation 'O'. Validation Rules: 16 Type A (Alphanumeric) Characters.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PreAdvRef

      • getPreadvLimit

        public TField getPreadvLimit()
        Returns the PreadvLimit

        Field description: This field is used to decide if the limit is to be impacted for Operation 'P'. This is an input field only for operation 'P'. The value cannot be amended once the record is authorized. Validation Rules: Valid inputs are either YES or NO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PreadvLimit

      • getPresentDayPeriod

        public TField getPresentDayPeriod()
        Returns the PresentDayPeriod

        Field description: This field represents the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. Format specification - 3n[/]35x]. 3n - specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. 35x - Narrative must only be used to specify another type of date than a shipment date, for example invoice date, from which the period for presentation begins. If user inputs only 3n in this field, then as per swift, it is construed to be number of days from the shipment date. In case of a different narrative, other than 'days from shipment date' then the user must explicitly input field. If Presentation days under PRESENT.DAY.PERIOD and Latest shipment date is defined, advice expiry date will be calculated based on Latest shipment date plus Presentation Days for import LC's. An override is raised when ADVICE.EXPIRY.DATE is less than LATEST.SHIPMENT plus Presentation Days.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PresentDayPeriod

      • getPresentPeriod

        public List<TField> getPresentPeriod()
        Returns the collection of PresentPeriod

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices this field specifies the number of days after the date of issuance of the transports document(s) within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. When presentation days is defined for import LC, system will default standard text 'Documents must be present within (Presentation Days) from the date of shipment but before the expiry of credit'. Validation Rules: 35 type Alphanumeric characters. Optional input (if left blank UCP rules apply) Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getPresentPeriod

        public TField getPresentPeriod(int idx)
        Returns the PresentPeriod at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices this field specifies the number of days after the date of issuance of the transports document(s) within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. When presentation days is defined for import LC, system will default standard text 'Documents must be present within (Presentation Days) from the date of shipment but before the expiry of credit'. Validation Rules: 35 type Alphanumeric characters. Optional input (if left blank UCP rules apply) Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getPresentationDays

        public TField getPresentationDays()
        Returns the PresentationDays

        Field description: This field represents the number of days within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PresentationDays

      • getPrevConfirmInst

        public TField getPrevConfirmInst()
        Returns the PrevConfirmInst

        Field description: Holds the previous asset type(i.e. Previous value in CONFIRM.INST field).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PrevConfirmInst

      • getProAwaitRel

        public TField getProAwaitRel()
        Returns the ProAwaitRel

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the Provision amount awaiting to be released. This is the provision amount that is pending to be released on the maturity date of the ACCEPTANCE DRAWINGS. This is the sum total of all provision amounts awaiting release. When an acceptance drawing is matured from AC to MA or a DP is matured to MD manually, the provision amount awaiting release will be released on line. If AC or DP is not changed to MA or MD manually, then the EOD (End Of Day) operation will change the status and release the provision amount.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProAwaitRel

      • getProOutAmount

        public TField getProOutAmount()
        Returns the ProOutAmount

        Field description: System maintained field. This field represents the provision amount outstanding for the transaction. When a sight DRAWING is processed, the provision released will be deducted from the outstanding provision amount. When an acceptance DRAWING is processed, this field will not be affected. However, PRO.AWAIT.REL will be stored with the released amount, pending to be released on maturity date of the acceptance DRAWING.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProOutAmount

      • getProductType

        public TField getProductType()
        Returns the ProductType

        Field description: This field accepts product type 'LCE' or 'LCI' depending upon the LETTER.OF.CREDIT type(Import or Export). Validation Rules: For Import LC - Product type should be 'LCI'. For Export LC - Product type should be 'LCE'. Product type LCI or LCE should be defined in Facility.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProductType

      • getProvCalcBase

        public TField getProvCalcBase()
        Returns the ProvCalcBase

        Field description:

        Determines whether provision has to be calculated on LC face value or liability amount. For example,

        Example 1

        LC Amount 100,000; Provision Percentage 20%; Credit Tolerance 5%;

        Provision Calc Base LC.AMT; Liability Amount 105,000;

        Provision Amount = (100,000 * 20%/100)

                                                                = 20,000.

        Example 2

        LC Amount 100,000; Provision Percentage 20%; Credit Tolerance 5%;

        Provision Calc Base LIABILITY.AMT; Liability Amount 105,000;

        Provision Amount = (105,000 * 20%/100)

                                    = 21,000.

        Validation Rules:

        Valid options are LC.AMT and LIABILITY.AMT.

        Allowed only for LC's with provision.

        Defaulted from PROV.CALC.BASE field in LC.PARAMETERS. Defaulted value can be amended by the user.

        No change field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvCalcBase

      • getProvExchRate

        public TField getProvExchRate()
        Returns the ProvExchRate

        Field description: Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ. Default is the mid rate of LC.MARKET.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvExchRate

      • getProvisAcc

        public TField getProvisAcc()
        Returns the ProvisAcc

        Field description: This field is used to determine the account from which the provision should be debited when such a transaction is deemed to require provision. The account will be re-credited when either a Sight Drawing is processed or on maturity of an acceptance Drawing by default. However, user can define a different account in DRAWINGS so that the provision amount is released into that account. For release of provision, this shall be the credit account and no change will be allowed. Validation Rules: Field PROVISION must be set to 'YES'. The account can be any account including a nostro or an internal account. If the account is not an account of the opener an override will be raised to alert the user.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvisAcc

      • getProvisAmount

        public TField getProvisAmount()
        Returns the ProvisAmount

        Field description: This field is used to register any changes in the amount of provision held, as displayed in field <PRO.OUT.AMOUNT> and can be either System Generated or User Input. As this field is also used for Partial Confirmation, when a value is input in the field <CONFIRMATION.AMT> the provision is taken only on that value. By inputting a percentage in the field <PROVIS.PERCENT> the system will automatically calculate a new Provision Amount based on the L/c amount, provision percentage, provision exchange rate and the provision debit account.. Alternatively the user can input an amount directly to indicate an increase in provision. A minus (-) sign inserted before the amount indicating a reduction in the provision amount. The amount is stored in the currency of the provision credit account. Validation Rules: If an amount is input then the PROVIS.PERCENTAGE will be ignored and the amount entered will override the calculated %amount. For mixed payment LCs the amount entered in this field will be split according to the DRAW.TYPE percentage given in the multivalue set. The amount here will be converted to LC.CURRENCY and the Limit will be hit for an amount LIABILITY minus provision amount, initially when the LC is input.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvisAmount

      • getProvisPercent

        public TField getProvisPercent()
        Returns the ProvisPercent

        Field description: This field details the provision percentage to be used to calculate the provision amount. Input into this field is only permitted if the field <PROVIS.AMOUNT> is left blank. They cannot co-exist. However, as this field is also used for Partial Confirmation, whenever a value is input in the <CONFIRMATION.AMT> and the provision is calculated only on that value.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvisPercent

      • getProvision

        public TField getProvision()
        Returns the Provision

        Field description: This field turns on the Provision processing for import Letters of Credit and export confirmed LCs.. When this field is set to 'YES' , an account/percentage provision can be entered. The system will then calculate (using the percentage entered) a provision amount, which will be passed to the Provision.amount field. This amount is in the currency of the provision account. Provision processing is also known as Margin processing. For a customer with a standard provision account and percentage you can set-up the LC.CUSTOMER.CONDITION file with the defaults for the provision account/percentage by Letter of Credit type. Note : Throughout the Trade Finance module this processing will be referenced as Provision processing. Validation Rules: Default is 'NO'.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Provision

      • getProvisionRate

        public TField getProvisionRate()
        Returns the ProvisionRate

        Field description: System maintained field This field displays the mid rate between the LC CURRENCY and the PROVISION CREDIT ACCOUNT CURRENCY.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvisionRate

      • getPurpOfMsg

        public TField getPurpOfMsg()
        Returns the PurpOfMsg

        Field description: This field specifies the purpose of MT707 amendment message. For Export LC with advice through bank i.e. field ADVISE.THRU inputted in the MT700 LC contract, then valid code ADVI OR ACNF will be a mandatory input. For Import LC valid code ISSU will be a mandatory input. At least one optional field needs to be present after the tag 22A, for the swift message MT707 to be construed. Permitted Codes are: ACNF - Advice and confirmation of the credit amendment ADVI - Advice of the credit amendment ISSU - Issuance of the credit amendment Validation Rules: Mandatory Input when Operation is set to A and AMENDMENT.DEL is YES. ISSU - Valid input for Import LC. ADVI and ACNF - Valid input for Export LC. Error message will be generated if No optional field inputted after the tag 22A.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PurpOfMsg

      • getRecordStatus

        public String getRecordStatus()
        Returns the RecordStatus

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the current status of the contract. IHLD for on hold / INAU for unauthorized / AU for authorised / CHLD for copied transaction on hold.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The RecordStatus

        public TField getReimbBkChgs()
        Returns the ReimbBkChgs

        Field description: This field allows to specify by which party the reimbursing bank's charges are to be borne. The absence of this field implies that charges will be borne by the Sender of this message. The value present in this field is populated in Tag 71A of MT740. Validation Rules: Valid inputs are OUR or CLM.

        Parameters:

        TField - The ReimbBkRef

The value present in this field is populated in Tag 77 of MT747. Validation Rules: Up to 20 lines of 35 characters. Accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT747 is generated.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return

        TField -

The value present in this field is populated in Tag 77 of MT747. Validation Rules: Up to 20 lines of 35 characters. Accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT747 is generated.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getReimburseFrom

        public TField getReimburseFrom()
        Returns the ReimburseFrom

        Field description: This field displays a code to identify from whom reimbursement will be received from under the letter of credit. Valid codes are: O(pener) - T(hird Party Bank (Reimbursing bank)) or W(aiting for further instructions) Validation Rules: 'O', 'T', or 'W'. If 'T' is specified then THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO or THIRD.PARTY must be entered.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReimburseFrom

      • getRelProvis

        public TField getRelProvis()
        Returns the RelProvis

        Field description: This Field is used to release the outstanding provision amount. The release will be done on line. The provision credit account will be debited for the outstanding amount and the provision debit account will be credited in this operation. This cannot be set to Y when no provision amount is outstanding in the credit account. When set to Y, no other amendment to the amount etc are allowed. When releasing provision, PROV.EXCH.RATE will act as provision release exchange rate. LC will not be allowed to be reversed unless the outstanding provision amount is released through operation REL.PROVIS equal to Y.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RelProvis

      • getRelatedLcNo

        public TField getRelatedLcNo()
        Returns the RelatedLcNo

        Field description: System maintained field. This field is used for displaying the corresponding import letter of credit number when a back to back transaction is generated. See the BACK.TO.BACK field for further information. Validation Rules: 16 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. This is a NO INPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RelatedLcNo

      • getReqConfBnk

        public TField getReqConfBnk()
        Returns the ReqConfBnk

        Field description: This field identifies the bank which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation or may add its confirmation to the documentary credit. It contains the mnemonic or customer number of the requested confirming bank. Validation Rules: Allowed characters for the ID (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). The customer code must exist on the CUSTOMER file. Input in this field is allowed only if the values in the field CONFIRM.INST is CONFIRM or MAY ADD. Either REQ.CONF.BNK or REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME is mandatory. If REQ.CONF.BNK is input, then, upon validation, the name and address of the confirming bank is to be defaulted into the REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME field. The name and address is defaulted from the CUSTOMER record.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReqConfBnk

      • getReqConfBnkName

        public List<TField> getReqConfBnkName()
        Returns the collection of ReqConfBnkName

        Field description: This field identifies the bank which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation or may add its confirmation to the documentary credit. It contains the name and address of the requested confirming bank. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Input in this field is allowed only if the values in the field CONFIRM.INST is CONFIRM or MAY ADD. Either REQ.CONF.BNK or REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME is mandatory. If REQ.CONF.BNK is input, then, upon validation, the name and address of the confirming bank is to be defaulted into the REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME field. The name and address is defaulted from the CUSTOMER record.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getReqConfBnkName

        Field description: This field identifies the bank which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation or may add its confirmation to the documentary credit. It contains the name and address of the requested confirming bank. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Input in this field is allowed only if the values in the field CONFIRM.INST is CONFIRM or MAY ADD. Either REQ.CONF.BNK or REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME is mandatory. If REQ.CONF.BNK is input, then, upon validation, the name and address of the confirming bank is to be defaulted into the REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME field. The name and address is defaulted from the CUSTOMER record.

        public TField getReserved18()

      • getReturnComm

        public TField getReturnComm()
        Returns the ReturnComm

        Field description: Determines whether the excess commission amount calculated on account of principal decrease is to be returned to the customer or not. Acceptable values are YES or No. Value gets defaulted from LC.PARAMETERS which can be amended by the user.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReturnComm

      • getRevocable

        public TField getRevocable()
        Returns the Revocable

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether the letter of credit is Revocable or Irrevocable. Post swift 2018 revision, this field is always set to Irrevocable. When a LC is issued this field should always be set to 'NO' such that the swift tag 40A is updated with one of the following values under MT700 / MT705 / MT710 / MT720: IRREVOCABLE, IRREVOCABLE TRANSFERABLE, IRREVOCABLE STANDBY and IRREVOC TRANS STANDBY.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Revocable

      • getRevolvingFqy

        public TField getRevolvingFqy()
        Returns the RevolvingFqy

        Field description: This field identifies the frequency at which the letter of credit is to revolve. Examples: Input of 'WEEK3' indicates that the letter of credit needs to be revolved every three weeks from the issue date. Input of 'M02' indicates that the letter of credit needs to be revolved every 2 months from the issue date. In the case of export revolving letters of credit which have been transferred, the frequency cannot be changed by amendment. Validation Rules: Mandatory for all revolving letters of credit.. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RevolvingFqy

      • getRevolvingType

        public TField getRevolvingType()
        Returns the RevolvingType

        Field description: Input in this field is applicable only for Revolving Letters of Credit. This field is used to identify the type of Revolving Letter of Credit applicable. Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative. T24 fully support the internationally recognized understanding of cumulative and non-cumulative revolving letters of credit. Example: A revolving letter of credit is issued for $10,000 revolving on the 15th day of every month with 3 revolutions. An initial drawing of $6000 is made and no further drawings were made by the 15th of the month (i.e. the time the first revolution is set to take place). For a Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the unutilized amount of $4000 will be carried over by the system to the next revolution period. i.e. the system will provide for the first revolution to be drawn for an increased amount of $14,000 (being $10,000 + $4000) For a Non-Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the untilled portion of $4000 is now unavailable for drawing and the system will provide for the fist revolution to be drawn for $10000 only.. Validation Rules: Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative. Default will be null, which indicates that the letter of credit is not revolving.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RevolvingType

      • getRiskParty

        public TField getRiskParty()
        Returns the RiskParty

        Field description: This field indicates a liability number to be used instead of that of the Issuing Bank's. However, it defaults to the Issuing Bank. This may be entered at any time until DRAWINGS are made under that Letter of Credit. Normally, once the Export LETTER.OF.CREDIT is established, the amounts are applied against the limits of the Issuing Bank taking the value from ISSUING.BANK.NO. In cases where the Reimbursing bank is not the Issuing bank, functionally, setting up the limit against the Issuing Bank may not be required but the contract has to reduce the limit of the Reimbursing Bank/Guaranteeing Bank/Confirming Bank. If input at the time of opening the Letter of Credit, then the limits are set against the Reimbursing Bank. But if it is done as an amendment, then the limit usage of the Issuing Bank is reversed and the amount applied against the Reimbursing Bank. This also generates two APP entries for CRF to reverse the old entry and set up the new one. The contents of this field are used to indicate the liability and Consolidated Reporting (CRF). Replaces the value in the CON.CUS.LINK field, because of which, in an Export Letter of Credit, all the delivery messages, which were hitherto being sent to Issuing Bank, which had defaulted to the CON.CUS.LINK, will now be addressed to the value in this field. Therefore this would warrant a review of mapping of fields in relation to the Delivery messages. Validation Rules: Default value is Issuing Bank Customer Number. Must be a valid Customer number or Mnemonic. This field cannot be changed when a Drawing exists under the LC. Input allowed only for Export LC.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RiskParty

      • getSendCollMsg

        public TField getSendCollMsg()
        Returns the SendCollMsg

        Field description: This field is used to generate MT422 or MT416 as adhoc messages for Collections. Validation Rules Options as MT422 and MT416. Allowed only for Collections.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The SendCollMsg

      • getSendMt740

        public TField getSendMt740()
        Returns the SendMt740

        Field description:

        Decides whether MT740 needs to be sent at LC issuance or Drawings stage. If MT740 is not sent at LC level, MT740 will be sent at Drawings level on the acceptance date.

        If MT740 was not sent at LC level, then MT747 will not be triggered at LC amendment stage.

        Validation Rules:

        Field options are YES or NO.

        Default value is 'YES'.

        Allowed only for Import LC's.

        Allowed only when THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO is specified.

        Must be 'YES' for Sight or Mixed LC's.

        Override message "MT740 message will be sent from Drawings" is generated when value is set to 'NO'.

        No change field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The SendMt740

      • getShipDespatch

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ShipDespatch

      • getTenor

        public TField getTenor()
        Returns the Tenor

        Field description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections only. It is used in conjunction with the following field 'DAYS' or 'COLL.MAT.CODE' to indicate the TENOR of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding Collection messages. Only the descriptive text is input in this field. eg. To input a draft of '120 days from the bill of lading date', the words 'days from the bill of lading date' would be inserted in this field or this can be chosen from the dropdown options under the field COLL.MAT.CODE. The actual number of days i.e. '120' would be inserted in the field 'DAYS'. System allows input either under TENOR or COLL.MAT.CODE. Value under any one of the fields is mandatory under a usance collection. Validation Rules: 35 S (Uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. For usance collection, free format text. Defaults to "at Sight".

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Tenor

      • getThirdParty

        public List<TField> getThirdParty()
        Returns the collection of ThirdParty

        Field description: Optional input. For letters of credit, this field identifies the reimbursing third party bank, through whom reimbursement will be made to the negotiating bank, if this is not a customer of the bank. For collection this field is used to identify the Name & Address of the Account with Bank. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer file), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO is set.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getThirdParty

        public TField getThirdParty(int idx)
        Returns the ThirdParty at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Optional input. For letters of credit, this field identifies the reimbursing third party bank, through whom reimbursement will be made to the negotiating bank, if this is not a customer of the bank. For collection this field is used to identify the Name & Address of the Account with Bank. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer file), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO is set.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getThirdPartyAcc

        public TField getThirdPartyAcc()
        Returns the ThirdPartyAcc

        Field description: Optional input, this field defines the account to be used when payment to or payment from the third party reimbursement bank is to be made. The account entered in this field will be used as the default payment to or reimbursement from account for this Letter of credit. For Export LCs, this account will be used for claiming funds from the reimbursement bank. For Import LCs, this account will be used to pay funds to the reimbursement bank. Validation Rules: Standard account format. Must be a valid account that belongs to the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ThirdPartyAcc

      • getThirdPartyCustno

        public TField getThirdPartyCustno()
        Returns the ThirdPartyCustno

        Field description: For Letter of credit this field identifies the Reimbursing bank. For Collections this file identifies the Account with bank This field is optional. LETTER OF CREDIT This THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO must be a customer of the bank and identifies the reimbursing third party bank through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. For import letters of credit this will identify where funds are to be remitted whenever payments are made. For export letters of credit this will identify where funds are to be received from whenever reimbursement is required after effecting payment to the beneficiary. If this field is not set then the default channel of payment and reimbursement is from the Opening Bank to the Negotiating Bank. COLLECTION For a collection this is the account with bank field used when ordering party requests that the beneficiary be paid at a bank other than the receive bank. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). For Import LCs must not be the same as the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO or the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO. For Export LCs must not be the same as the ISSUING.BANK.NO or the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ThirdPartyCustno

      • getTotPendMvmt

        public TField getTotPendMvmt()

        Field description: Contains the total amount from all pending amendments for the LC. Validation Rules:

        (1) System maintained field.

        (2) The value in this field will reflect the net principal(LC.AMOUNT) movements inclusive of tolerance done through LC.AMENDMENTS for which decision is pending.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotPendMvmt

      • getTracerDate

        public TField getTracerDate()
        Returns the TracerDate

        Field description: Accepts Standard date format. Holds the date on which a tracer message will be sent. Once input and authorized, this will produce an EB.FREE.MESSAGE record which will contain relevant details of the particular transaction and the date on which the Tracer message has to be sent. Further tracers may be sent on an automatic cycle which can be specified in TRACER.DAYS. The EB.ACTIVITY which will be triggered is defined in the application LCs Company record in EB.FREE.PARAMETERS. If this is not defined then no message will be sent. Validation Rules: : A valid date, which is not less than Today. Input allowed only when Operation is O, T or A .

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TracerDate

      • getTracerDays

        public TField getTracerDays()
        Returns the TracerDays

        Field description: Accepts valid number of days. The days mentioned here get defaulted in the respective EB.FREE.MESSAGE record. During the EOD process, the tracer date is cycled so as to produce the tracer message again after the above said number of days. If the days are not entered, it is either defaulted from the COUNTRY file or from the EB.FREE.PARAMETERS file for that Application. E.g. : +1W or 20W or +9W etc. Validation Rules: Accepts valid days format - +NW or NNW where N stands for Number of days and W stands for Working days.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TracerDays

      • getTransShipCode

        public TField getTransShipCode()
        Returns the TransShipCode

        Field description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC. Transhipment is used in the production of documents and advices to specify whether transhipments are allowed or not under the terms and conditions of the Letter of Credit. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes Allowed codes are ALLOWED - Allowed under the documentary credit. CONDITIONAL - Conditional based on conditions specified elsewhere in the message. NOT ALLOWED - Not allowed under the documentary credit. Override generated to alert the user to specify the condition when the code chosen is CONDITIONAL.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TransShipCode
