      • setAckChgClaim

        public void setAckChgClaim(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AckChgClaim
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field allows input of currency and amount of charges to be claimed by the Sender. The field will be mapped against the Tag 32a for Outward and Inward MT730 messages. If EUR 120 were to be claimed as charges, the input may either be EUR120 or 100.120, where 100 represents the ID of EUR in the NUMERIC.CURRENCY table. Validation Rules: 3 character (uppercase alpha) - type SSS, or 1-3 numeric character for a valid currency code. When Numeric code is used for the currency, the '.' delimiter is mandatory. 1-14 characters plus a decimal point (standard amount format) - type AMT to represent the amount. The Numeric Currency Code must be an existing code on the NUMERIC.CURRENCY table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAckChgClaim

        public void setAckChgClaim(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AckChgClaim
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field allows input of currency and amount of charges to be claimed by the Sender. The field will be mapped against the Tag 32a for Outward and Inward MT730 messages. If EUR 120 were to be claimed as charges, the input may either be EUR120 or 100.120, where 100 represents the ID of EUR in the NUMERIC.CURRENCY table. Validation Rules: 3 character (uppercase alpha) - type SSS, or 1-3 numeric character for a valid currency code. When Numeric code is used for the currency, the '.' delimiter is mandatory. 1-14 characters plus a decimal point (standard amount format) - type AMT to represent the amount. The Numeric Currency Code must be an existing code on the NUMERIC.CURRENCY table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setActivityCode

        public void setActivityCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ActivityCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field holds the activity number, which is triggered by the latest activity in the life-cycle of the transaction. The activity is 4 digit number composed of three main parts: First indicates the operation 1 - Represents O or P; operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT 2 - Represents A, C or T; operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT 3 - Represents Sight Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS 4 - Represents Usance Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS Second indicates the type of instrument 1 - Represents Outward Collection 2 - Represents Inward Collection 4 - Represents Export Letter of Credit 8 - Represents Import Letter of Credit And the last two digit indicate the detail activity related to that operation. For example : For the L/C Import Issuing activity, the first digit will be 1. The second digit will be 8 and the last two digits will be 01 (to indicate basic INPUT/AUTHORIZE operation). Thus, the activity for L/C import issuing will be LC-1801. The complete list of activity codes can be found in User's Manual.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setActivityCode

        public void setActivityCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ActivityCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field holds the activity number, which is triggered by the latest activity in the life-cycle of the transaction. The activity is 4 digit number composed of three main parts: First indicates the operation 1 - Represents O or P; operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT 2 - Represents A, C or T; operation in LETTER.OF.CREDIT 3 - Represents Sight Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS 4 - Represents Usance Drawing Operation in DRAWINGS Second indicates the type of instrument 1 - Represents Outward Collection 2 - Represents Inward Collection 4 - Represents Export Letter of Credit 8 - Represents Import Letter of Credit And the last two digit indicate the detail activity related to that operation. For example : For the L/C Import Issuing activity, the first digit will be 1. The second digit will be 8 and the last two digits will be 01 (to indicate basic INPUT/AUTHORIZE operation). Thus, the activity for L/C import issuing will be LC-1801. The complete list of activity codes can be found in User's Manual.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAddAmtCovered

        public void setAddAmtCovered(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified AddAmtCovered to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to specify any additional amounts covered by this LC, i.e. charges, transportation costs, etc. Used only for the production of LC documents and advices, to specify any additional amounts that are covered by this LC (as described in S.W.I.F.T. MT700 field no. 39c) Validation Rules: Multivalue field of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.

        Parameters:
        param - the AddAmtCovered to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAddAmtCovered

        public void setAddAmtCovered(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified AddAmtCovered to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to specify any additional amounts covered by this LC, i.e. charges, transportation costs, etc. Used only for the production of LC documents and advices, to specify any additional amounts that are covered by this LC (as described in S.W.I.F.T. MT700 field no. 39c) Validation Rules: Multivalue field of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.

        Parameters:
        param - the AddAmtCovered to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdditionlConds

        public void setAdditionlConds(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified AdditionlConds to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field can be used to provide a description of additional conditions that are not detailed elsewhere. The contents of this field may be printed on messages and advices generated by the system. This field represents 47A for LC Issuance. When used to create an amendment message using Operation A, any modification to this field identify that the additional conditions of the LC contract is amended. The additional conditions details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 47B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 47B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both ADDITIONL.CONDS and CLAUSES.TXT, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        param - the AdditionlConds to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdditionlConds

        public void setAdditionlConds(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified AdditionlConds to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field can be used to provide a description of additional conditions that are not detailed elsewhere. The contents of this field may be printed on messages and advices generated by the system. This field represents 47A for LC Issuance. When used to create an amendment message using Operation A, any modification to this field identify that the additional conditions of the LC contract is amended. The additional conditions details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 47B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 47B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both ADDITIONL.CONDS and CLAUSES.TXT, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        param - the AdditionlConds to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviceExpiryDate

        public void setAdviceExpiryDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AdviceExpiryDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the date that a letter of credit expires from the beneficiary's point of view. This will usually be a number of working days before the EXPIRY.DATE. Charge calculation and customer advices will be using this field whereas accounting, limit updates will still be taking place on EXPIRY.DATE. Validation Rules: Standard T24 date format. Optional input field. (Default EXPIRY.DATE) Must be less than or equal to EXPIRY.DATE. If Presentation days and Lastest shipment date is defined, advice expiry date will be calculated based on Lastest shipment date plus Presentation Days for import LC's.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviceExpiryDate

        public void setAdviceExpiryDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AdviceExpiryDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the date that a letter of credit expires from the beneficiary's point of view. This will usually be a number of working days before the EXPIRY.DATE. Charge calculation and customer advices will be using this field whereas accounting, limit updates will still be taking place on EXPIRY.DATE. Validation Rules: Standard T24 date format. Optional input field. (Default EXPIRY.DATE) Must be less than or equal to EXPIRY.DATE. If Presentation days and Lastest shipment date is defined, advice expiry date will be calculated based on Lastest shipment date plus Presentation Days for import LC's.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviseThru

        public void setAdviseThru(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified AdviseThru to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to identify the bank (which is not a customer of the bank) which is assigned to act as the intermediary between the advising bank of a Letter of Credit/ Collecting Bank or a Documentary Collection and the beneficiary/drawee. If an intermediary between the advising bank/collecting bank and the beneficiary is required, but the intermediary chosen is not a customer of the bank, then this field allows the input of a free format name and address of the chosen bank. It will be used to route all documents/advices for advising/presenting to the beneficiary/drawee. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO is entered.

        Parameters:
        param - the AdviseThru to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviseThru

        public void setAdviseThru(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified AdviseThru to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to identify the bank (which is not a customer of the bank) which is assigned to act as the intermediary between the advising bank of a Letter of Credit/ Collecting Bank or a Documentary Collection and the beneficiary/drawee. If an intermediary between the advising bank/collecting bank and the beneficiary is required, but the intermediary chosen is not a customer of the bank, then this field allows the input of a free format name and address of the chosen bank. It will be used to route all documents/advices for advising/presenting to the beneficiary/drawee. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO is entered.

        Parameters:
        param - the AdviseThru to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviseThruAcc

        public void setAdviseThruAcc(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AdviseThruAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input. Identifies the account of the advise-thru bank, if there is an account relationship. For Export/Advising LC'/Collections, if an account relationship exists between the bank and the advise thru bank, and this account is to be used to route payments to the beneficiary of the LC, then the account is entered here. Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Must be a valid account that belongs to the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviseThruAcc

        public void setAdviseThruAcc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AdviseThruAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input. Identifies the account of the advise-thru bank, if there is an account relationship. For Export/Advising LC'/Collections, if an account relationship exists between the bank and the advise thru bank, and this account is to be used to route payments to the beneficiary of the LC, then the account is entered here. Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Must be a valid account that belongs to the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviseThruCustno

        public void setAdviseThruCustno(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AdviseThruCustno
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the bank who is designated to act as an intermediary between the advising bank of a letter of credit and the beneficiary or the collecting bank of a documentary collection and the drawee. Input into this field is conditional upon the party in question holding a valid customer.no with the bank. This field is required for letters of credit and collections if the advising/collecting bank does not have a direct relationship with the beneficiary/drawee. It identifies the bank through which documents/advices are to be routed for advice/presentation to the beneficiary/drawee. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). For Import/Opening LCs/Outward Collection, cannot be the same as the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO or the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO. For Export/Advising LCs/Inward Collection, cannot be the same as the ISSUING.BANK.NO or the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdviseThruCustno

        public void setAdviseThruCustno(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AdviseThruCustno
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the bank who is designated to act as an intermediary between the advising bank of a letter of credit and the beneficiary or the collecting bank of a documentary collection and the drawee. Input into this field is conditional upon the party in question holding a valid customer.no with the bank. This field is required for letters of credit and collections if the advising/collecting bank does not have a direct relationship with the beneficiary/drawee. It identifies the bank through which documents/advices are to be routed for advice/presentation to the beneficiary/drawee. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). For Import/Opening LCs/Outward Collection, cannot be the same as the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO or the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO. For Export/Advising LCs/Inward Collection, cannot be the same as the ISSUING.BANK.NO or the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO.

      • setAdvisingBkCustno

        public void setAdvisingBkCustno(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AdvisingBkCustno
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is mandatory for Import Letter of Credits and contains the customer number or mnemonic of the advising bank. For Inward Documentary Collections this field contains the customer number or mnemonic of the Remitting Bank. When a child LC is created from an Export transfer type of Letter of Credit, this field identifies the name and address of the bank that receives the outward MT720. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.') Must exist on the CUSTOMER file. Not allowed for Export Letters of Credit except those opened through Inward MT710 or Outward Documentary Collections.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

For Inward Documentary Collections this field contains the customer number or mnemonic of the Remitting Bank. When a child LC is created from an Export transfer type of Letter of Credit, this field identifies the name and address of the bank that receives the outward MT720. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.') Must exist on the CUSTOMER file. Not allowed for Export Letters of Credit except those opened through Inward MT710 or Outward Documentary Collections.

      • setAdvisingDate

        public void setAdvisingDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AdvisingDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Date of advising of the Export LC(Applicable only for Export LCs). For Periodic Commission calculation of Export LCs, if the Bank opts to collect commission from the Advising date, this field is used as the start date for commission calculation. Defaulted to the date on which LC is advised. System maintained field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAdvisingDate

        public void setAdvisingDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AdvisingDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Date of advising of the Export LC(Applicable only for Export LCs). For Periodic Commission calculation of Export LCs, if the Bank opts to collect commission from the Advising date, this field is used as the start date for commission calculation. Defaulted to the date on which LC is advised. System maintained field

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setAmendNo

        public void setAmendNo(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AmendNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field accepts the Amendment Number, on which the decision has received. The order of input need not be sequential or in any pattern. The number is the amendment number of the LC Amendment. Once input and committed, until the Amendment is authorised, the field does not open up. This field should allow user to input values from 1 to 999 when an operation D is performed for an existing bene consent amendment. Input, only during Operation 'D'. Validation Rules: (1) MANDATORY INPUT, when Operation is 'D'. (2) Input must be the number after the alphabet A of the LC.AMENDMENTS ID. Example: If LC.AMENDMENTS ID is TF0007500001A01 , then AMEND.NO must 01. (3) The Amendment must have status as PENDING. This field specifies the amendment number of the Documentary credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendNo

        public void setAmendNo(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AmendNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field accepts the Amendment Number, on which the decision has received. The order of input need not be sequential or in any pattern. The number is the amendment number of the LC Amendment. Once input and committed, until the Amendment is authorised, the field does not open up. This field should allow user to input values from 1 to 999 when an operation D is performed for an existing bene consent amendment. Input, only during Operation 'D'. Validation Rules: (1) MANDATORY INPUT, when Operation is 'D'. (2) Input must be the number after the alphabet A of the LC.AMENDMENTS ID. Example: If LC.AMENDMENTS ID is TF0007500001A01 , then AMEND.NO must 01. (3) The Amendment must have status as PENDING. This field specifies the amendment number of the Documentary credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendStatus

        public void setAmendStatus(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AmendStatus
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to input the Decision text, on the Amendment with number entered in the previous field AMEND.NO. This signifies the Beneficiary consent on the Amendment. When the value input is APPROVED and LIMIT.UPDATE holds the value YES the second limit line is appended to the first. The decision APPROVED is irrevocable even at the INAU status. The opposite is possible Validation Rules: Valid Inputs are APPROVED or REJECTED. Once APPROVED cannot be REJECTED even at INAU. If there is an AMEND.NO this is MANDATORY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendStatus

        public void setAmendStatus(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AmendStatus
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to input the Decision text, on the Amendment with number entered in the previous field AMEND.NO. This signifies the Beneficiary consent on the Amendment. When the value input is APPROVED and LIMIT.UPDATE holds the value YES the second limit line is appended to the first. The decision APPROVED is irrevocable even at the INAU status. The opposite is possible Validation Rules: Valid Inputs are APPROVED or REJECTED. Once APPROVED cannot be REJECTED even at INAU. If there is an AMEND.NO this is MANDATORY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendmentDel

        public void setAmendmentDel(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AmendmentDel
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether the amendment is internal of external. 'Yes' indicates that this amendment is external and will be communicated to third parties using messages and documents sent via the Delivery application. 'No' indicates that this amendment is internal and will not be communicated to the third parties to the contract. Validation Rules: Optional input. Following values allowed: Yes - send delivery messages. This is an external amendment. No - do not send delivery messages. This is an internal amendment. Input only permitted if OPERATION.CODE is A for amendment.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendmentDel

        public void setAmendmentDel(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AmendmentDel
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether the amendment is internal of external. 'Yes' indicates that this amendment is external and will be communicated to third parties using messages and documents sent via the Delivery application. 'No' indicates that this amendment is internal and will not be communicated to the third parties to the contract. Validation Rules: Optional input. Following values allowed: Yes - send delivery messages. This is an external amendment. No - do not send delivery messages. This is an internal amendment. Input only permitted if OPERATION.CODE is A for amendment.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendmentDte

        public void setAmendmentDte(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AmendmentDte
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field displays the date of the last external amendment. This field specifies the date on which the issuing bank considers the documentary credit as being amended. This represents Tag30 of MT707. Backdated date is acceptable under this field. In case, the swift message extends to MT708's, amendment date from tag30 of MT707 to be replicated in MT708 message type. For Import LC, it is a system-generated field. System date is auto picked as the date of amendment for issuance of MT707. For Export LC, this is an inputable field, where date of amendment under tag 30 mentioned in the inward MT707 received from the issuing bank to be inputted (Date of advising the amendment to second advising bank should not be considered). Validation Rules: Mandatory Field Format Specification YYMMDD Amendment date cannot be greater than todays date. Amendment date cannot be lesser than Issue date of the credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendmentDte

        public void setAmendmentDte(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AmendmentDte
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field displays the date of the last external amendment. This field specifies the date on which the issuing bank considers the documentary credit as being amended. This represents Tag30 of MT707. Backdated date is acceptable under this field. In case, the swift message extends to MT708's, amendment date from tag30 of MT707 to be replicated in MT708 message type. For Import LC, it is a system-generated field. System date is auto picked as the date of amendment for issuance of MT707. For Export LC, this is an inputable field, where date of amendment under tag 30 mentioned in the inward MT707 received from the issuing bank to be inputted (Date of advising the amendment to second advising bank should not be considered). Validation Rules: Mandatory Field Format Specification YYMMDD Amendment date cannot be greater than todays date. Amendment date cannot be lesser than Issue date of the credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendmentNo

        public void setAmendmentNo(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AmendmentNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field for Import Letter of Credit and Input field for Exports. This field displays the number of external amendments made to this letter of credit. Amendments (OPERATION.CODE of A) are classified as internal or external depending on the value input in the AMENDMENT.DEL field. Third parties are informed of external amendments. For each external amendment made, this field will be automatically incremented by 1. In the case of Export Letter of Credit, the user has the option to input the same. It can then be used in advices and documents sent to third parties to ensure that all are aware of each modification made to the LC. This field is used in SWIFT message MT707 field 26 Number of Amendment. Validation Rules: This is a NO-INPUT, system maintained field for Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendmentNo

        public void setAmendmentNo(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AmendmentNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field for Import Letter of Credit and Input field for Exports. This field displays the number of external amendments made to this letter of credit. Amendments (OPERATION.CODE of A) are classified as internal or external depending on the value input in the AMENDMENT.DEL field. Third parties are informed of external amendments. For each external amendment made, this field will be automatically incremented by 1. In the case of Export Letter of Credit, the user has the option to input the same. It can then be used in advices and documents sent to third parties to ensure that all are aware of each modification made to the LC. This field is used in SWIFT message MT707 field 26 Number of Amendment. Validation Rules: This is a NO-INPUT, system maintained field for Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAmendments

        public void setAmendments(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified Amendments to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This free format field is used to describe amendments to the transaction, other than Amount/CCY/Maturity date, which can be amended in their specific fields. Validation Rules: 6 x 35 type S (Swift Standard Format).

        Parameters:
        param - the Amendments to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setApplRuleCodes

        public void setApplRuleCodes(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ApplRuleCodes
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the rules the credit is subject to.Following values can be inputUCP LATEST VERSION,EUCP LATEST VERSION,UCPURR LATEST VERSION,EUCPURR LATEST VERSION,ISP LATEST VERSION,OTHR If OTHR is input then, the rule under which credit is subject to must be input in APPL.RULE.DESC field. For the other values, APPL.RULE.DESC will remain a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setApplRuleCodes

For the other values, APPL.RULE.DESC will remain a NOINPUT field.

        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        public void setApplRuleDesc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ApplRuleDesc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the rules the credit is subject to. Accepts 35 alphanumeric characters. Input to the field is mandatory only if OTHR is specified in APPL.RULE.CODES field. For the remaining values of APPLR.ULE.CODE field, This field remains NOINPUT.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setApplicant

        public void setApplicant(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified Applicant to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the name and address of the Applicant / Drawee / Drawer. LETTERS OF CREDIT For Letters of Credit, this field identifies the applicant's name and address on whose behalf of a Letter of Credit is issued. Although the initial values are defaulted from the Customer file, yet they may be altered with an alternate address that the Bank may think is apt. In the case of Transferred Letter of Credit, this field holds the value of the Original Beneficiary of the Parent Letter of Credit. DOCUMENTARY COLLECTIONS For Documentary Collections, this field identifies the bank's customer's name and address i.e. Drawee (inward collection) or drawer (outward collection). Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Only allowed if APPLICANT.CUSTNO is not entered.

        Parameters:
        param - the Applicant to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setApplicant

        public void setApplicant(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified Applicant to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the name and address of the Applicant / Drawee / Drawer. LETTERS OF CREDIT For Letters of Credit, this field identifies the applicant's name and address on whose behalf of a Letter of Credit is issued. Although the initial values are defaulted from the Customer file, yet they may be altered with an alternate address that the Bank may think is apt. In the case of Transferred Letter of Credit, this field holds the value of the Original Beneficiary of the Parent Letter of Credit. DOCUMENTARY COLLECTIONS For Documentary Collections, this field identifies the bank's customer's name and address i.e. Drawee (inward collection) or drawer (outward collection). Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Only allowed if APPLICANT.CUSTNO is not entered.

        Parameters:
        param - the Applicant to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setApplicantAcc

        public void setApplicantAcc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ApplicantAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input. Defines the default account to be used for reimbursement from the Applicant in the case of an Import Letter of Credit and the Drawee in the event of an Inward Collection. Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Only allowed for Import Letters of Credit and Inward Documentary Collections. Account must belong to the Applicant.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setApplicantCustno

        public void setApplicantCustno(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ApplicantCustno
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letters of Credit this field identifies the applicant on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued, if the applicant is held on the CUSTOMER file. Either this field or APPLICANT field (a text description of the applicant) must be entered. For Documentary Collections this field identifies the banks customer i.e. drawee (inward collection) or drawer (outward collection). Validation Rules: Number of mnemonic of customer on CUSTOMER file. Either this field or APPLICANT is mandatory. 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.')

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setApplicantCustno

        public void setApplicantCustno(TField value)

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letters of Credit this field identifies the applicant on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued, if the applicant is held on the CUSTOMER file. Either this field or APPLICANT field (a text description of the applicant) must be entered. For Documentary Collections this field identifies the banks customer i.e. drawee (inward collection) or drawer (outward collection). Validation Rules: Number of mnemonic of customer on CUSTOMER file. Either this field or APPLICANT is mandatory. 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.')

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAutoExpiry

        public void setAutoExpiry(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AutoExpiry
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies whether LC is to be liquidated manually or automatically on EXPIRY.DATE. When set to "YES", LC will be automatically expired on EXPIRY.DATE of LC. When set to "NO", LC will be in live status even after crossing the EXPIRY.DATE and has to be manually liquidated. Validations Rules

        Valid input- YES or NO

        Default value - YES

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAutoExpiry

        public void setAutoExpiry(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AutoExpiry
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies whether LC is to be liquidated manually or automatically on EXPIRY.DATE. When set to "YES", LC will be automatically expired on EXPIRY.DATE of LC. When set to "NO", LC will be in live status even after crossing the EXPIRY.DATE and has to be manually liquidated. Validations Rules

        Valid input- YES or NO

        Default value - YES

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setAvailWithCustno

        public void setAvailWithCustno(TField value)
        Set the specified value for AvailWithCustno
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the production of letter of credit messages/advices, this field identifies the bank authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit if such a bank is a customer with a valid CUSTOMER.NO. This field is not required for collections. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). (Mandatory Input) If this field is entered then AVAIL.WITH cannot be entered. Must be a valid CUSTOMER.NO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Set the specified AvailableWith to a specific position in collection.

        Field description: Used for the production of letter of credit messages/advices, this field identifies the bank authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate documents presented under the L/C if it is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.         public void setAvalBy(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for AvalBy
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the party who has avalized the inward collection bill.It can be avalized either by own bank or third party. Validation Rules a) Allowed Values "OWN"/"OTHERS". b) Allowed only when avalization is requested. c) Allowed only for inward collections. d) Not allowed to modify if avalization has been accepted by defining AVAL.DATE.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBackToBack

        public void setBackToBack(TField value)
        Set the specified value for BackToBack
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Back-to-back letters of credit are related to each other usually with one acting as security for the other. T24 can help with the preparation of details by using one as the basis for generating the other. This field indicates whether a back-to-back LC is to be generated. Input is allowed in this field only if the BACK.TO.BACK field is set to YES in the LC.TYPES record of an export letter of credit. The type of the generated LC is taken from the BACK.LC.TYPE field in the LC.TYPES record. The associated import letter of credit will be generated in the IHOLD status when the record is authorised.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBackToBack

        public void setBackToBack(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for BackToBack
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Back-to-back letters of credit are related to each other usually with one acting as security for the other. T24 can help with the preparation of details by using one as the basis for generating the other. This field indicates whether a back-to-back LC is to be generated. Input is allowed in this field only if the BACK.TO.BACK field is set to YES in the LC.TYPES record of an export letter of credit. The type of the generated LC is taken from the BACK.LC.TYPE field in the LC.TYPES record. The associated import letter of credit will be generated in the IHOLD status when the record is authorised.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBankToBank

        public void setBankToBank(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified BankToBank to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies additional information for the Receiver. This field represents tag72Z in the SWIFT Message type MT700. This is a freetext and allows the user to input any information apart from the those sepcified in the structured fields in the message. Validation Rules: Optional field. Max 6 lines allowed and each lines can have 35Z characters. Also, allows Z Characters when a MT700/705/707/710/720 messages are generated

        Parameters:
        param - the BankToBank to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

Max 6 lines allowed and each lines can have 35Z characters. Also, allows Z Characters when a MT700/705/707/710/720 messages are generated

Commitment available amount in Facility and Facility limit line will be updated at the rate input in this field. Validation Rules: Optional Input Default value - Mid Reval Rate

        value - The value to set

      • setBeneficiary

        public void setBeneficiary(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified Beneficiary to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letters of Credit this field identifies the Beneficiary's name and address. For Documentary Collections this field identifies the name and address of the bank's customer's counterparty i.e. Drawer (Inward Collections), Drawee (Outward Collections). Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters This file is mandatory if the BENEFICIARY.CUSTNO. has not been input.

        Parameters:
        param - the Beneficiary to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBeneficiary

        public void setBeneficiary(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified Beneficiary to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letters of Credit this field identifies the Beneficiary's name and address. For Documentary Collections this field identifies the name and address of the bank's customer's counterparty i.e. Drawer (Inward Collections), Drawee (Outward Collections). Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters This file is mandatory if the BENEFICIARY.CUSTNO. has not been input.

        Parameters:
        param - the Beneficiary to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBeneficiaryAcc

        public void setBeneficiaryAcc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for BeneficiaryAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Export Letters of Credit Only. This field identifies the Beneficiary's default account for crediting proceeds to. If this field is entered then this account will be credited with the proceeds from the Letter of Credit. Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Only allowed for Export/Advising LC's. Must belong to Beneficiary. Must be a valid account.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). The customer code must exist on the CUSTOMER file.

      • setBrokerPercent

        public void setBrokerPercent(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for BrokerPercent
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Where present, the value in this field is used to calculate the default brokerage on all Letter of Credit Drawings for which this contract is the underlying Letter of Credit. The default brokerage amount is set to the percentage defined here of the document amount on the DRAWINGS application. Validation Rules: Standard T24 rate field. Input cannot be greater than 100%. Optional Input.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setBwdFwdKey

        public void setBwdFwdKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for BwdFwdKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies to which day the scheduled frequency date is to be cycled, when the scheduled date is not a working day. Options: C - Calendar, P - Previous working day, N - Next working day. Validation: Applicable only when COMM.FREQUENCY is defined.

        Parameters:

      • setCancelReq

        public void setCancelReq(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CancelReq
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies that the documentary credit is requested to be cancelled. This field represents Tag 23S when a MT707 is generated. When consent received to CANCEL the Documentary Credit, Reversal of liability entries after validation of the current contract to be manually handled. Permitted Code are: CANCEL - This is a request to cancel the instrument Validation Rules: Optional field Valid input is CANCEL Upon validation of cancellation request, System checks and throw override in the below scenarios and user needs to keep track on the expected consequences and act as per the valid business requirement. If any drawings already booked under the Documentary credit. User to keep track on the other consequence for requesting the cancellation when drawings is already booked and to act as per the valid business requirement. If any previous Amendments are already booked through LETTER.OF.CREDIT operation A, no other fields to be amended along with cancellation request except for bank-to-bank communication and charges fields. System to throw override, when amendment/drawings initiated for the cancellation request already accepted through operation D.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCancelReq

        public void setCancelReq(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CancelReq
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies that the documentary credit is requested to be cancelled. This field represents Tag 23S when a MT707 is generated. When consent received to CANCEL the Documentary Credit, Reversal of liability entries after validation of the current contract to be manually handled. Permitted Code are: CANCEL - This is a request to cancel the instrument Validation Rules: Optional field Valid input is CANCEL Upon validation of cancellation request, System checks and throw override in the below scenarios and user needs to keep track on the expected consequences and act as per the valid business requirement. If any drawings already booked under the Documentary credit. User to keep track on the other consequence for requesting the cancellation when drawings is already booked and to act as per the valid business requirement. If any previous Amendments are already booked through LETTER.OF.CREDIT operation A, no other fields to be amended along with cancellation request except for bank-to-bank communication and charges fields. System to throw override, when amendment/drawings initiated for the cancellation request already accepted through operation D.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCategoryCode

        public void setCategoryCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CategoryCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains the category code to which the deal will be accounted. This information will be used for CRF and MIS reporting and will identify the product being processed. A default category code may be specified for each L/C type on the LC.TYPES file. Validation Rules: 5 numeric characters. (Optional input, default value, see details below). The category code must be defined on the CATEGORY table. The category code must relate to the LC application. Valid range is 23000-23999.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCategoryCode

        public void setCategoryCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CategoryCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains the category code to which the deal will be accounted. This information will be used for CRF and MIS reporting and will identify the product being processed. A default category code may be specified for each L/C type on the LC.TYPES file. Validation Rules: 5 numeric characters. (Optional input, default value, see details below). The category code must be defined on the CATEGORY table. The category code must relate to the LC application. Valid range is 23000-23999.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargeBaseAmt

        public void setChargeBaseAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ChargeBaseAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: CHARGE.BASE.AMT: While amending a Letter of Credit, when charges are allowed to default the same is calculated for the entire amount of the LC and not for the amended amount. The value input into this field enables the user to identify a portion of the Letter of Credit for which the charges are to be applied. This facility is available for operation "O" and "A" only. For Example: When a Letter of Credit is input for GBP 100,000 and then amended to GBP 150,000, the user has the option to recover charges only to the extent of the enhanced amount, which is GBP 50,000 in this case. This enhanced amount is treated as the CHARGE.BASE.AMT. If left blank, LC.AMOUNT will be used for calculating default charges, which is the existing flow. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. Input is only allowed if valid Charge/Commission code has been entered

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargeBaseAmt

        public void setChargeBaseAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ChargeBaseAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: CHARGE.BASE.AMT: While amending a Letter of Credit, when charges are allowed to default the same is calculated for the entire amount of the LC and not for the amended amount. The value input into this field enables the user to identify a portion of the Letter of Credit for which the charges are to be applied. This facility is available for operation "O" and "A" only. For Example: When a Letter of Credit is input for GBP 100,000 and then amended to GBP 150,000, the user has the option to recover charges only to the extent of the enhanced amount, which is GBP 50,000 in this case. This enhanced amount is treated as the CHARGE.BASE.AMT. If left blank, LC.AMOUNT will be used for calculating default charges, which is the existing flow. Validation Rules: Standard amount format. Input is only allowed if valid Charge/Commission code has been entered

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Set the specified ChargeCode to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        param - the ChargeCode to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargesAccount

        public void setChargesAccount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ChargesAccount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: From G10.2.02, the charge account will be part of the charge input set. Therefore this field will be no longer use. This field identifies the account from which related charges will be taken, if any.Any valid account number can be entered in this field. If this is entered and the credit is an IMPORT contract , then all charges relating to this L/C will automatically be taken from this account whenever a charge arises during the life of the L/C. All charges for drawings under this L/C will taken from this account, on the day the charge is raised, unless value dating charges is set to yes (From the LC.PARAMETERS file), when they will be taken on the Issue date for L/Cs and the value date for drawings under this L/C. Validation Rules: Optional Input Standard Account Format. Must be a valid account.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargesAccount

        public void setChargesAccount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ChargesAccount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: From G10.2.02, the charge account will be part of the charge input set. Therefore this field will be no longer use. This field identifies the account from which related charges will be taken, if any.Any valid account number can be entered in this field. If this is entered and the credit is an IMPORT contract , then all charges relating to this L/C will automatically be taken from this account whenever a charge arises during the life of the L/C. All charges for drawings under this L/C will taken from this account, on the day the charge is raised, unless value dating charges is set to yes (From the LC.PARAMETERS file), when they will be taken on the Issue date for L/Cs and the value date for drawings under this L/C. Validation Rules: Optional Input Standard Account Format. Must be a valid account.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargesDet

        public void setChargesDet(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified ChargesDet to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field will be mapped against Tag 71D of Outward and Inward MT730 messages. or of MT740 When set to MT730, the valid codes are: AGENT - Agents Commission COMM - Our commission CORCOM - Our correspondent's commission DISC - Commercial discount INSUR - Insurance premium POST - Our postage STAMP - Stamp duty WAREHOUS - Wharfing and warehouse When set to MT740, the valid codes are: DISCCHGS - Discount Charges. ACCECHGS - Acceptance Charges. Any code used in this field must be between slashes and must appear at the beginning of a line. These codes must have been defined in the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS. Narrative text must not begin with a slash and, if used, must begin on a new line and be the last information in the field. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines of 35 type X (Alphanumeric) characters Allows Z characters when a MT730/740 is generated.

        Parameters:
        param - the ChargesDet to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargesDet

        public void setChargesDet(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified ChargesDet to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field will be mapped against Tag 71D of Outward and Inward MT730 messages. or of MT740 When set to MT730, the valid codes are: AGENT - Agents Commission COMM - Our commission CORCOM - Our correspondent's commission DISC - Commercial discount INSUR - Insurance premium POST - Our postage STAMP - Stamp duty WAREHOUS - Wharfing and warehouse When set to MT740, the valid codes are: DISCCHGS - Discount Charges. ACCECHGS - Acceptance Charges. Any code used in this field must be between slashes and must appear at the beginning of a line. These codes must have been defined in the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS. Narrative text must not begin with a slash and, if used, must begin on a new line and be the last information in the field. Validation Rules: 1-6 lines of 35 type X (Alphanumeric) characters Allows Z characters when a MT730/740 is generated.

        Parameters:
        param - the ChargesDet to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setChargesFrom

        public void setChargesFrom(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ChargesFrom
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field displays a code to identify from whom the bank is to claim it's charges. Valid codes are: O(pener), B(eneficiary) or T(hird Party) Validation Rules: 'O', 'B', or 'T'. Default is 'O'. If 'T' is entered, then THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO or THIRD.PARTY must be present.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setClosingDate

        public void setClosingDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ClosingDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the date that the LC is due to be closed, and written to the history files. If any drawings are outstanding on this date for the LC, then the LC will not be closed. The date entered here will be the date on which the LC will be closed from the books and written to the history files. This will not happen if there are outstanding drawings sent for collection, authority to Pay/Access oand Requested, term/usance deals with maturity review dates greater than this date. Validation Rules: Standard Date Format. (Default from EXPIRY.DATE + CLOSING.DAYS from LC.PARAMETERS file). Mandatory input.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setClosingDate

        public void setClosingDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ClosingDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the date that the LC is due to be closed, and written to the history files. If any drawings are outstanding on this date for the LC, then the LC will not be closed. The date entered here will be the date on which the LC will be closed from the books and written to the history files. This will not happen if there are outstanding drawings sent for collection, authority to Pay/Access oand Requested, term/usance deals with maturity review dates greater than this date. Validation Rules: Standard Date Format. (Default from EXPIRY.DATE + CLOSING.DAYS from LC.PARAMETERS file). Mandatory input.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCollMatCode

        public void setCollMatCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CollMatCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: In support of Option K of Tag 32a in 4** series of SWIFT for collection and to default text in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT for acceptence and deferred LC's. This works in conjunction with the DAYS field and accepts the following values. will get triggered if DAYS field has a value and DATE.ACCEPTED is left blank. The default values are ST in the case of Sight Document and BE in the case of Usance documents. The value here along with DAYS shall form the basis for field 32 of MT 400 generated from DRAWINGS under this collection. In case DATE.ACCEPTED is input, then that will be taken to form F32 of MT 400. COLL.MAT.CODE in conjuction with DAYS field will be defaulted for deferred and acceptance LC's in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT fields. This field indicates the codes available for the drafts under a collection. It can also be used under "Documentary Collections" in conjunction with DAYS field to indicate the tenor of the drafts under a collection. System allows input under this field for a documentary collection only if the TENOR field has no value. System allows input either under TENOR or COLL.MAT.CODE. Value under any one of the fields is mandatory under a usance collection. Validation Rules: Mandatory for Option K of Tag 32a in 4** series.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCollMatCode

        public void setCollMatCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CollMatCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: In support of Option K of Tag 32a in 4** series of SWIFT for collection and to default text in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT for acceptence and deferred LC's. This works in conjunction with the DAYS field and accepts the following values. will get triggered if DAYS field has a value and DATE.ACCEPTED is left blank. The default values are ST in the case of Sight Document and BE in the case of Usance documents. The value here along with DAYS shall form the basis for field 32 of MT 400 generated from DRAWINGS under this collection. In case DATE.ACCEPTED is input, then that will be taken to form F32 of MT 400. COLL.MAT.CODE in conjuction with DAYS field will be defaulted for deferred and acceptance LC's in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT fields. This field indicates the codes available for the drafts under a collection. It can also be used under "Documentary Collections" in conjunction with DAYS field to indicate the tenor of the drafts under a collection. System allows input under this field for a documentary collection only if the TENOR field has no value. System allows input either under TENOR or COLL.MAT.CODE. Value under any one of the fields is mandatory under a usance collection. Validation Rules: Mandatory for Option K of Tag 32a in 4** series.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommCode

        public void setCommCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CommCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Field to trigger the collection of periodic commission in LETTER.OF.CREDIT for an issuance and also for an amendment. Separate amendment commission code can be defined for the LC either through operation A or D. Accepts valid code from PERIODIC.COMMISSION table. If any code is defined for the LC type (with operation O, A or D) in LC.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION, then the same is defaulted in this field. However, user input takes precedence. Validations: Periodic commission is not supported for,

        Revolving LCs

        LCs issued under syndication

        Pre-advised LCs

        If no issuance commission has been taken, then amendment commission cannot be taken.

        If separate amendment commission code is not input, then the existing issuance commission will be recalculated.

        Only one amendment commission can be taken (either through operation A or D). For subsequent amendments, the same amendment commission will be recalculated. LC issuance commission accruals will remain unchanged.

        If frequency is defined for LC issuance commission, then separate amendment commission code cannot be input in the amendment.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommCode

        public void setCommCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CommCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Field to trigger the collection of periodic commission in LETTER.OF.CREDIT for an issuance and also for an amendment. Separate amendment commission code can be defined for the LC either through operation A or D. Accepts valid code from PERIODIC.COMMISSION table. If any code is defined for the LC type (with operation O, A or D) in LC.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION, then the same is defaulted in this field. However, user input takes precedence. Validations: Periodic commission is not supported for,

        Revolving LCs

        LCs issued under syndication

        Pre-advised LCs

        If no issuance commission has been taken, then amendment commission cannot be taken.

        If separate amendment commission code is not input, then the existing issuance commission will be recalculated.

        Only one amendment commission can be taken (either through operation A or D). For subsequent amendments, the same amendment commission will be recalculated. LC issuance commission accruals will remain unchanged.

        If frequency is defined for LC issuance commission, then separate amendment commission code cannot be input in the amendment.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommExchRate

        public void setCommExchRate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CommExchRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Exchange rate to be applied between commission(contract) currency and commission account currency. If not input by the user, system to default the appropriate buy/sell rate from the currency table. Validations:

        Optional field.

        Not allowed when LC currency and commission account currency are same.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommExchRate

        public void setCommExchRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CommExchRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Exchange rate to be applied between commission(contract) currency and commission account currency. If not input by the user, system to default the appropriate buy/sell rate from the currency table. Validations:

        Optional field.

        Not allowed when LC currency and commission account currency are same.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommFrequency

        public void setCommFrequency(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CommFrequency
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Determines the frequency at which the commission is to be collected or claimed. The first scheduled date must be the value date. Standard T24 frequency field. Validations:

        Only monthly frequency allowed (M01, M02, etc.)

        Not allowed when PERIODIC.COMMISSION is defined with 'For every Additional Period'.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommFrequency

        Field description: Determines the frequency at which the commission is to be collected or claimed. The first scheduled date must be the value date. Standard T24 frequency field. Validations:

        Only monthly frequency allowed (M01, M02, etc.)

        Not allowed when PERIODIC.COMMISSION is defined with 'For every Additional Period'.

      • setCommPartyChg

        public void setCommPartyChg(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CommPartyChg
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is to identify whether the commission is claimed from opener or beneficiary. Validation Rules: No change field. Option field. Options - O(Opener) or B(Beneficiary) Allowed only when commission is claimed. When commission claimed is "Yes", system defaults this field as "O".

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Field description: This field is to identify whether the commission is claimed from opener or beneficiary. Validation Rules: No change field. Option field. Options - O(Opener) or B(Beneficiary) Allowed only when commission is claimed. When commission claimed is "Yes", system defaults this field as "O".

        Parameters:

        nothing

      • setCommRate

        public void setCommRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CommRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the rate at which the commission has to be calculated. If the user inputs a rate in this field, then the default commission calculation will be ignored and the commission will be calculated at this rate. User input field. Validation:

        Not allowed when FIXED.COMM.AMT is INPUT.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCommStartDate

        public void setCommStartDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CommStartDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Start date for calculation of the LC commission. Values are Advising Date, Confirmation Date, Issue Date, Aval Date. Default value for Import LC is Issue Date. Allowed value for Import LC is Issue Date only Allowed value for Import Collections is Aval Date only

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Field description: Start date for calculation of the LC commission. Values are Advising Date, Confirmation Date, Issue Date, Aval Date. Default value for Import LC is Issue Date. Allowed value for Import LC is Issue Date only Allowed value for Import Collections is Aval Date only

      • setConfLiabAmt

        public void setConfLiabAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ConfLiabAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: CONF.LIAB.AMT: Identifies the total confirmed liability amount in respect of partially confirmed Letters of Credit. It represents the running total of the remaining confirmed portion of the liability amount, as the drawings are being made under this Letter of Credit. The amount will be expressed in terms of LC currency. This field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. Validation Rules: System Generated. Standard Amount format.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing
