      • setConfirmInst

        public void setConfirmInst(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ConfirmInst
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the Receiver. Only three Swift key words can be entered into this field (see Validation Rules: ) The default from the LC.TYPE file can be overwritten. Validation Rules: 7 Alphanumeric characters as specified in the Validation Rules. Defaults from the LC.TYPE parameter file. Valid codes are as follows: CONFIRM The Receiver is requested to confirm the credit. MAY ADD The Receiver may add its confirmation to the credit. WITHOUT The Receiver is not requested to confirm the credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConfirmInst

        public void setConfirmInst(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ConfirmInst
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the Receiver. Only three Swift key words can be entered into this field (see Validation Rules: ) The default from the LC.TYPE file can be overwritten. Validation Rules: 7 Alphanumeric characters as specified in the Validation Rules. Defaults from the LC.TYPE parameter file. Valid codes are as follows: CONFIRM The Receiver is requested to confirm the credit. MAY ADD The Receiver may add its confirmation to the credit. WITHOUT The Receiver is not requested to confirm the credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConfirmationAmt

        public void setConfirmationAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ConfirmationAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: CONFIRMATION.AMT In a partially Confirmed Letter of Credit this field can be input with a value that represents the portion of the Letter of Credit that has been confirmed. This can be expressed in terms of percentage or amount. When input as a percentage, the CONFIRMATION.AMT will be calculated only on the LC amount without taking into account the credit tolerance or Add Covered amount if any. If a provision amount is input without CONFIRMATION.AMT, then to input the confirmation amount the provision has to be released first. But the provision and the CONFIRMATION.AMT may be input concurrently, or the provision may be taken after inputting the confirmation amount. Either way when a provision is input with a CONFIRMATION.AMT then the provision is calculated only for this value and not the LC amount. If a Drawing is done prior to inputting a value into this field, then no partial confirmation can be done for that Letter of Credit. Likewise if the LC is of a Transferable type then no partial confirmation can be done. Validation Rules: It cannot be greater than liability amount. Enabled only for export Letter of Credits.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConfirmationAmt

        public void setConfirmationAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ConfirmationAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: CONFIRMATION.AMT In a partially Confirmed Letter of Credit this field can be input with a value that represents the portion of the Letter of Credit that has been confirmed. This can be expressed in terms of percentage or amount. When input as a percentage, the CONFIRMATION.AMT will be calculated only on the LC amount without taking into account the credit tolerance or Add Covered amount if any. If a provision amount is input without CONFIRMATION.AMT, then to input the confirmation amount the provision has to be released first. But the provision and the CONFIRMATION.AMT may be input concurrently, or the provision may be taken after inputting the confirmation amount. Either way when a provision is input with a CONFIRMATION.AMT then the provision is calculated only for this value and not the LC amount. If a Drawing is done prior to inputting a value into this field, then no partial confirmation can be done for that Letter of Credit. Likewise if the LC is of a Transferable type then no partial confirmation can be done. Validation Rules: It cannot be greater than liability amount. Enabled only for export Letter of Credits.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConsolKey

        public void setConsolKey(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ConsolKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. Indicates the consolidation key which has been generated for this contract. This field will be updated by the system after its first end of day has been processed. The field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. The first four parameters will always contain the application ID (i.e. LC), the Currency Market, the Position Type, and the currency code (LC.CURRENCY). The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setConsolKey

        public void setConsolKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ConsolKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. Indicates the consolidation key which has been generated for this contract. This field will be updated by the system after its first end of day has been processed. The field will be calculated by the system and no operator input will be allowed. The first four parameters will always contain the application ID (i.e. LC), the Currency Market, the Position Type, and the currency code (LC.CURRENCY). The other parameters will default on the conditions defined in the file CONSOLIDATE.COND.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setContactInfo

        public void setContactInfo(ContactInfoClass param, int idx)
        Set the specified ContactInfo to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        param - the ContactInfo to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCreditProvisAcc

        public void setCreditProvisAcc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CreditProvisAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field indicates the account where the provision needs to be credited. In can be in any currency. If not input, default will be from the LC.PARAMETERS and the credit will be in the same currency as that of the debit currency. NOTES: The provision credit account can be changed to any other account provided the currencies are the same. During change of credit provision account (in same currency), no additional amounts can be debited. If provision credit account currency needs to be changed to an account of another currency, then first the existing provision needs to be released by setting REL.PROV to "Y" under operation "A". Once the existing provision is released, the operator can take a revised provision to the debit and credit accounts of different choice. Validation Rules: Mandatory Input if Field PROVISION set to 'YES'.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCreditProvisAcc

        public void setCreditProvisAcc(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CreditProvisAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field indicates the account where the provision needs to be credited. In can be in any currency. If not input, default will be from the LC.PARAMETERS and the credit will be in the same currency as that of the debit currency. NOTES: The provision credit account can be changed to any other account provided the currencies are the same. During change of credit provision account (in same currency), no additional amounts can be debited. If provision credit account currency needs to be changed to an account of another currency, then first the existing provision needs to be released by setting REL.PROV to "Y" under operation "A". Once the existing provision is released, the operator can take a revised provision to the debit and credit accounts of different choice. Validation Rules: Mandatory Input if Field PROVISION set to 'YES'.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDayBasis

        public void setDayBasis(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DayBasis
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the calculation method to be used to generate the Discount and Load amounts on the Drawing contracts related to this L/C and also for charge amortisations. The following types are acceptable:

        Key Days/Denominator
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        S Special
        W 252/252
        W1 21/252
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASIS Validation Rules: 1 type A (alphanumeric) character. Valid inputs are A, B, C, D,E, F, S,W,W1 or blank. Default Value = Interest Day Basis as specified on the Currency record for the currency of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDayBasis

        public void setDayBasis(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DayBasis
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the calculation method to be used to generate the Discount and Load amounts on the Drawing contracts related to this L/C and also for charge amortisations. The following types are acceptable:

        Key Days/Denominator
        A 360/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        S Special
        W 252/252
        W1 21/252
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS types see: INTEREST.BASIS Validation Rules: 1 type A (alphanumeric) character. Valid inputs are A, B, C, D,E, F, S,W,W1 or blank. Default Value = Interest Day Basis as specified on the Currency record for the currency of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDays

        public void setDays(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Days
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections and LC. only. It is used in conjunction with the previous field 'TENOR' to indicate the tenor of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding documentary collection messages. However, this field in order to support Option K of Tag 32a, accepts "D" or "M" followed by number representing Number of Days or Number of Months. Eg. To input a draft of '120 days from the bill of lading date', the number 'D120' would be inserted in this field. The descriptive text i.e. 'days from the bill of lading date' would be inserted in the field 'TENOR'. COLL.MAT.CODE may also be input with BE in this case. COLL.MAT.CODE in conjuction with DAYS field will be defaulted for deferred and acceptance LC's in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT fields. Validation Rules: Maximum length of 4. First Character can either be D or M followed by number such as 120 or 012. Documentary Collection input only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDays

        public void setDays(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Days
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections and LC. only. It is used in conjunction with the previous field 'TENOR' to indicate the tenor of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding documentary collection messages. However, this field in order to support Option K of Tag 32a, accepts "D" or "M" followed by number representing Number of Days or Number of Months. Eg. To input a draft of '120 days from the bill of lading date', the number 'D120' would be inserted in this field. The descriptive text i.e. 'days from the bill of lading date' would be inserted in the field 'TENOR'. COLL.MAT.CODE may also be input with BE in this case. COLL.MAT.CODE in conjuction with DAYS field will be defaulted for deferred and acceptance LC's in DEFERRED.PAY and DRAFTS.AT fields. Validation Rules: Maximum length of 4. First Character can either be D or M followed by number such as 120 or 012. Documentary Collection input only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDbProvAmount

        public void setDbProvAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DbProvAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field This field displays the provision amount in terms of the debit account. This will be prefixed by a minus sign to indicate the debit. As debit account and credit account can be of any two currencies, this field will indicate the amount debited in the currency of the debit account.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDbProvAmount

        public void setDbProvAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DbProvAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field This field displays the provision amount in terms of the debit account. This will be prefixed by a minus sign to indicate the debit. As debit account and credit account can be of any two currencies, this field will indicate the amount debited in the currency of the debit account.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDeferredPay

        public void setDeferredPay(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified DeferredPay to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This free text field will specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC. Validation Rules: 4 x 35 alphanumeric characters. If the LC type is DP(Deferred Payment), this field is mandatory input. If the LC type is N or NS, this field is an optional field. However override raised when no value is inputted. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY DEF PAYMENT", standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC. E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        param - the DeferredPay to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDeferredPay

        public void setDeferredPay(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified DeferredPay to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This free text field will specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC. Validation Rules: 4 x 35 alphanumeric characters. If the LC type is DP(Deferred Payment), this field is mandatory input. If the LC type is N or NS, this field is an optional field. However override raised when no value is inputted. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY DEF PAYMENT", standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC. E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        param - the DeferredPay to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDeliveryRef

        public void setDeliveryRef(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified DeliveryRef to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. Contains the delivery keys used for the generation of LC advices / documents / payments from the Electronic Delivery System.

        Parameters:
        param - the DeliveryRef to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDeliveryRef

        public void setDeliveryRef(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified DeliveryRef to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. Contains the delivery keys used for the generation of LC advices / documents / payments from the Electronic Delivery System.

        Parameters:
        param - the DeliveryRef to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDescGoods

        public void setDescGoods(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified DescGoods to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the creation of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the description of the goods covered by the transaction. This field represents tag 45A while issuance of a LC. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this field identify that the description goods of the LC contract is amended. The description of goods can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 45B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 45B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/705/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. A maximum of 250 lines are only allowed Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        param - the DescGoods to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDescGoods

        public void setDescGoods(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified DescGoods to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the creation of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the description of the goods covered by the transaction. This field represents tag 45A while issuance of a LC. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this field identify that the description goods of the LC contract is amended. The description of goods can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 45B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 45B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept X (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/705/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. A maximum of 250 lines are only allowed Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        param - the DescGoods to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDirectCollNo

        public void setDirectCollNo(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DirectCollNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Direct Export Collection Reference. One of a series of references pre-issued for use by a customer. It is a reference which can be used with the customer ID as an alternative key to access the collection record.. The reference must be in a series assigned to the customer in the DIR.COL.ALL application. Validation Rules: The reference must be in a series assigned to the customer in the DIR.COL.ALL application. The reference must not have been used in another collection by this customer.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDirectCollNo

        public void setDirectCollNo(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DirectCollNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Direct Export Collection Reference. One of a series of references pre-issued for use by a customer. It is a reference which can be used with the customer ID as an alternative key to access the collection record.. The reference must be in a series assigned to the customer in the DIR.COL.ALL application. Validation Rules: The reference must be in a series assigned to the customer in the DIR.COL.ALL application. The reference must not have been used in another collection by this customer.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDiscountNo

        public void setDiscountNo(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DiscountNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the total number of term or usance drawings made under the letter of credit which have been discounted. When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new term or usance drawing (drawing with type 'AC', or 'DP') that is discounted, is entered via the DRAWINGS application for this Letter of credit then this field will be incremented by 1. This provides the user with an easy reference to identify the total number of discounted drawings made against this letter of credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDiscountNo

        public void setDiscountNo(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DiscountNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the total number of term or usance drawings made under the letter of credit which have been discounted. When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new term or usance drawing (drawing with type 'AC', or 'DP') that is discounted, is entered via the DRAWINGS application for this Letter of credit then this field will be incremented by 1. This provides the user with an easy reference to identify the total number of discounted drawings made against this letter of credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the amount of discount made against the letter of credit.

      • setDocsReceived

        public void setDocsReceived(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DocsReceived
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: When an outward collection is initiated through internet banking, this field specifies if original documents have been received by the bank. When this field is set to 'Yes', only then IB.STATUS can be changed to 'Approved'. Validation Rules: Allowed values: Yes, No. User input field. Allowed only for Bank user.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: When an outward collection is initiated through internet banking, this field specifies if original documents have been received by the bank. When this field is set to 'Yes', only then IB.STATUS can be changed to 'Approved'. Validation Rules: Allowed values: Yes, No. User input field. Allowed only for Bank user.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDocumentId

        public void setDocumentId(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DocumentId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to default list of documents defined in LC.ADVICE.TEXT. Validation Rules Applicable only for Import Letter of Credit Default will be based on the following combinations and order from LC.ADVICE.TEXT Applicant customer - Inco Terms - Mode of Shipment Inco Terms - Mode ot Shipment Applicant customer - Free Text Applicant customer

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDocumentId

        public void setDocumentId(TField value)

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to default list of documents defined in LC.ADVICE.TEXT.       • setDocumentsReq

        public void setDocumentsReq(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified DocumentsReq to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains the description of the documents to be presented by under the letter of credit. It will be included in messages/advices generated by the application. This field represents 46A for LC Issuance. The descriptions input to this field will be used in addition to the predefined documents input in the DOCUMENT.CODE field. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this narrative structured text field identify that the document required of the LC contract is amended. The document details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 46B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 46B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept x (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both DOCUMENT.TXT and DOCUMENTS.REQ, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        Parameters:
        param - the DocumentsReq to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDocumentsReq

        public void setDocumentsReq(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified DocumentsReq to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains the description of the documents to be presented by under the letter of credit. It will be included in messages/advices generated by the application. This field represents 46A for LC Issuance. The descriptions input to this field will be used in addition to the predefined documents input in the DOCUMENT.CODE field. When used to create an amendment messages using Operation A, any modification of this narrative structured text field identify that the document required of the LC contract is amended. The document details can be modified during the operation A and when AMENDMENT.DEL is set to YES, an MT707 is generated and the amendment details are mapped to tag 46B of the MT707/MT708. When the maximum lines exceeds(250) under this field, the text inputted in this field is auto split and extension message MT708 is generated. The format of the Narrative structured text must begin with the code and must be within slashes (/ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/) for both MT707 (amendment message) and MT708 (extension to amendment message). Multiple codes and multiple combination of codes allowed in the field except for REPALL. No other code is allowed if REPALL is used. ADD - Must be followed by the text to be added (a sentence, paragraph or line item) DELETE - Must be followed by the text to be deleted (a sentence, paragraph or line item) REPALL - Must be followed by the text that replaces all text in same field. No other code may be used. Line 1 (/Code/)(Narrative) Line 2 (Continuation of Narration) Line 3 (/Code/)(Narrative) As per swift, first line of the Narrative structured text in MT708 should begin with the code. User to deduce and input the code manually at the beginning of a MT708 extension message. In case, the user fails to input the code manually, system will automatically add the code at beginning of tag 46B at the time of generation of one or more MT708 extension messages. System will identify the last code evidenced in the previous sequence and prefix this code in the subsequent MT708 messages. If the amendment is handled through LC.AMENDMENTS application and accepted through operation 'D', the user should manually edit the contents to reflect these changes in line with the original instrument (i.e. LETTER.OF.CREDIT application) Validation Rules: Accept x (Alphanumeric) characters Also, Accepts Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/701/710/711/720/721/707/708 is generated Optional input. If input under both DOCUMENT.TXT and DOCUMENTS.REQ, then combined maximum length of the field should not exceed 250 lines. Valid codes to be used are /ADD/, /DELETE/, /REPALL/ in case of amendment.

        param - the DocumentsReq to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDraftPrint

        public void setDraftPrint(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DraftPrint
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This fielkd is used to indicate whether a draft print of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection document created is to be produced on deal input (i.e. before the authorization stage). If set to 'Y' and the Letter of Credit is an IMPORT credit then a draft print of the letter of credit MT700 will be produced after validation. The message type used for this delivery transaction is MT9700. This preview will not be available at the authorisation stage Validation Rules: 'Y' or 'N'. Default from LC.PARAMETERS file.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDraftPrint

        public void setDraftPrint(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DraftPrint
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This fielkd is used to indicate whether a draft print of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection document created is to be produced on deal input (i.e. before the authorization stage). If set to 'Y' and the Letter of Credit is an IMPORT credit then a draft print of the letter of credit MT700 will be produced after validation. The message type used for this delivery transaction is MT9700. This preview will not be available at the authorisation stage Validation Rules: 'Y' or 'N'. Default from LC.PARAMETERS file.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDraftsAt

        public void setDraftsAt(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified DraftsAt to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used in the production of messages/advices, this field indicates the tenor of the draft to be presented under the Letter of Credit. Example: when a letter of credit has a tenor of 120 days sight, '120 days sight' will be entered in this field. Validation Rules: 35 alphanumeric characters. If this field is used then the Tenor field must be blank and either DRAWEE.CUST.NO or DRAWEE must have a value. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY ACCEPTANCE or BY NEGOTIATION"(Negotiation Acceptance), standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        param - the DraftsAt to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDraftsAt

        public void setDraftsAt(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified DraftsAt to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used in the production of messages/advices, this field indicates the tenor of the draft to be presented under the Letter of Credit. Example: when a letter of credit has a tenor of 120 days sight, '120 days sight' will be entered in this field. Validation Rules: 35 alphanumeric characters. If this field is used then the Tenor field must be blank and either DRAWEE.CUST.NO or DRAWEE must have a value. When AVAILABLE.BY is "BY ACCEPTANCE or BY NEGOTIATION"(Negotiation Acceptance), standard text will be defaulted based on values defined in COLL.MAT.CODE and DAYS field for import LC E.g 120 DAYS AFTER BILL OF EXCHANGE

        Parameters:
        param - the DraftsAt to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

        Set the specified DrawType to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:

        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawee

        public void setDrawee(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified Drawee to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO. Drawees Name and Address may be manually input. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A Alphanumeric characters.. If DRAFTS.AT is used, either this field or DRAWEE.CUST.NO must have a value. If this field is used, then DRAWEE.CUST.NO must be left blank. If the LC type is DP (Deferred Payment) this field must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        param - the Drawee to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawee

        public void setDrawee(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified Drawee to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this free text field is used to identify the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO. Drawees Name and Address may be manually input. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A Alphanumeric characters.. If DRAFTS.AT is used, either this field or DRAWEE.CUST.NO must have a value. If this field is used, then DRAWEE.CUST.NO must be left blank. If the LC type is DP (Deferred Payment) this field must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        param - the Drawee to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDraweeCustNo

        public void setDraweeCustNo(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DraweeCustNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this field identifies the name of the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z Uppercase alpha or '.'). If DRAFTS.AT is used, either this field or DRAWEEmust have a value. If this field is used, then DRAWEE must be left blank. The Customer code must be on CUSTOMER file. If the LC type is DP (Deferred Payment) this field must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDraweeCustNo

        public void setDraweeCustNo(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DraweeCustNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this field identifies the name of the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z Uppercase alpha or '.'). If DRAFTS.AT is used, either this field or DRAWEEmust have a value. If this field is used, then DRAWEE must be left blank. The Customer code must be on CUSTOMER file. If the LC type is DP (Deferred Payment) this field must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawings

        public void setDrawings(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Drawings
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field is used to display a running total of the amount of drawings/payments made under the contract to date. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the Letter of contract (LC.CURRENCY). When a new Letter of Credit/Documentary Collection is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new drawing is entered, this field will be updated by the amount of the drawing. A drawing on a 'collection' basis (Drawing Type CO) under a letter of credit will not be included in the total.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawings

        public void setDrawings(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Drawings
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field is used to display a running total of the amount of drawings/payments made under the contract to date. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the Letter of contract (LC.CURRENCY). When a new Letter of Credit/Documentary Collection is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new drawing is entered, this field will be updated by the amount of the drawing. A drawing on a 'collection' basis (Drawing Type CO) under a letter of credit will not be included in the total.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExpiryDate

        public void setExpiryDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ExpiryDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letters of Credit, this field details the 'Expiry Date' of the Letter of Credit in the bank's book and is not necessarily the actual Expiry Date of the Letter of Credit. On this date all CRF contingent entries and Limits will be liquidated. After this date no further drawings can be made. For term/usance drawings made under an LC, the maturity review date can be greater than this date. Care should be taken not to confuse this field with ADVICE.EXPIRY.DAT which is the actual expiry date advised to the beneficiary in the letter of credit, if different to this EXPIRY.DATE field.. For Documentary Collections, this field details the 'TRACE' date. On this date the item will be included in the 'TRACE' report, which in respect of all Collections whose fate has not been notified by the Collecting Bank. This date can be amended to meet the user's requirements. To facilitate easy input of this field, the user can enter a code indicating the number of weeks or months forward of the issue date to be used as the expiry date. This can be entered in the form of a number followed by the letter 'W' for weeks and 'M' for 'months'. For example if '3M' is entered here and the issue date entered above is '15 June 2000' then the expiry date will be calculated as '15 September 2000'. Note that if you enter "6M" and a 3-monthly charge is applied then the number of charge periods may default to 3 if the expiry date is adjusted to a working day. If this happens then you should override the number of charge periods manually. Validation Rules: Standard Date Format or Code (see above). Mandatory input. If the expiry date of a Letter of Credit exceeds the issue date by more than one year, then an override will be needed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExpiryDate

        public void setExpiryDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ExpiryDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letters of Credit, this field details the 'Expiry Date' of the Letter of Credit in the bank's book and is not necessarily the actual Expiry Date of the Letter of Credit. On this date all CRF contingent entries and Limits will be liquidated. After this date no further drawings can be made. For term/usance drawings made under an LC, the maturity review date can be greater than this date. Care should be taken not to confuse this field with ADVICE.EXPIRY.DAT which is the actual expiry date advised to the beneficiary in the letter of credit, if different to this EXPIRY.DATE field.. For Documentary Collections, this field details the 'TRACE' date. On this date the item will be included in the 'TRACE' report, which in respect of all Collections whose fate has not been notified by the Collecting Bank. This date can be amended to meet the user's requirements. To facilitate easy input of this field, the user can enter a code indicating the number of weeks or months forward of the issue date to be used as the expiry date. This can be entered in the form of a number followed by the letter 'W' for weeks and 'M' for 'months'. For example if '3M' is entered here and the issue date entered above is '15 June 2000' then the expiry date will be calculated as '15 September 2000'. Note that if you enter "6M" and a 3-monthly charge is applied then the number of charge periods may default to 3 if the expiry date is adjusted to a working day. If this happens then you should override the number of charge periods manually. Validation Rules: Standard Date Format or Code (see above). Mandatory input. If the expiry date of a Letter of Credit exceeds the issue date by more than one year, then an override will be needed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExpiryPlace

        public void setExpiryPlace(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ExpiryPlace
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is relevant to Letters of Credit only and identifies the location at which the Letter of Credit expires. Can be a 2 digit country code eg. GB or US or up to 26 free format characters identifying the place of Letter of Credit expiry. If a 2 digit code is entered, then this is checked against the COUNTRY file for enrichment. Validation Rules: 2-26 S (Uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. If 2 digits are entered then this must be a valid country code from the COUNTRY file. If more than 2 digits are entered then any location can be specified. No input required for Collection.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExpiryPlace

        public void setExpiryPlace(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ExpiryPlace
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is relevant to Letters of Credit only and identifies the location at which the Letter of Credit expires. Can be a 2 digit country code eg. GB or US or up to 26 free format characters identifying the place of Letter of Credit expiry. If a 2 digit code is entered, then this is checked against the COUNTRY file for enrichment. Validation Rules: 2-26 S (Uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. If 2 digits are entered then this must be a valid country code from the COUNTRY file. If more than 2 digits are entered then any location can be specified. No input required for Collection.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExtArrId

        public void setExtArrId(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ExtArrId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: When an external arrangement is created as a result of availing a LC using AA Facility, then the arrangement ID created is stored in this field to identify the linked external arrangement and communicate future activities to the arrangement. This is a system updated field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExternalReference

        public void setExternalReference(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ExternalReference
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to display the Issuing Bank/Handling Bank/Customer reference for use on messages and advices. For Export LCs this is the Issuing Bank's reference. For outward collections this is the Customer's reference number and for inward collections this the Remitting Bank's reference number. For Inward MT730 the field will be populated with the value in Tag20 Validation Rules: 1-16 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Input only allowed for Collections and Export Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setExternalReference

        public void setExternalReference(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ExternalReference
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to display the Issuing Bank/Handling Bank/Customer reference for use on messages and advices. For Export LCs this is the Issuing Bank's reference. For outward collections this is the Customer's reference number and for inward collections this the Remitting Bank's reference number. For Inward MT730 the field will be populated with the value in Tag20 Validation Rules: 1-16 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. Input only allowed for Collections and Export Letters of Credit.

        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFixedCommAmt

        public void setFixedCommAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FixedCommAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the commission amount for each commission schedule. Amount expressed in the currency of the contract. If the user inputs a value in this field, then the default commission calculation will be ignored. User input field. Validations:

        Not allowed when COMM.RATE is input.

        Fixed commission amount must be less than LC face value.

        Input of value zero is not allowed.

        If user doesnt input any value in this field, system will default PERIODIC.COMM.AMT field of LC.GROUP.CONDITION defined for the periodic commission code in COMM.CODE field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFixedCommAmt

        public void setFixedCommAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FixedCommAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the commission amount for each commission schedule. Amount expressed in the currency of the contract. If the user inputs a value in this field, then the default commission calculation will be ignored. User input field. Validations:

        Not allowed when COMM.RATE is input.

        Fixed commission amount must be less than LC face value.

        Input of value zero is not allowed.

        If user doesnt input any value in this field, system will default PERIODIC.COMM.AMT field of LC.GROUP.CONDITION defined for the periodic commission code in COMM.CODE field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFullyUtilised

        public void setFullyUtilised(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FullyUtilised
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether this transaction is fully utilised. YES - fully utilised NO - not fully utilised If this field is set to YES then any drawings will require the override of a warning message. This field will default to NO. It may be set to YES in the following circumstances. - Manually during an amendment to the LC. - If a drawing has its FULLY.UTILISED field set to YES. - Automatically if the total of all drawings exceed the LC amount. Validation Rules: Optional input. Must be YES or NO. Default is NO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFullyUtilised

        public void setFullyUtilised(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FullyUtilised
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether this transaction is fully utilised. YES - fully utilised NO - not fully utilised If this field is set to YES then any drawings will require the override of a warning message. This field will default to NO. It may be set to YES in the following circumstances. - Manually during an amendment to the LC. - If a drawing has its FULLY.UTILISED field set to YES. - Automatically if the total of all drawings exceed the LC amount. Validation Rules: Optional input. Must be YES or NO. Default is NO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIbLimit

        public void setIbLimit(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IbLimit
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field decides whether to hit the limit at the stage of 'IO' for this LC Defaulted from IB.LIMT field of LC.PARAMETERS, user can overwrite the default value. Validation Rules: Allowed Values are YES or NO Value 'YES' will hit the limit at 'IO' stage in Internet Banking Value 'NO' will not hit the limit at 'IO' stage in Internet Banking Default value is 'NO'

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        public void setIbStatus(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IbStatus
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Field to indicate the status of LC request through internet banking. Validation Rules: Below are the allowed Values "Approved" if request is approved by Bank user To be updated by bank user. "Rejected" if request is rejected by Bank user To be updated by Bank user. "With Bank" System updated value at CIB side. If value selected is "Rejected" or "With Customer",then IB.BK.TO.CUST field is mandatory.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIncoTerms

        public void setIncoTerms(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IncoTerms
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Holds the terms of LC contract. Validation Rules: Allowed Values are CIF stands for COST,INSURANCE AND FREIGHT CFR stands for COST AND FREIGHT FOB stands for FREE ON BOARD FCA stands for FREE CARRIER FAS stands for FREE ALONGSIDE SHIP CPT stands for CARRIAGE PAID TO CIP stands for CARRIAGE AND INSURANCE PAID TO DAF stands for DELEIVERED AT FRONTIER DDP stands for DELIEVERED DUTY PAID DDU stands for DELIVERED DUTY UNPAID DES stands for DELIVERED EX SHIP DEQ stands for DELIVERED EX QUAY EXW stands for EX WORKS

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssueDate

        public void setIssueDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IssueDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the initial date of the contract i.e. the date the Letter of Credit is Issued/Advised/Confirmed. Can be prior to or after the deal input date. Should an unconfirmed export Letter of Credit subsequently be confirmed, this initial date will not change. All entries for contingent accounting/charges will be produced effective from this date. Validation Rules: Standard date Format. Mandatory Input (Default to Today).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssueDate

Should an unconfirmed export Letter of Credit subsequently be confirmed, this initial date will not change. All entries for contingent accounting/charges will be produced effective from this date. Validation Rules: Standard date Format. Mandatory Input (Default to Today).

      • setIssuingBank

        public void setIssuingBank(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified IssuingBank to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the Issuing Bank for an Export Letter of Credit and the Collecting Bank for an Outward Documentary Collection. Input is mandatory if the Bank in question is not a customer on the CUSTOMER file and the respective customer no. has not been inserted in the field ISSUING.BANK.NO. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed for Inward Documentation Collections / Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        param - the IssuingBank to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssuingBankAcc

        public void setIssuingBankAcc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IssuingBankAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input. Input to this field sets up the default account to be used for reimbursement from the Issuing Bank (in the case of a Export Letter of Credit) and the Collecting Bank (in the case of an Outward Documentary Collection). Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Should belong to the Issuing / Collecting Bank. Only allowed for Export Letters of Credit / Outward Documentary Collections. No input allowed for Inward Documentary Collections / Import Letters of Credit.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

Validation Rules: Standard Account Format. Should belong to the Issuing / Collecting Bank. Only allowed for Export Letters of Credit / Outward Documentary Collections. No input allowed for Inward Documentary Collections / Import Letters of Credit.

Validation Rules: Standard date format. Date cannot be greater than Expiry date. Input to this field is not allowed if field <SHIPMENT.PERIOD> has been used.

        nothing

      • setLcAmount

        public void setLcAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LcAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains the amount of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection which will always be expressed in the currency defined in the previous field (LC.CURRENCY). In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. In english language text this is accomplished by using a 'T' to denote thousands, and an 'M' to denote millions. Other languages will require the provision of translation values. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T = 1,000.00, 1M = 1,000,000.00, 1B = 1,000,000,000.00 Validation Rules: 2-16 type AMT (Standard amount format) characters. (Mandatory input) The amount must be greater than zero.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLcAmount

        public void setLcAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LcAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field contains the amount of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection which will always be expressed in the currency defined in the previous field (LC.CURRENCY). In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. In english language text this is accomplished by using a 'T' to denote thousands, and an 'M' to denote millions. Other languages will require the provision of translation values. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T = 1,000.00, 1M = 1,000,000.00, 1B = 1,000,000,000.00 Validation Rules: 2-16 type AMT (Standard amount format) characters. (Mandatory input) The amount must be greater than zero.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLcAmountLocal

        public void setLcAmountLocal(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LcAmountLocal
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. The value in this field contains the local currency equivalent of the liability amount mentioned in field <LIABILITY.AMT.>.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLcAmountLocal

        public void setLcAmountLocal(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LcAmountLocal
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. The value in this field contains the local currency equivalent of the liability amount mentioned in field <LIABILITY.AMT.>.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLcCurrency

        public void setLcCurrency(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LcCurrency
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the SWIFT currency code to denote the currency of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection. Will be used on all related correspondence. CRF entries are generated in this currency. Defaults to local currency. Validation Rules: SWIFT Currency code e.g. United States Dollars must be USD. (Mandatory input) Must exist on the CURRENCY file. Once the deal has been authorised, this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLcCurrency

        public void setLcCurrency(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LcCurrency
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the SWIFT currency code to denote the currency of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection. Will be used on all related correspondence. CRF entries are generated in this currency. Defaults to local currency. Validation Rules: SWIFT Currency code e.g. United States Dollars must be USD. (Mandatory input) Must exist on the CURRENCY file. Once the deal has been authorised, this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Field description: This field holds the rate between LC.CURRENCY and local currency. This is a NOINPUT field.

        Field description: This field holds the rate between LC.CURRENCY and local currency. This is a NOINPUT field.

      • setLcType

        public void setLcType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LcType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the type of Trade Finance contract from the LC.TYPES file. The type will identify whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable lc etc... If the type input is a Documentary Collection, then this will impact on the processing performed, and some of the other input fields' meanings. The value entered must be a valid record on the LC.TYPES file and will be used to determine which kind of processing is required for the various combinations of Import/Confirmed/Usance etc. Validation Rules: For any parent transferred LC, which has already been transferred the LC.TYPE cannot be changed. (L/C transaction has already had the child L/C number associated to). A child is not be allowed to transfer to another child l/c and therefore the child LC.TYPE cannot be transferrable.. 3-4 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. (Mandatory input) Must be present on the LC.TYPES file.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLcType

        public void setLcType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LcType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the type of Trade Finance contract from the LC.TYPES file. The type will identify whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable lc etc... If the type input is a Documentary Collection, then this will impact on the processing performed, and some of the other input fields' meanings. The value entered must be a valid record on the LC.TYPES file and will be used to determine which kind of processing is required for the various combinations of Import/Confirmed/Usance etc. Validation Rules: For any parent transferred LC, which has already been transferred the LC.TYPE cannot be changed. (L/C transaction has already had the child L/C number associated to). A child is not be allowed to transfer to another child l/c and therefore the child LC.TYPE cannot be transferrable.. 3-4 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. (Mandatory input) Must be present on the LC.TYPES file.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLiabilityAmt

        public void setLiabilityAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LiabilityAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total liability amount in respect of each individual issued or confirmed letters of credit. Used as a running total of the remaining credit amount available after all current drawings (if any) have been made under the letter of credit. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY). When the letter of credit/documentary collection is input this field will contain either the LC.AMOUNT, or the MAXIMUM.CR.AMT, or the LC amount plus any tolerance indicated in field <PERCENTAGE.CR.AMT>.and any amount entered in the field <ADD.COVERED.AMOUNT>. Whenever drawings are entered, this amount is reduced by the amount of the drawing, so at any stage the total credit amount remaining will be shown by this field. This field also represents the undrawn balance of an unconfirmed letter of credit and the unpaid balance of a documentary collection. The contingent CRF entry will be updated by this field for all live letters of credit, to show the total liability amount.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLiabilityAmt

        public void setLiabilityAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LiabilityAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total liability amount in respect of each individual issued or confirmed letters of credit. Used as a running total of the remaining credit amount available after all current drawings (if any) have been made under the letter of credit. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY). When the letter of credit/documentary collection is input this field will contain either the LC.AMOUNT, or the MAXIMUM.CR.AMT, or the LC amount plus any tolerance indicated in field <PERCENTAGE.CR.AMT>.and any amount entered in the field <ADD.COVERED.AMOUNT>. Whenever drawings are entered, this amount is reduced by the amount of the drawing, so at any stage the total credit amount remaining will be shown by this field. This field also represents the undrawn balance of an unconfirmed letter of credit and the unpaid balance of a documentary collection. The contingent CRF entry will be updated by this field for all live letters of credit, to show the total liability amount.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLimitUpdate

        public void setLimitUpdate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LimitUpdate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Holds the value updated from the LC.AMENDMENTS application. It is based on this field, the second Limit line for the LC.AMENDMENT is hit or reversed. Validation Rules: (1) System maintained. Updated from LC.AMENDMENT application.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLimitUpdate

        public void setLimitUpdate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LimitUpdate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Holds the value updated from the LC.AMENDMENTS application. It is based on this field, the second Limit line for the LC.AMENDMENT is hit or reversed. Validation Rules: (1) System maintained. Updated from LC.AMENDMENT application.

        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLimitWithProv

        public void setLimitWithProv(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LimitWithProv
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This value is defaulted from the Parameter. When set to YES, the Limit is impacted net of the Provision taken if any and when set to NO, irrespective of the Provision taken the limit is impacted for the Liability amount. E.g. When a Letter of Credit is opened for USD 100,000.00 and a Provision of USD 50,000 is taken, the impact of the limit line would be for: USD 50,000 when LIMIT.WITH.PROV is set to YES USD 100,000 when LIMIT.WITH.PROV is set to NO. Validation Rules: Valid input is YES or NO. Input cannot be changed even at INAU.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLimitWithProv

        public void setLimitWithProv(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LimitWithProv
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This value is defaulted from the Parameter. When set to YES, the Limit is impacted net of the Provision taken if any and when set to NO, irrespective of the Provision taken the limit is impacted for the Liability amount. E.g. When a Letter of Credit is opened for USD 100,000.00 and a Provision of USD 50,000 is taken, the impact of the limit line would be for: USD 50,000 when LIMIT.WITH.PROV is set to YES USD 100,000 when LIMIT.WITH.PROV is set to NO. Validation Rules: Valid input is YES or NO. Input cannot be changed even at INAU.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLmtForRevolving

        public void setLmtForRevolving(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LmtForRevolving
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: In the case of Revolving Non-Cumulative Letters of Credit, the limit can be impacted only for the current revolution, by setting this field to SINGLE. The consol entry also would be raised for the current cycle's liability. The default would be NULL, retaining the extant flow. If an LC were to be issued for USD 150,000 for 2 revolutions, the limit would be impacted for USD 450,000 and consol entry would be raised for USD 450,000. By setting this to SINGLE, the limit would be impacted for USD 150,000 and this would also be the amount of consol entry. During the roll-over the new limit line and the consol entry would be raised as a part of End of Day processing. However, if Cash Margin (Provision) were to be taken under this LC, the same would be calculated on the entire Liability of the LC and not just for the Current cycle's liability as populated in CUR.REVOL.LIAB. Validation Rules: Valid input is SINGLE. Input permitted only if the LC is revolving and non-cumulative in nature.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLmtForRevolving

        public void setLmtForRevolving(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LmtForRevolving
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: In the case of Revolving Non-Cumulative Letters of Credit, the limit can be impacted only for the current revolution, by setting this field to SINGLE. The consol entry also would be raised for the current cycle's liability. The default would be NULL, retaining the extant flow. If an LC were to be issued for USD 150,000 for 2 revolutions, the limit would be impacted for USD 450,000 and consol entry would be raised for USD 450,000. By setting this to SINGLE, the limit would be impacted for USD 150,000 and this would also be the amount of consol entry. During the roll-over the new limit line and the consol entry would be raised as a part of End of Day processing. However, if Cash Margin (Provision) were to be taken under this LC, the same would be calculated on the entire Liability of the LC and not just for the Current cycle's liability as populated in CUR.REVOL.LIAB. Validation Rules: Valid input is SINGLE. Input permitted only if the LC is revolving and non-cumulative in nature.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMaximumCrAmt

        public void setMaximumCrAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for MaximumCrAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to specify the users preferred choice to indicate that the l/c amount indicated in field <LC.AMOUNT> is a maximum. This field reflects the options available under S.W.I.F.T. specifications. Validation Rules: 13 type Alphanumeric characters. Can only be entered if the field <PERCENTAGE.CR.AMT> is blank. Validate input terms are: UP.TO, MAXIMUM, or NOT EXCEEDING. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMaximumCrAmt

        public void setMaximumCrAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for MaximumCrAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to specify the users preferred choice to indicate that the l/c amount indicated in field <LC.AMOUNT> is a maximum. This field reflects the options available under S.W.I.F.T. specifications. Validation Rules: 13 type Alphanumeric characters. Can only be entered if the field <PERCENTAGE.CR.AMT> is blank. Validate input terms are: UP.TO, MAXIMUM, or NOT EXCEEDING. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing
