      • setMt759AltRefNumber

        public void setMt759AltRefNumber(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759AltRefNumber
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If the user intends to send a MT759 for an amendment or for a drawing record then this field is used to specify the reference of the LC.AMENDMENTS or the DRAWINGS record. Should be a valid @ID from LC.AMENDMENTS and DRAWINGS. Allowed input only when Operation is M. This field will be mapped to Tag 20 of the MT759. Validation Rules: Should be a valid @ID from LC.AMENDMENTS and DRAWINGS. This field must not start or end with a slash '/' and must not contain two consecutive slashes '//'

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMt759AltRefNumber

        public void setMt759AltRefNumber(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759AltRefNumber
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If the user intends to send a MT759 for an amendment or for a drawing record then this field is used to specify the reference of the LC.AMENDMENTS or the DRAWINGS record. Should be a valid @ID from LC.AMENDMENTS and DRAWINGS. Allowed input only when Operation is M. This field will be mapped to Tag 20 of the MT759. Validation Rules: Should be a valid @ID from LC.AMENDMENTS and DRAWINGS. This field must not start or end with a slash '/' and must not contain two consecutive slashes '//'

      • setMt759FormOfUndk

        public void setMt759FormOfUndk(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759FormOfUndk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the type of instrument. Field will be mapped against Tag 22D of Outward and Inward MT759 messages. Mandatory field for a MT759 message. Input in this field is applicable only for Operation - M. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes as under Allowed Codes are: i. DOCR - Documentary Credit ii. STBY - Standby Letter of Credit iii.UNDK - Undertaking Validation Rules: i. If MT759.FUNCTION is ISSUANCE, REQISSUE, REQAMEND, or ISSAMEND then field MT759.FORM.OF.UNDK must contain UNDK ii. If MT759.FUNCTION is TRANSFER then field MT759.FORM.OF.UNDK must contain STBY or UNDK

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMt759FormOfUndk

        public void setMt759FormOfUndk(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759FormOfUndk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the type of instrument. Field will be mapped against Tag 22D of Outward and Inward MT759 messages. Mandatory field for a MT759 message. Input in this field is applicable only for Operation - M. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes as under Allowed Codes are: i. DOCR - Documentary Credit ii. STBY - Standby Letter of Credit iii.UNDK - Undertaking Validation Rules: i. If MT759.FUNCTION is ISSUANCE, REQISSUE, REQAMEND, or ISSAMEND then field MT759.FORM.OF.UNDK must contain UNDK ii. If MT759.FUNCTION is TRANSFER then field MT759.FORM.OF.UNDK must contain STBY or UNDK

      • setMt759Function

        public void setMt759Function(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759Function
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the type of request or function of the message. Field will be mapped against Tag 23H of the MT759 message. Mandatory field to generate a MT759 message. Input allowed only when operation is M. Permitted Codes are: i. CLSVCLOS - Closing of client service call by Trade Operations ii. CLSVOPEN - Opening of client service call by Trade Operations iii. FRAUDMSG - Advice of a fraud attempt iv. GENINFAD - General information advice v. ISSAMEND - Amendment of a free-form undertaking such as a dependent guarantee vi. ISSUANCE - Issue of a free-form undertaking such as a dependent guarantee vii. OTHERFNC - Other request viii.REIMBURS - Request related to a reimbursement ix. REQAMEND - Request to amend an undertaking x. REQFINAN - Financing request xi. REQISSUE - Request to issue an undertaking xii. TRANSFER - Transfer of a undertaking Validation Rules: i. ISSUANCE, REQISSUE, REQAMEND, or ISSAMEND then field 22D must contain UNDK ii. TRANSFER then field 22D must contain STBY, or UNDK

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMt759Function

        public void setMt759Function(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759Function
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the type of request or function of the message. Field will be mapped against Tag 23H of the MT759 message. Mandatory field to generate a MT759 message. Input allowed only when operation is M. Permitted Codes are: i. CLSVCLOS - Closing of client service call by Trade Operations ii. CLSVOPEN - Opening of client service call by Trade Operations iii. FRAUDMSG - Advice of a fraud attempt iv. GENINFAD - General information advice v. ISSAMEND - Amendment of a free-form undertaking such as a dependent guarantee vi. ISSUANCE - Issue of a free-form undertaking such as a dependent guarantee vii. OTHERFNC - Other request viii.REIMBURS - Request related to a reimbursement ix. REQAMEND - Request to amend an undertaking x. REQFINAN - Financing request xi. REQISSUE - Request to issue an undertaking xii. TRANSFER - Transfer of a undertaking Validation Rules: i. ISSUANCE, REQISSUE, REQAMEND, or ISSAMEND then field 22D must contain UNDK ii. TRANSFER then field 22D must contain STBY, or UNDK

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMt759Narrative

        public void setMt759Narrative(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified Mt759Narrative to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Free text field that allows the user to input the details of the request or the information. Input allowed only when operation is 'M' This field will be mapped against the tag 45D of a MT759 message. Format : 150*65z ( of 8 sequences) Accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters System auto populates 'Tag 27 - Sequence of Total' based on the number of MT759 messages generated. Only upto 8 sequences allowed(i.e. 8/8). This field allows to input a maximum of 1200 lines of 65 characters(Z character set). For each of the 150 lines, T24 generates multiple MT759 messages and a maximum of upto 8/8 sequence of messages can generated. Mandatory field for a MT759 message. Validation Rules: The number of lines in this field cannot exceed 1200.

        Parameters:
        param - the Mt759Narrative to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMt759Narrative

        public void setMt759Narrative(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified Mt759Narrative to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Free text field that allows the user to input the details of the request or the information. Input allowed only when operation is 'M' This field will be mapped against the tag 45D of a MT759 message. Format : 150*65z ( of 8 sequences) Accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters System auto populates 'Tag 27 - Sequence of Total' based on the number of MT759 messages generated. Only upto 8 sequences allowed(i.e. 8/8). This field allows to input a maximum of 1200 lines of 65 characters(Z character set). For each of the 150 lines, T24 generates multiple MT759 messages and a maximum of upto 8/8 sequence of messages can generated. Mandatory field for a MT759 message. Validation Rules: The number of lines in this field cannot exceed 1200.

        Parameters:
        param - the Mt759Narrative to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMt759RecvBank

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to specify the Receiver of the MT759 message. It holds a valid Customer ID. Should be a valid Bank in T24. Mandatory input in MT759 message. (User to ensure that a valid DE.BIC is defined for this bank). Input in this field is applicable only for Operation - M.

      • setMt759RecvRef

        public void setMt759RecvRef(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759RecvRef
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to represent a reference number which is meaningful to the Receiver, for example, the reference number of a previously sent acknowledgement. This field will be mapped with the Tag 21 and this is an optional field in MT759. This field must not start or end with slash / and must not contain two consecutive slashes //. Input in this field is applicable only for Operation - M.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMt759RecvRef

        public void setMt759RecvRef(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Mt759RecvRef
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to represent a reference number which is meaningful to the Receiver, for example, the reference number of a previously sent acknowledgement. This field will be mapped with the Tag 21 and this is an optional field in MT759. This field must not start or end with slash / and must not contain two consecutive slashes //. Input in this field is applicable only for Operation - M.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNarrative

        public void setNarrative(NarrativeClass param, int idx)
        Set the specified Narrative to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        param - the Narrative to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNarrativeChrgs

        public void setNarrativeChrgs(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified NarrativeChrgs to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This free text field is used to specify charges to be borne by the beneficiary(71D) when an LC is issued. If modified during an amendment(Operation A), this field specifies any changes to the charges(71D) borne by the beneficiary. Validation Rules: Optional Input 6*35 Alphanumeric with X characters. Also, accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/710/720/740 is generated Defaults standard text - All charges outside (Applicant's Country) are for the account of Beneficiary' for import LC's.

        Parameters:
        param - the NarrativeChrgs to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNarrativeChrgs

        public void setNarrativeChrgs(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This free text field is used to specify charges to be borne by the beneficiary(71D) when an LC is issued. Also, accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT700/710/720/740 is generated Defaults standard text - All charges outside (Applicant's Country) are for the account of Beneficiary' for import LC's.

      • setNegWithBank

        public void setNegWithBank(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified NegWithBank to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field allows input of drawer of the drafts, to be drawn on the reimbursing bank, when the drawer is the negotiating bank. The value present in this field is populated in Tag 58a of MT740 Validation Rules: Valid Customer number or BIC Code. 1-4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters.

        Parameters:
        param - the NegWithBank to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNextDrawing

        public void setNextDrawing(TField value)
        Set the specified value for NextDrawing
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the number of the next drawing that will be made under the letter of credit. 01 is defaulted if there are no drawings against the L/C.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNextDrawing

        public void setNextDrawing(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for NextDrawing
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the number of the next drawing that will be made under the letter of credit. 01 is defaulted if there are no drawings against the L/C.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNoOfRevolving

        public void setNoOfRevolving(TField value)
        Set the specified value for NoOfRevolving
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the number of times the letter of credit will revolve. Example: A letter of credit is issued for US$50,000.00 and the NO.OF.REVOLVING field shows an input of '3'. This indicates that the letter of credit will be revolved three times. The liability will show an outstanding of USD200,000 (i.e. the initial US$50,000 plus US$150,000 [US$50,000 revolved 3 times]). In the case of an export revolving letter of credit which has been transferred; any amendment (operation 'A') to the field NO.OF.REVOLVING will be checked against that of the transferred letter of credit. If the proposed number change does not support the transfer already effected then it will not be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 alphanumeric characters.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNoOfRevolving

        public void setNoOfRevolving(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for NoOfRevolving
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the number of times the letter of credit will revolve. Example: A letter of credit is issued for US$50,000.00 and the NO.OF.REVOLVING field shows an input of '3'. This indicates that the letter of credit will be revolved three times. The liability will show an outstanding of USD200,000 (i.e. the initial US$50,000 plus US$150,000 [US$50,000 revolved 3 times]). In the case of an export revolving letter of credit which has been transferred; any amendment (operation 'A') to the field NO.OF.REVOLVING will be checked against that of the transferred letter of credit. If the proposed number change does not support the transfer already effected then it will not be allowed. Validation Rules: 3 alphanumeric characters.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNopayReason

        public void setNopayReason(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified NopayReason to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to map 77A tag in MT416 message (Inward as well as outward). Validation Rules Allowed to input only when MT416 is set in SEND.COLL.MSG field. Allowed to input only during amendment of LC record. Not allowed to input if drawings are present under the Collection. Not allowed if LC is already fully utilised. Should not be more than 20 lines.

        Parameters:
        param - the NopayReason to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

        nothing

      • setOperation

        public void setOperation(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Operation
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. The following codes are valid: O - Open new Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, P - Preadvise new Letter of Credit contract, A - Amend an existing Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, C - Direct charge processing for an existing contract, T - Trace existing Documentary Collection contract, D - Decision on an Amendment, M - Ancillary Trade Structured Message. Operation 'C' provides the operator with the ability to either record a new charge or amend (not cancel or write-off) a previously input charge. Operation 'C' also displays all uncollected charges (having null status) in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES, which are available to the operator to amend. However, keeping the status unchanged at null will enable the system to rewrite the charges back in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES. To ensure that no fee/charges are accidentally deleted or 'lost' from the system, once a charge set has been input, it cannot be deleted. However such a charge can be written off in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES. When accessed the contract will be shown with all relevant fields in their amended state, except charges set. When using 'T' trace, an MT420 will be produced and the next process date will have to be modified. Operation D is used when a decision on a Pending Amendment is to be taken as either Approved or Rejected. Use of this option opens up AMEND.NO and AMEND.STATUS. to use this the Letter of Credit has to be previously authorised in its O status. Operation M is used to send an Ancillary Trade Structured Message MT759. User can send a MT759 for a LC contract, LC Amendment or a Drawing contract. During this operation, input to other fields are not allowed other than the related MT759 fields. This operation is allowed only for an existing contract.

        Validation Rules: Mandatory input. For a new contract the following are valid: O - open, P - pre-advise For an existing contract the following are valid: A - amend, C - direct charge, T - trace (collections only), D decision, M - Miscellaneous Message For D operation, the Letter of Credit must be previously authorised as O, should not be of a Mixed payment or Revolving type or a Collection Document.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOperation

        public void setOperation(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Operation
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. The following codes are valid: O - Open new Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, P - Preadvise new Letter of Credit contract, A - Amend an existing Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection contract, C - Direct charge processing for an existing contract, T - Trace existing Documentary Collection contract, D - Decision on an Amendment, M - Ancillary Trade Structured Message. Operation 'C' provides the operator with the ability to either record a new charge or amend (not cancel or write-off) a previously input charge. Operation 'C' also displays all uncollected charges (having null status) in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES, which are available to the operator to amend. However, keeping the status unchanged at null will enable the system to rewrite the charges back in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES. To ensure that no fee/charges are accidentally deleted or 'lost' from the system, once a charge set has been input, it cannot be deleted. However such a charge can be written off in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES. When accessed the contract will be shown with all relevant fields in their amended state, except charges set. When using 'T' trace, an MT420 will be produced and the next process date will have to be modified. Operation D is used when a decision on a Pending Amendment is to be taken as either Approved or Rejected. Use of this option opens up AMEND.NO and AMEND.STATUS. to use this the Letter of Credit has to be previously authorised in its O status. Operation M is used to send an Ancillary Trade Structured Message MT759. User can send a MT759 for a LC contract, LC Amendment or a Drawing contract. During this operation, input to other fields are not allowed other than the related MT759 fields. This operation is allowed only for an existing contract.

        Validation Rules: Mandatory input. For a new contract the following are valid: O - open, P - pre-advise For an existing contract the following are valid: A - amend, C - direct charge, T - trace (collections only), D decision, M - Miscellaneous Message For D operation, the Letter of Credit must be previously authorised as O, should not be of a Mixed payment or Revolving type or a Collection Document.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOscollectNo

        public void setOscollectNo(TField value)
        Set the specified value for OscollectNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total number of outstanding drawings sent for 'collection' under the letter of credit. When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new drawing sent for 'collection' (drawing type of 'CO' is entered via the DRAWINGS application for this LC), the field will be increased by 1. Note: When a drawing that has been sent for collection is subsequently changed to a 'SP', 'AC', or 'DP', then this field is decreased by 1.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOscollectNo

        public void setOscollectNo(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for OscollectNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total number of outstanding drawings sent for 'collection' under the letter of credit. When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a new drawing sent for 'collection' (drawing type of 'CO' is entered via the DRAWINGS application for this LC), the field will be increased by 1. Note: When a drawing that has been sent for collection is subsequently changed to a 'SP', 'AC', or 'DP', then this field is decreased by 1.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOscollectVal

        public void setOscollectVal(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for OscollectVal
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total value of documents sent for 'collection' under a letter of credit which remain outstanding. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY). When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a set of documents are sent for collection (drawing type of 'CO' is entered via the DRAWINGS application), then this field will be increased by the amount of the drawing. Note: When a drawing that has been sent for 'collection' is subsequently changed to a 'SP', 'AC', or 'DP', then this field is reduced by the amount of the drawing.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOscollectVal

        public void setOscollectVal(TField value)
        Set the specified value for OscollectVal
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field identifies the total value of documents sent for 'collection' under a letter of credit which remain outstanding. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY). When a new deal is input, this field will contain 0. Whenever a set of documents are sent for collection (drawing type of 'CO' is entered via the DRAWINGS application), then this field will be increased by the amount of the drawing. Note: When a drawing that has been sent for 'collection' is subsequently changed to a 'SP', 'AC', or 'DP', then this field is reduced by the amount of the drawing.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

Whenever a new term or usance drawing (drawing with type 'AC', or 'DP') is entered via the DRAWINGS application, then this field will be increased by 1.

        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

      • setParentLcNo

        public void setParentLcNo(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ParentLcNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is applicable to transferred child L/C(s) input only. The <PARENT.LC.NO> is the T24 transaction reference for parent L/C. When inputting the child L/C(s) record, the parent L/C number has to be put in this field. so that the serial updating control can be maintained in the parent L/C record. The details of the parent L/C can be retrieved for use in the child L/C record(s). For example: Example - The parent L/C is a sight credit and partial shipments allowed (i.e. in which case, multi-transfer under this L/C can be effected.). It has been input in T24 under reference TF0005200001 with following extract: Date of Issue: 06-Mar-00 Expiry Date: 06-Jun-00 Place of Expiry: Germany Applicant: PO Box 888, Bangkok, Thailand Beneficiary: German Mechanical Ltd., PO Box 999, Hamburg, Germany. Amount: USD600,000 Available With: Any Bank By Payment Draft At: Sight Shipment Latest: 16-May-00 Shipment: 1,000 sets of washing machine and accessories. FOB Singapore Against presentation of the following documents: +Signed Commercial Invoice in five-fold +Full set clean on board Ocean Bills of Lading made out to the order and blank endorsed marked "Freight Collect" evidencing shipment of the above merchandise. +Packing List in five-fold Documents are to be presented within 21 days after the date of issuance of the shipping documents. The advising bank may add its confirmation to the credit. Shipment will be from Singapore to Bangkok, Thailand Transshipment is allowed Partial shipment is allowed Against presentation of the following documents: +Signed Commercial Invoice in five-fold +Full set clean on board Ocean Bills of Lading made out to the order and blank endorsed marked "Freight Collect" evidencing shipment of the above merchandise. +Packing List in five-fold Documents are to be presented within 21 days after the date of issuance of the shipping documents. The advising bank may add its confirmation to the credit. Shipment will be from Singapore to Bangkok, Thailand Transshipment is allowed Partial shipment is allowed Now, the 1st beneficiary requests to transfer above L/C to A Co. and B Co. for USD250,000 and USD200,000 respectively. When input the Child L/C(s), TF0005200001 has to be input in <Field 34>, then the details in above extract would be retrieved in the child L/C records, except the Applicant of which it would be replaced by the 1st beneficiary automatically. As usual, the expiry date, shipment date and days of presentation may be reduced according to 1st beneficiary's request. After committing the Child L/C(s), let us say TF0005300001 and TF0005300002, the fields <TRANSFERRED.LC> and <TRAN.PORT.AMT> in the parent L/C record will be updated accordingly as below: TRANSFERRED.LC TF0005300001 TRAN.PORT.AMT.. 250,000 TRANSFERRED.LC. TF0005300002 TRAN.PORT.AMT.. 200,000 Validation Rules: Only valid Letter of Credit record allowed

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setParentLcNo

        public void setParentLcNo(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ParentLcNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is applicable to transferred child L/C(s) input only. The <PARENT.LC.NO> is the T24 transaction reference for parent L/C. When inputting the child L/C(s) record, the parent L/C number has to be put in this field. so that the serial updating control can be maintained in the parent L/C record. The details of the parent L/C can be retrieved for use in the child L/C record(s). For example: Example - The parent L/C is a sight credit and partial shipments allowed (i.e. in which case, multi-transfer under this L/C can be effected.). It has been input in T24 under reference TF0005200001 with following extract: Date of Issue: 06-Mar-00 Expiry Date: 06-Jun-00 Place of Expiry: Germany Applicant: PO Box 888, Bangkok, Thailand Beneficiary: German Mechanical Ltd., PO Box 999, Hamburg, Germany. Amount: USD600,000 Available With: Any Bank By Payment Draft At: Sight Shipment Latest: 16-May-00 Shipment: 1,000 sets of washing machine and accessories. FOB Singapore Against presentation of the following documents: +Signed Commercial Invoice in five-fold +Full set clean on board Ocean Bills of Lading made out to the order and blank endorsed marked "Freight Collect" evidencing shipment of the above merchandise. +Packing List in five-fold Documents are to be presented within 21 days after the date of issuance of the shipping documents. The advising bank may add its confirmation to the credit. Shipment will be from Singapore to Bangkok, Thailand Transshipment is allowed Partial shipment is allowed Against presentation of the following documents: +Signed Commercial Invoice in five-fold +Full set clean on board Ocean Bills of Lading made out to the order and blank endorsed marked "Freight Collect" evidencing shipment of the above merchandise. +Packing List in five-fold Documents are to be presented within 21 days after the date of issuance of the shipping documents. The advising bank may add its confirmation to the credit. Shipment will be from Singapore to Bangkok, Thailand Transshipment is allowed Partial shipment is allowed Now, the 1st beneficiary requests to transfer above L/C to A Co. and B Co. for USD250,000 and USD200,000 respectively. When input the Child L/C(s), TF0005200001 has to be input in <Field 34>, then the details in above extract would be retrieved in the child L/C records, except the Applicant of which it would be replaced by the 1st beneficiary automatically. As usual, the expiry date, shipment date and days of presentation may be reduced according to 1st beneficiary's request. After committing the Child L/C(s), let us say TF0005300001 and TF0005300002, the fields <TRANSFERRED.LC> and <TRAN.PORT.AMT> in the parent L/C record will be updated accordingly as below: TRANSFERRED.LC TF0005300001 TRAN.PORT.AMT.. 250,000 TRANSFERRED.LC. TF0005300002 TRAN.PORT.AMT.. 200,000 Validation Rules: Only valid Letter of Credit record allowed

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPartShipCode

        public void setPartShipCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PartShipCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies if part shipments are allowed under the terms of the Letter of Credit. Part shipments is used in the production of messages/advices to specify whether part shipments are allowed or not under the terms of the Letter of Credit. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes Allowed codes are ALLOWED - Allowed under the documentary credit. CONDITIONAL - Conditional based on conditions specified elsewhere in the message. NOT ALLOWED - Not allowed under the documentary credit. Override generated to alert the user to specify the condition when the code chosen is CONDITIONAL.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPartShipCode

        public void setPartShipCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PartShipCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies if part shipments are allowed under the terms of the Letter of Credit. Part shipments is used in the production of messages/advices to specify whether part shipments are allowed or not under the terms of the Letter of Credit. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes Allowed codes are ALLOWED - Allowed under the documentary credit. CONDITIONAL - Conditional based on conditions specified elsewhere in the message. NOT ALLOWED - Not allowed under the documentary credit. Override generated to alert the user to specify the condition when the code chosen is CONDITIONAL.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        public void setPendDecMvmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PendDecMvmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the total of all negative amount from all pending Amendments for the LC. Validation Rules: (1) NO INPUT Field . (2) This Field is automatically updated by adding up the decrease of Liability Amount on decision of each Amendment.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setPercentageCrAmt

        public void setPercentageCrAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PercentageCrAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to define the percentage to be added to the letter of credit amount (LC.AMOUNT) to calculate the full liability amount or maximum amount that can be drawn. If a rate is specified here, then it is used to calculate the liability amount of the letter of credit by adding the percentage of the LC.AMOUNT to the LC.AMOUNT. Example: If the LC.AMOUNT = 1,000,000.00 and the percentage entered here = 10, then the LIABILITY.AMOUNT will be equal to 1,100,000.00. Validation Rules: Standard rate format (Only up to 6 integer and decimal characters). If this field is entered, then MAXIMUM.CR.AMT must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPercentageCrAmt

        public void setPercentageCrAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PercentageCrAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to define the percentage to be added to the letter of credit amount (LC.AMOUNT) to calculate the full liability amount or maximum amount that can be drawn. If a rate is specified here, then it is used to calculate the liability amount of the letter of credit by adding the percentage of the LC.AMOUNT to the LC.AMOUNT. Example: If the LC.AMOUNT = 1,000,000.00 and the percentage entered here = 10, then the LIABILITY.AMOUNT will be equal to 1,100,000.00. Validation Rules: Standard rate format (Only up to 6 integer and decimal characters). If this field is entered, then MAXIMUM.CR.AMT must be left blank.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPercentageDrAmt

        public void setPercentageDrAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PercentageDrAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the negative tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount as a percentage. Example: If the LC.AMOUNT = $1,000,000.00 and the percentage entered here = 10, then the minimum drawing expected under this letter of credit is $900,000.00 and the maximum is $1,000,000.00. The LIABILITY.AMOUNT will be equal to $1,000,000.00. Validation Rules: Standard rate format (Only up to 6 integer and decimal characters).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPercentageDrAmt

        public void setPercentageDrAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PercentageDrAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the negative tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount as a percentage. Example: If the LC.AMOUNT = $1,000,000.00 and the percentage entered here = 10, then the minimum drawing expected under this letter of credit is $900,000.00 and the maximum is $1,000,000.00. The LIABILITY.AMOUNT will be equal to $1,000,000.00. Validation Rules: Standard rate format (Only up to 6 integer and decimal characters).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPortNoAppIss

        public void setPortNoAppIss(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PortNoAppIss
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the customer portfolio number to which this letter of contract will be associated with. This will be used for the portfolio valuation either for the APPLICANT.CUSTNO or the ISSUING.BANK.NO fields. On Import LCs the APPLICANT.CUSTNO field will be used here and for Export LCs the ISSUING.BANK.NO field will be used in the Portfolio Valuation. The amount of the letter of credit less the drawings will be used to update the Portfolio as a NEGATIVE amount, i.e. will be treated similar to a Loan. No input will result in this deal being excluded from the portfolio valuation. Validation Rules: Up to 3 characters numeric. (Optional input)

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPortNoAppIss

        public void setPortNoAppIss(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PortNoAppIss
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the customer portfolio number to which this letter of contract will be associated with. This will be used for the portfolio valuation either for the APPLICANT.CUSTNO or the ISSUING.BANK.NO fields. On Import LCs the APPLICANT.CUSTNO field will be used here and for Export LCs the ISSUING.BANK.NO field will be used in the Portfolio Valuation. The amount of the letter of credit less the drawings will be used to update the Portfolio as a NEGATIVE amount, i.e. will be treated similar to a Loan. No input will result in this deal being excluded from the portfolio valuation. Validation Rules: Up to 3 characters numeric. (Optional input)

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPresentDayPeriod

        public void setPresentDayPeriod(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PresentDayPeriod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field represents the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. Format specification - 3n[/]35x]. 3n - specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. 35x - Narrative must only be used to specify another type of date than a shipment date, for example invoice date, from which the period for presentation begins. If user inputs only 3n in this field, then as per swift, it is construed to be number of days from the shipment date. In case of a different narrative, other than 'days from shipment date' then the user must explicitly input field. If Presentation days under PRESENT.DAY.PERIOD and Latest shipment date is defined, advice expiry date will be calculated based on Latest shipment date plus Presentation Days for import LC's. An override is raised when ADVICE.EXPIRY.DATE is less than LATEST.SHIPMENT plus Presentation Days.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPresentDayPeriod

        public void setPresentDayPeriod(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PresentDayPeriod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field represents the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. Format specification - 3n[/]35x]. 3n - specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. 35x - Narrative must only be used to specify another type of date than a shipment date, for example invoice date, from which the period for presentation begins. If user inputs only 3n in this field, then as per swift, it is construed to be number of days from the shipment date. In case of a different narrative, other than 'days from shipment date' then the user must explicitly input field. If Presentation days under PRESENT.DAY.PERIOD and Latest shipment date is defined, advice expiry date will be calculated based on Latest shipment date plus Presentation Days for import LC's. An override is raised when ADVICE.EXPIRY.DATE is less than LATEST.SHIPMENT plus Presentation Days.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPresentPeriod

        public void setPresentPeriod(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified PresentPeriod to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices this field specifies the number of days after the date of issuance of the transports document(s) within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. When presentation days is defined for import LC, system will default standard text 'Documents must be present within (Presentation Days) from the date of shipment but before the expiry of credit'. Validation Rules: 35 type Alphanumeric characters. Optional input (if left blank UCP rules apply) Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        param - the PresentPeriod to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProAwaitRel

        public void setProAwaitRel(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProAwaitRel
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the Provision amount awaiting to be released. This is the provision amount that is pending to be released on the maturity date of the ACCEPTANCE DRAWINGS. This is the sum total of all provision amounts awaiting release. When an acceptance drawing is matured from AC to MA or a DP is matured to MD manually, the provision amount awaiting release will be released on line. If AC or DP is not changed to MA or MD manually, then the EOD (End Of Day) operation will change the status and release the provision amount.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProAwaitRel

        public void setProAwaitRel(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProAwaitRel
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays the Provision amount awaiting to be released. This is the provision amount that is pending to be released on the maturity date of the ACCEPTANCE DRAWINGS. This is the sum total of all provision amounts awaiting release. When an acceptance drawing is matured from AC to MA or a DP is matured to MD manually, the provision amount awaiting release will be released on line. If AC or DP is not changed to MA or MD manually, then the EOD (End Of Day) operation will change the status and release the provision amount.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProOutAmount

        public void setProOutAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProOutAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field represents the provision amount outstanding for the transaction. When a sight DRAWING is processed, the provision released will be deducted from the outstanding provision amount. When an acceptance DRAWING is processed, this field will not be affected. However, PRO.AWAIT.REL will be stored with the released amount, pending to be released on maturity date of the acceptance DRAWING.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProOutAmount

        public void setProOutAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProOutAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field represents the provision amount outstanding for the transaction. When a sight DRAWING is processed, the provision released will be deducted from the outstanding provision amount. When an acceptance DRAWING is processed, this field will not be affected. However, PRO.AWAIT.REL will be stored with the released amount, pending to be released on maturity date of the acceptance DRAWING.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProductType

        public void setProductType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProductType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field accepts product type 'LCE' or 'LCI' depending upon the LETTER.OF.CREDIT type(Import or Export). Validation Rules: For Import LC - Product type should be 'LCI'. For Export LC - Product type should be 'LCE'. Product type LCI or LCE should be defined in Facility.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProductType

        public void setProductType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProductType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field accepts product type 'LCE' or 'LCI' depending upon the LETTER.OF.CREDIT type(Import or Export). Validation Rules: For Import LC - Product type should be 'LCI'. For Export LC - Product type should be 'LCE'. Product type LCI or LCE should be defined in Facility.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvCalcBase

        public void setProvCalcBase(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProvCalcBase
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description:

        Determines whether provision has to be calculated on LC face value or liability amount. For example,

        Example 1

        LC Amount 100,000; Provision Percentage 20%; Credit Tolerance 5%;

        Provision Calc Base LC.AMT; Liability Amount 105,000;

        Provision Amount = (100,000 * 20%/100)

                                                                = 20,000.

        Example 2

        LC Amount 100,000; Provision Percentage 20%; Credit Tolerance 5%;

        Provision Calc Base LIABILITY.AMT; Liability Amount 105,000;

        Provision Amount = (105,000 * 20%/100)

                                    = 21,000.

        Validation Rules:

        Valid options are LC.AMT and LIABILITY.AMT.

        Allowed only for LC's with provision.

        Defaulted from PROV.CALC.BASE field in LC.PARAMETERS. Defaulted value can be amended by the user.

        No change field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvCalcBase

        public void setProvCalcBase(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProvCalcBase
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description:

        Determines whether provision has to be calculated on LC face value or liability amount. For example,

        Example 1

        LC Amount 100,000; Provision Percentage 20%; Credit Tolerance 5%;

        Provision Calc Base LC.AMT; Liability Amount 105,000;

        Provision Amount = (100,000 * 20%/100)

                                                                = 20,000.

        Example 2

        LC Amount 100,000; Provision Percentage 20%; Credit Tolerance 5%;

        Provision Calc Base LIABILITY.AMT; Liability Amount 105,000;

        Provision Amount = (105,000 * 20%/100)

                                    = 21,000.

        Validation Rules:

        Valid options are LC.AMT and LIABILITY.AMT.

        Allowed only for LC's with provision.

        Defaulted from PROV.CALC.BASE field in LC.PARAMETERS. Defaulted value can be amended by the user.

        No change field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvExchRate

        public void setProvExchRate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProvExchRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ. Default is the mid rate of LC.MARKET.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvExchRate

        public void setProvExchRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProvExchRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ. Default is the mid rate of LC.MARKET.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisAcc

        public void setProvisAcc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProvisAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to determine the account from which the provision should be debited when such a transaction is deemed to require provision. The account will be re-credited when either a Sight Drawing is processed or on maturity of an acceptance Drawing by default. However, user can define a different account in DRAWINGS so that the provision amount is released into that account. For release of provision, this shall be the credit account and no change will be allowed. Validation Rules: Field PROVISION must be set to 'YES'. The account can be any account including a nostro or an internal account. If the account is not an account of the opener an override will be raised to alert the user.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisAcc

        public void setProvisAcc(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProvisAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to determine the account from which the provision should be debited when such a transaction is deemed to require provision. The account will be re-credited when either a Sight Drawing is processed or on maturity of an acceptance Drawing by default. However, user can define a different account in DRAWINGS so that the provision amount is released into that account. For release of provision, this shall be the credit account and no change will be allowed. Validation Rules: Field PROVISION must be set to 'YES'. The account can be any account including a nostro or an internal account. If the account is not an account of the opener an override will be raised to alert the user.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisAmount

        public void setProvisAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProvisAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to register any changes in the amount of provision held, as displayed in field <PRO.OUT.AMOUNT> and can be either System Generated or User Input. As this field is also used for Partial Confirmation, when a value is input in the field <CONFIRMATION.AMT> the provision is taken only on that value. By inputting a percentage in the field <PROVIS.PERCENT> the system will automatically calculate a new Provision Amount based on the L/c amount, provision percentage, provision exchange rate and the provision debit account.. Alternatively the user can input an amount directly to indicate an increase in provision. A minus (-) sign inserted before the amount indicating a reduction in the provision amount. The amount is stored in the currency of the provision credit account. Validation Rules: If an amount is input then the PROVIS.PERCENTAGE will be ignored and the amount entered will override the calculated %amount. For mixed payment LCs the amount entered in this field will be split according to the DRAW.TYPE percentage given in the multivalue set. The amount here will be converted to LC.CURRENCY and the Limit will be hit for an amount LIABILITY minus provision amount, initially when the LC is input.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisAmount

        public void setProvisAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProvisAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to register any changes in the amount of provision held, as displayed in field <PRO.OUT.AMOUNT> and can be either System Generated or User Input. As this field is also used for Partial Confirmation, when a value is input in the field <CONFIRMATION.AMT> the provision is taken only on that value. By inputting a percentage in the field <PROVIS.PERCENT> the system will automatically calculate a new Provision Amount based on the L/c amount, provision percentage, provision exchange rate and the provision debit account.. Alternatively the user can input an amount directly to indicate an increase in provision. A minus (-) sign inserted before the amount indicating a reduction in the provision amount. The amount is stored in the currency of the provision credit account. Validation Rules: If an amount is input then the PROVIS.PERCENTAGE will be ignored and the amount entered will override the calculated %amount. For mixed payment LCs the amount entered in this field will be split according to the DRAW.TYPE percentage given in the multivalue set. The amount here will be converted to LC.CURRENCY and the Limit will be hit for an amount LIABILITY minus provision amount, initially when the LC is input.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisPercent

        public void setProvisPercent(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProvisPercent
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field details the provision percentage to be used to calculate the provision amount. Input into this field is only permitted if the field <PROVIS.AMOUNT> is left blank. They cannot co-exist. However, as this field is also used for Partial Confirmation, whenever a value is input in the <CONFIRMATION.AMT> and the provision is calculated only on that value.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisPercent

        public void setProvisPercent(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ProvisPercent
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field details the provision percentage to be used to calculate the provision amount. Input into this field is only permitted if the field <PROVIS.AMOUNT> is left blank. They cannot co-exist. However, as this field is also used for Partial Confirmation, whenever a value is input in the <CONFIRMATION.AMT> and the provision is calculated only on that value.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvision

        public void setProvision(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Provision
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field turns on the Provision processing for import Letters of Credit and export confirmed LCs.. When this field is set to 'YES' , an account/percentage provision can be entered. The system will then calculate (using the percentage entered) a provision amount, which will be passed to the Provision.amount field. This amount is in the currency of the provision account. Provision processing is also known as Margin processing. For a customer with a standard provision account and percentage you can set-up the LC.CUSTOMER.CONDITION file with the defaults for the provision account/percentage by Letter of Credit type. Note : Throughout the Trade Finance module this processing will be referenced as Provision processing. Validation Rules: Default is 'NO'.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvision

        public void setProvision(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Provision
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field turns on the Provision processing for import Letters of Credit and export confirmed LCs.. When this field is set to 'YES' , an account/percentage provision can be entered. The system will then calculate (using the percentage entered) a provision amount, which will be passed to the Provision.amount field. This amount is in the currency of the provision account. Provision processing is also known as Margin processing. For a customer with a standard provision account and percentage you can set-up the LC.CUSTOMER.CONDITION file with the defaults for the provision account/percentage by Letter of Credit type. Note : Throughout the Trade Finance module this processing will be referenced as Provision processing. Validation Rules: Default is 'NO'.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisionRate

        public void setProvisionRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ProvisionRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field This field displays the mid rate between the LC CURRENCY and the PROVISION CREDIT ACCOUNT CURRENCY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisionRate

        public void setProvisionRate(TField value)

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field This field displays the mid rate between the LC CURRENCY and the PROVISION CREDIT ACCOUNT CURRENCY.

      • setPurpOfMsg

        public void setPurpOfMsg(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PurpOfMsg
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the purpose of MT707 amendment message. For Export LC with advice through bank i.e. field ADVISE.THRU inputted in the MT700 LC contract, then valid code ADVI OR ACNF will be a mandatory input. For Import LC valid code ISSU will be a mandatory input. At least one optional field needs to be present after the tag 22A, for the swift message MT707 to be construed. Permitted Codes are: ACNF - Advice and confirmation of the credit amendment ADVI - Advice of the credit amendment ISSU - Issuance of the credit amendment Validation Rules: Mandatory Input when Operation is set to A and AMENDMENT.DEL is YES. ISSU - Valid input for Import LC. ADVI and ACNF - Valid input for Export LC. Error message will be generated if No optional field inputted after the tag 22A.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPurpOfMsg

        public void setPurpOfMsg(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PurpOfMsg
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field specifies the purpose of MT707 amendment message. For Export LC with advice through bank i.e. field ADVISE.THRU inputted in the MT700 LC contract, then valid code ADVI OR ACNF will be a mandatory input. For Import LC valid code ISSU will be a mandatory input. At least one optional field needs to be present after the tag 22A, for the swift message MT707 to be construed. Permitted Codes are: ACNF - Advice and confirmation of the credit amendment ADVI - Advice of the credit amendment ISSU - Issuance of the credit amendment Validation Rules: Mandatory Input when Operation is set to A and AMENDMENT.DEL is YES. ISSU - Valid input for Import LC. ADVI and ACNF - Valid input for Export LC. Error message will be generated if No optional field inputted after the tag 22A.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setReimbBkChgs

        public void setReimbBkChgs(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ReimbBkChgs
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field allows to specify by which party the reimbursing bank's charges are to be borne. The absence of this field implies that charges will be borne by the Sender of this message. The value present in this field is populated in Tag 71A of MT740. Validation Rules: Valid inputs are OUR or CLM.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setReimbNarrative

        public void setReimbNarrative(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified ReimbNarrative to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field allows to input amendments of a reimbursement (Narrative of MT747) that has been included in the message. The value present in this field is populated in Tag 77 of MT747. Validation Rules: Up to 20 lines of 35 characters. Accept Z (Alphanumeric) characters when a MT747 is generated.

        Parameters:
        param - the ReimbNarrative to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setReimburseFrom

        public void setReimburseFrom(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ReimburseFrom
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field displays a code to identify from whom reimbursement will be received from under the letter of credit. Valid codes are: O(pener) - T(hird Party Bank (Reimbursing bank)) or W(aiting for further instructions) Validation Rules: 'O', 'T', or 'W'. If 'T' is specified then THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO or THIRD.PARTY must be entered.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setReimburseFrom

        public void setReimburseFrom(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ReimburseFrom
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field displays a code to identify from whom reimbursement will be received from under the letter of credit. Valid codes are: O(pener) - T(hird Party Bank (Reimbursing bank)) or W(aiting for further instructions) Validation Rules: 'O', 'T', or 'W'. If 'T' is specified then THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO or THIRD.PARTY must be entered.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRelProvis

        public void setRelProvis(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for RelProvis
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This Field is used to release the outstanding provision amount. The release will be done on line. The provision credit account will be debited for the outstanding amount and the provision debit account will be credited in this operation. This cannot be set to Y when no provision amount is outstanding in the credit account. When set to Y, no other amendment to the amount etc are allowed. When releasing provision, PROV.EXCH.RATE will act as provision release exchange rate. LC will not be allowed to be reversed unless the outstanding provision amount is released through operation REL.PROVIS equal to Y.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRelProvis

        public void setRelProvis(TField value)
        Set the specified value for RelProvis
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This Field is used to release the outstanding provision amount. The release will be done on line. The provision credit account will be debited for the outstanding amount and the provision debit account will be credited in this operation. This cannot be set to Y when no provision amount is outstanding in the credit account. When set to Y, no other amendment to the amount etc are allowed. When releasing provision, PROV.EXCH.RATE will act as provision release exchange rate. LC will not be allowed to be reversed unless the outstanding provision amount is released through operation REL.PROVIS equal to Y.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

See the BACK.TO.BACK field for further information. Validation Rules: 16 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. This is a NO INPUT field.

      • setReqConfBnk

        public void setReqConfBnk(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ReqConfBnk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the bank which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation or may add its confirmation to the documentary credit. It contains the mnemonic or customer number of the requested confirming bank. Validation Rules: Allowed characters for the ID (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). The customer code must exist on the CUSTOMER file. Input in this field is allowed only if the values in the field CONFIRM.INST is CONFIRM or MAY ADD. Either REQ.CONF.BNK or REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME is mandatory. If REQ.CONF.BNK is input, then, upon validation, the name and address of the confirming bank is to be defaulted into the REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME field. The name and address is defaulted from the CUSTOMER record.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setReqConfBnk

        public void setReqConfBnk(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ReqConfBnk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the bank which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation or may add its confirmation to the documentary credit. It contains the mnemonic or customer number of the requested confirming bank. Validation Rules: Allowed characters for the ID (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). The customer code must exist on the CUSTOMER file. Input in this field is allowed only if the values in the field CONFIRM.INST is CONFIRM or MAY ADD. Either REQ.CONF.BNK or REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME is mandatory. If REQ.CONF.BNK is input, then, upon validation, the name and address of the confirming bank is to be defaulted into the REQ.CONF.BNK.NAME field. The name and address is defaulted from the CUSTOMER record.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing
