      • setReturnComm

        public void setReturnComm(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ReturnComm
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Determines whether the excess commission amount calculated on account of principal decrease is to be returned to the customer or not. Acceptable values are YES or No. Value gets defaulted from LC.PARAMETERS which can be amended by the user.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setReturnComm

        public void setReturnComm(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ReturnComm
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Determines whether the excess commission amount calculated on account of principal decrease is to be returned to the customer or not. Acceptable values are YES or No. Value gets defaulted from LC.PARAMETERS which can be amended by the user.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevocable

        public void setRevocable(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Revocable
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether the letter of credit is Revocable or Irrevocable. Post swift 2018 revision, this field is always set to Irrevocable. When a LC is issued this field should always be set to 'NO' such that the swift tag 40A is updated with one of the following values under MT700 / MT705 / MT710 / MT720: IRREVOCABLE, IRREVOCABLE TRANSFERABLE, IRREVOCABLE STANDBY and IRREVOC TRANS STANDBY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevocable

        public void setRevocable(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Revocable
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to indicate whether the letter of credit is Revocable or Irrevocable. Post swift 2018 revision, this field is always set to Irrevocable. When a LC is issued this field should always be set to 'NO' such that the swift tag 40A is updated with one of the following values under MT700 / MT705 / MT710 / MT720: IRREVOCABLE, IRREVOCABLE TRANSFERABLE, IRREVOCABLE STANDBY and IRREVOC TRANS STANDBY.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevolvingFqy

        public void setRevolvingFqy(TField value)
        Set the specified value for RevolvingFqy
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the frequency at which the letter of credit is to revolve. Examples: Input of 'WEEK3' indicates that the letter of credit needs to be revolved every three weeks from the issue date. Input of 'M02' indicates that the letter of credit needs to be revolved every 2 months from the issue date. In the case of export revolving letters of credit which have been transferred, the frequency cannot be changed by amendment. Validation Rules: Mandatory for all revolving letters of credit.. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevolvingFqy

        public void setRevolvingFqy(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for RevolvingFqy
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the frequency at which the letter of credit is to revolve. Examples: Input of 'WEEK3' indicates that the letter of credit needs to be revolved every three weeks from the issue date. Input of 'M02' indicates that the letter of credit needs to be revolved every 2 months from the issue date. In the case of export revolving letters of credit which have been transferred, the frequency cannot be changed by amendment. Validation Rules: Mandatory for all revolving letters of credit.. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevolvingType

        public void setRevolvingType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for RevolvingType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Input in this field is applicable only for Revolving Letters of Credit. This field is used to identify the type of Revolving Letter of Credit applicable. Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative. T24 fully support the internationally recognized understanding of cumulative and non-cumulative revolving letters of credit. Example: A revolving letter of credit is issued for $10,000 revolving on the 15th day of every month with 3 revolutions. An initial drawing of $6000 is made and no further drawings were made by the 15th of the month (i.e. the time the first revolution is set to take place). For a Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the unutilized amount of $4000 will be carried over by the system to the next revolution period. i.e. the system will provide for the first revolution to be drawn for an increased amount of $14,000 (being $10,000 + $4000) For a Non-Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the untilled portion of $4000 is now unavailable for drawing and the system will provide for the fist revolution to be drawn for $10000 only.. Validation Rules: Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative. Default will be null, which indicates that the letter of credit is not revolving.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRevolvingType

        public void setRevolvingType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for RevolvingType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Input in this field is applicable only for Revolving Letters of Credit. This field is used to identify the type of Revolving Letter of Credit applicable. Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative. T24 fully support the internationally recognized understanding of cumulative and non-cumulative revolving letters of credit. Example: A revolving letter of credit is issued for $10,000 revolving on the 15th day of every month with 3 revolutions. An initial drawing of $6000 is made and no further drawings were made by the 15th of the month (i.e. the time the first revolution is set to take place). For a Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the unutilized amount of $4000 will be carried over by the system to the next revolution period. i.e. the system will provide for the first revolution to be drawn for an increased amount of $14,000 (being $10,000 + $4000) For a Non-Cumulative letter of credit, on the 15th, the untilled portion of $4000 is now unavailable for drawing and the system will provide for the fist revolution to be drawn for $10000 only.. Validation Rules: Options available are (CM) Cumulative or (NC) Non-Cumulative. Default will be null, which indicates that the letter of credit is not revolving.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRiskParty

        public void setRiskParty(TField value)
        Set the specified value for RiskParty
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field indicates a liability number to be used instead of that of the Issuing Bank's. However, it defaults to the Issuing Bank. This may be entered at any time until DRAWINGS are made under that Letter of Credit. Normally, once the Export LETTER.OF.CREDIT is established, the amounts are applied against the limits of the Issuing Bank taking the value from ISSUING.BANK.NO. In cases where the Reimbursing bank is not the Issuing bank, functionally, setting up the limit against the Issuing Bank may not be required but the contract has to reduce the limit of the Reimbursing Bank/Guaranteeing Bank/Confirming Bank. If input at the time of opening the Letter of Credit, then the limits are set against the Reimbursing Bank. But if it is done as an amendment, then the limit usage of the Issuing Bank is reversed and the amount applied against the Reimbursing Bank. This also generates two APP entries for CRF to reverse the old entry and set up the new one. The contents of this field are used to indicate the liability and Consolidated Reporting (CRF). Replaces the value in the CON.CUS.LINK field, because of which, in an Export Letter of Credit, all the delivery messages, which were hitherto being sent to Issuing Bank, which had defaulted to the CON.CUS.LINK, will now be addressed to the value in this field. Therefore this would warrant a review of mapping of fields in relation to the Delivery messages. Validation Rules: Default value is Issuing Bank Customer Number. Must be a valid Customer number or Mnemonic. This field cannot be changed when a Drawing exists under the LC. Input allowed only for Export LC.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setRiskParty

        public void setRiskParty(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for RiskParty
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field indicates a liability number to be used instead of that of the Issuing Bank's. However, it defaults to the Issuing Bank. This may be entered at any time until DRAWINGS are made under that Letter of Credit. Normally, once the Export LETTER.OF.CREDIT is established, the amounts are applied against the limits of the Issuing Bank taking the value from ISSUING.BANK.NO. In cases where the Reimbursing bank is not the Issuing bank, functionally, setting up the limit against the Issuing Bank may not be required but the contract has to reduce the limit of the Reimbursing Bank/Guaranteeing Bank/Confirming Bank. If input at the time of opening the Letter of Credit, then the limits are set against the Reimbursing Bank. But if it is done as an amendment, then the limit usage of the Issuing Bank is reversed and the amount applied against the Reimbursing Bank. This also generates two APP entries for CRF to reverse the old entry and set up the new one. The contents of this field are used to indicate the liability and Consolidated Reporting (CRF). Replaces the value in the CON.CUS.LINK field, because of which, in an Export Letter of Credit, all the delivery messages, which were hitherto being sent to Issuing Bank, which had defaulted to the CON.CUS.LINK, will now be addressed to the value in this field. Therefore this would warrant a review of mapping of fields in relation to the Delivery messages. Validation Rules: Default value is Issuing Bank Customer Number. Must be a valid Customer number or Mnemonic. This field cannot be changed when a Drawing exists under the LC. Input allowed only for Export LC.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        nothing

      • setSendMt740

        public void setSendMt740(TField value)
        Set the specified value for SendMt740
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description:

        Decides whether MT740 needs to be sent at LC issuance or Drawings stage. If MT740 is not sent at LC level, MT740 will be sent at Drawings level on the acceptance date.

        If MT740 was not sent at LC level, then MT747 will not be triggered at LC amendment stage.

        Validation Rules:

        Field options are YES or NO.

        Default value is 'YES'.

        Allowed only for Import LC's.

        Allowed only when THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO is specified.

        Must be 'YES' for Sight or Mixed LC's.

        Override message "MT740 message will be sent from Drawings" is generated when value is set to 'NO'.

        No change field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setSendMt740

        public void setSendMt740(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for SendMt740
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description:

        Decides whether MT740 needs to be sent at LC issuance or Drawings stage. If MT740 is not sent at LC level, MT740 will be sent at Drawings level on the acceptance date.

        If MT740 was not sent at LC level, then MT747 will not be triggered at LC amendment stage.

        Validation Rules:

        Field options are YES or NO.

        Default value is 'YES'.

        Allowed only for Import LC's.

        Allowed only when THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO is specified.

        Must be 'YES' for Sight or Mixed LC's.

        Override message "MT740 message will be sent from Drawings" is generated when value is set to 'NO'.

        No change field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setShipDespatch

        public void setShipDespatch(java.lang.CharSequence value)

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this field stipulates the place of dispatch or taking in charge of the goods or loading on board for shipments made under the LC. Validation Rules: Marked to Tag 44A. One line of 65 characters for SWIFT.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setStmtEntryNo

        public void setStmtEntryNo(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified StmtEntryNo to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: System maintained field. This field displays either a statement entry number or a category entry number depending on the value contained in the corresponding multivalue fields of the contract. Note : The only statement and category entries raised on this deal will relate to charge entries. All other entries are CRF contingent entries.

        Parameters:
        param - the StmtEntryNo to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTenor

        public void setTenor(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Tenor
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections only. It is used in conjunction with the following field 'DAYS' or 'COLL.MAT.CODE' to indicate the TENOR of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding Collection messages. Only the descriptive text is input in this field. eg. To input a draft of '120 days from the bill of lading date', the words 'days from the bill of lading date' would be inserted in this field or this can be chosen from the dropdown options under the field COLL.MAT.CODE. The actual number of days i.e. '120' would be inserted in the field 'DAYS'. System allows input either under TENOR or COLL.MAT.CODE. Value under any one of the fields is mandatory under a usance collection. Validation Rules: 35 S (Uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. For usance collection, free format text. Defaults to "at Sight".

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTenor

        public void setTenor(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Tenor
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections only. It is used in conjunction with the following field 'DAYS' or 'COLL.MAT.CODE' to indicate the TENOR of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding Collection messages. Only the descriptive text is input in this field. eg. To input a draft of '120 days from the bill of lading date', the words 'days from the bill of lading date' would be inserted in this field or this can be chosen from the dropdown options under the field COLL.MAT.CODE. The actual number of days i.e. '120' would be inserted in the field 'DAYS'. System allows input either under TENOR or COLL.MAT.CODE. Value under any one of the fields is mandatory under a usance collection. Validation Rules: 35 S (Uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. For usance collection, free format text. Defaults to "at Sight".

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setThirdParty

        public void setThirdParty(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified ThirdParty to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input. For letters of credit, this field identifies the reimbursing third party bank, through whom reimbursement will be made to the negotiating bank, if this is not a customer of the bank. For collection this field is used to identify the Name & Address of the Account with Bank. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer file), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO is set.

        Parameters:
        param - the ThirdParty to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setThirdParty

        public void setThirdParty(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified ThirdParty to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input. For letters of credit, this field identifies the reimbursing third party bank, through whom reimbursement will be made to the negotiating bank, if this is not a customer of the bank. For collection this field is used to identify the Name & Address of the Account with Bank. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer file), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank. Validation Rules: 4 lines of 35 type A (Alphanumeric) characters. No input allowed if THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO is set.

        Parameters:
        param - the ThirdParty to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setThirdPartyAcc

        public void setThirdPartyAcc(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ThirdPartyAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input, this field defines the account to be used when payment to or payment from the third party reimbursement bank is to be made. The account entered in this field will be used as the default payment to or reimbursement from account for this Letter of credit. For Export LCs, this account will be used for claiming funds from the reimbursement bank. For Import LCs, this account will be used to pay funds to the reimbursement bank. Validation Rules: Standard account format. Must be a valid account that belongs to the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setThirdPartyAcc

        public void setThirdPartyAcc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ThirdPartyAcc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Optional input, this field defines the account to be used when payment to or payment from the third party reimbursement bank is to be made. The account entered in this field will be used as the default payment to or reimbursement from account for this Letter of credit. For Export LCs, this account will be used for claiming funds from the reimbursement bank. For Import LCs, this account will be used to pay funds to the reimbursement bank. Validation Rules: Standard account format. Must be a valid account that belongs to the THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setThirdPartyCustno

        public void setThirdPartyCustno(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ThirdPartyCustno
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letter of credit this field identifies the Reimbursing bank. For Collections this file identifies the Account with bank This field is optional. LETTER OF CREDIT This THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO must be a customer of the bank and identifies the reimbursing third party bank through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. For import letters of credit this will identify where funds are to be remitted whenever payments are made. For export letters of credit this will identify where funds are to be received from whenever reimbursement is required after effecting payment to the beneficiary. If this field is not set then the default channel of payment and reimbursement is from the Opening Bank to the Negotiating Bank. COLLECTION For a collection this is the account with bank field used when ordering party requests that the beneficiary be paid at a bank other than the receive bank. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). For Import LCs must not be the same as the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO or the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO. For Export LCs must not be the same as the ISSUING.BANK.NO or the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setThirdPartyCustno

        public void setThirdPartyCustno(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ThirdPartyCustno
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: For Letter of credit this field identifies the Reimbursing bank. For Collections this file identifies the Account with bank This field is optional. LETTER OF CREDIT This THIRD.PARTY.CUSTNO must be a customer of the bank and identifies the reimbursing third party bank through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. For import letters of credit this will identify where funds are to be remitted whenever payments are made. For export letters of credit this will identify where funds are to be received from whenever reimbursement is required after effecting payment to the beneficiary. If this field is not set then the default channel of payment and reimbursement is from the Opening Bank to the Negotiating Bank. COLLECTION For a collection this is the account with bank field used when ordering party requests that the beneficiary be paid at a bank other than the receive bank. Validation Rules: 10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha or '.'). For Import LCs must not be the same as the ADVISING.BK.CUSTNO or the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO. For Export LCs must not be the same as the ISSUING.BANK.NO or the ADVISE.THRU.CUSTNO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTotPendMvmt

        public void setTotPendMvmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TotPendMvmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the total amount from all pending amendments for the LC. Validation Rules:

        (1) System maintained field.

        (2) The value in this field will reflect the net principal(LC.AMOUNT) movements inclusive of tolerance done through LC.AMENDMENTS for which decision is pending.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTrReimbAddr

        public void setTrReimbAddr(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified TrReimbAddr to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is currently not in use.

        Parameters:
        param - the TrReimbAddr to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTracerDate

        public void setTracerDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TracerDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Accepts Standard date format. Holds the date on which a tracer message will be sent. Once input and authorized, this will produce an EB.FREE.MESSAGE record which will contain relevant details of the particular transaction and the date on which the Tracer message has to be sent. Further tracers may be sent on an automatic cycle which can be specified in TRACER.DAYS. The EB.ACTIVITY which will be triggered is defined in the application LCs Company record in EB.FREE.PARAMETERS. If this is not defined then no message will be sent. Validation Rules: : A valid date, which is not less than Today. Input allowed only when Operation is O, T or A .

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTracerDate

        public void setTracerDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TracerDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Accepts Standard date format. Holds the date on which a tracer message will be sent. Once input and authorized, this will produce an EB.FREE.MESSAGE record which will contain relevant details of the particular transaction and the date on which the Tracer message has to be sent. Further tracers may be sent on an automatic cycle which can be specified in TRACER.DAYS. The EB.ACTIVITY which will be triggered is defined in the application LCs Company record in EB.FREE.PARAMETERS. If this is not defined then no message will be sent. Validation Rules: : A valid date, which is not less than Today. Input allowed only when Operation is O, T or A .

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTracerDays

        public void setTracerDays(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TracerDays
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Accepts valid number of days. The days mentioned here get defaulted in the respective EB.FREE.MESSAGE record. During the EOD process, the tracer date is cycled so as to produce the tracer message again after the above said number of days. If the days are not entered, it is either defaulted from the COUNTRY file or from the EB.FREE.PARAMETERS file for that Application. E.g. : +1W or 20W or +9W etc. Validation Rules: Accepts valid days format - +NW or NNW where N stands for Number of days and W stands for Working days.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTracerDays

        public void setTracerDays(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TracerDays
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Accepts valid number of days. The days mentioned here get defaulted in the respective EB.FREE.MESSAGE record. During the EOD process, the tracer date is cycled so as to produce the tracer message again after the above said number of days. If the days are not entered, it is either defaulted from the COUNTRY file or from the EB.FREE.PARAMETERS file for that Application. E.g. : +1W or 20W or +9W etc. Validation Rules: Accepts valid days format - +NW or NNW where N stands for Number of days and W stands for Working days.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTransShipCode

        public void setTransShipCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TransShipCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC. Transhipment is used in the production of documents and advices to specify whether transhipments are allowed or not under the terms and conditions of the Letter of Credit. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes Allowed codes are ALLOWED - Allowed under the documentary credit. CONDITIONAL - Conditional based on conditions specified elsewhere in the message. NOT ALLOWED - Not allowed under the documentary credit. Override generated to alert the user to specify the condition when the code chosen is CONDITIONAL.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTransShipCode

        public void setTransShipCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TransShipCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC. Transhipment is used in the production of documents and advices to specify whether transhipments are allowed or not under the terms and conditions of the Letter of Credit. This field to hold one of the allowed swift codes Allowed codes are ALLOWED - Allowed under the documentary credit. CONDITIONAL - Conditional based on conditions specified elsewhere in the message. NOT ALLOWED - Not allowed under the documentary credit. Override generated to alert the user to specify the condition when the code chosen is CONDITIONAL.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTransshipments

        public void setTransshipments(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Transshipments
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC. Transhipments is used in the production of documents and advices to specify whether transhipments are allowed under the terms and conditions of the Letter of Credit. Validation Rules: 'Y' - Transhipments Permitted or 'N' -Transhipments not permitted. Default is 'N'. Also permits a maximum of 35 characters. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTransshipments

Validation Rules: 'Y' - Transhipments Permitted or 'N' -Transhipments not permitted. Default is 'N'. Also permits a maximum of 35 characters. Field not used if SWIFT standards are updated as per 2018 revision.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTrustRel

        public void setTrustRel(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TrustRel
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is activated for Import Collections. The values accepted are RELEASE,ACCEPT and REJECT and can also be left blank. On opening of a LC the valid value accepted in this field is RELEASE. This denotes that the documents have been accepted under TRUST. The user can accept or reject the documents at a later stage and accordingly update the TRUST.REL field. Whenever documents are accepted under trust, the system will hit the trust limit set up in LIMIT.PARAMETER. Also instead of the normal COLL contingent entry, system will create a contingent entry with TRCOLL. Subsequently when the documents are accepted, the previous limit and contingent entries will be reversed and the normal collection limit and contingent entry will be created. When the documents are rejected, the previous limits and contingent entries will be reversed out and the LC liability will become zero. When this field is kept as null, the system processes like a normal collection. The valid sequences allowed are: RELEASE REJECT RELEASE ACCEPT If a document has been released under trust and it is neither accepted nor rejected before the expiry date, the system will expire the LC and will update this field as EXPIRED. No drawings are allowed in the system unless the documents released under trust are accepted.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTrustRel

        public void setTrustRel(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TrustRel
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is activated for Import Collections. The values accepted are RELEASE,ACCEPT and REJECT and can also be left blank. On opening of a LC the valid value accepted in this field is RELEASE. This denotes that the documents have been accepted under TRUST. The user can accept or reject the documents at a later stage and accordingly update the TRUST.REL field. Whenever documents are accepted under trust, the system will hit the trust limit set up in LIMIT.PARAMETER. Also instead of the normal COLL contingent entry, system will create a contingent entry with TRCOLL. Subsequently when the documents are accepted, the previous limit and contingent entries will be reversed and the normal collection limit and contingent entry will be created. When the documents are rejected, the previous limits and contingent entries will be reversed out and the LC liability will become zero. When this field is kept as null, the system processes like a normal collection. The valid sequences allowed are: RELEASE REJECT RELEASE ACCEPT If a document has been released under trust and it is neither accepted nor rejected before the expiry date, the system will expire the LC and will update this field as EXPIRED. No drawings are allowed in the system unless the documents released under trust are accepted.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setUcpInd

        public void setUcpInd(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for UcpInd
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to define whether the letter of credit is subject to the Uniform Customs and Practices or not. If 'Y' is input then this LC is subject to the Uniform Customs and Practices Rules, otherwise it is not. Validation Rules: 'Y' or 'N'. Default 'Y'.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setUcpInd

        public void setUcpInd(TField value)

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to define whether the letter of credit is subject to the Uniform Customs and Practices or not. If 'Y' is input then this LC is subject to the Uniform Customs and Practices Rules, otherwise it is not. Validation Rules: 'Y' or 'N'. Default 'Y'.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setUnconfLiabAmt

        public void setUnconfLiabAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for UnconfLiabAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: UNCONF.LIAB.AMT: Identifies the total unconfirmed liability amount in respect of partially confirmed Letters of Credit. This is used as a running total of the remaining unconfirmed liability amount, after drawings have been made under this Letter of Credit. The amount will be expressed in terms of LC currency. This field will be calculated by the system as the difference between LIABILITY.AMT and CONF.LIAB.AMT. No operator input will be allowed. Validation Rules: System Generated Standard amount format

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setUnconfLiabAmt

        public void setUnconfLiabAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for UnconfLiabAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: UNCONF.LIAB.AMT: Identifies the total unconfirmed liability amount in respect of partially confirmed Letters of Credit. This is used as a running total of the remaining unconfirmed liability amount, after drawings have been made under this Letter of Credit. The amount will be expressed in terms of LC currency. This field will be calculated by the system as the difference between LIABILITY.AMT and CONF.LIAB.AMT. No operator input will be allowed. Validation Rules: System Generated Standard amount format

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setUnconfLimitRef

        public void setUnconfLimitRef(TField value)
        Set the specified value for UnconfLimitRef
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: UNCONF.LIMIT.REF: In a partially confirmed Letter of Credit, the user may prefer to assign a valid LIMIT.REFERENCE number for the unconfirmed portion. The value into this field enables to update the limit accordingly. If left blank, the information limit line is defaulted from the LIMIT.PARAMETER. Validation Rules: Input to this field must be a valid LIMIT.REFERENCE number.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setUnconfLimitRef

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

      • setWaiveCharges

        public void setWaiveCharges(TField value)
        Set the specified value for WaiveCharges
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field indicates whether Letters of Credit/Documentary Collection default charges are to be waived. If this field is set to 'Y' then all charges relating to this LC will be waived, i.e. no default charges will be added. Validation Rules: Options available are - Y(es) or N(o).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing
